32013  1 2 21113 article 4  flight hazard areas recitals whereas the city of syracuse has heretofore established and is now operating and maintaining a public airport located in the towns of dewitt cicero clay and salina onondaga county new york pursuant to the provisions of of the general municipal law of the state of new york which airport has been and is now designated as clarence e hancock airport and has acquired title to and easements in lands located in said towns as laid out and established on an amended master plan of clarence e hancock airport syracuse new york dated  approved by the commissioner of aviation under date of  approved by the federal aviation agency on  filed with the city clerk on  and in the offices of the town clerks of the said towns of dewitt cicero clay and salina at least ten 10 days prior to the adoption thereof by the common council of the city of syracuse in accordance with the provision of section 352a of the general municipal law of the state of new york and which amended master plan was thereafter duly adopted by ordinance of the common council of the city of syracuse enacted  which master plan showing the location of the boundaries and runways of said clarence e hancock airport is still in full force and effect  and whereas the legislature has authorized the establishment of a flight hazard area for the approach and turning zones which lie within the limits defined by section 355 of the general municipal law or within such greater distance as the federal aviation agency successor to the federal civil aeronautics administration may declare necessary with respect to said airport for the approach and turning zones appurtenant thereto  and whereas said section 355 of the general municipal law defines said flight hazard area as being the approach and turning zones which lie in air space above the lands within three thousand 3000 feet of the perimeter of said airport computed on a gliding angle of one foot in height to every thirty 30 feet of horizontal distance from the nearest point of said airport  and whereas the federal aviation agency has declared the flight hazard area necessary for the safe ascent and descent of aircraft to clarence e hancock airport as that approach and those turning zones which lie in the air space above the lands that extend for a distance of ten thousand 10000 feet at a gliding angle of one foot in height to every fifty 50 feet of horizontal distance computed from a point two hundred 200 feet beyond the end of each runway used for instrument flight operations and one foot in height to every forty 40 feet of horizontal distance computed from said point or points for all other flight operations  and whereas the legislature has declared as a matter of public policy that the creation or establishment of a flight hazard including any structure building tower pole wire tree or other thing or portion thereof located within said flight hazard area is a public nuisance and an injury to the people and community service by such public airport  therefore a flight hazard area is hereby established and determined by the common council for the air space over and surrounding clarence e hancock airport within the limits set forth in section 312 flight hazard area limits prescribed the flight hazard area limits under this article shall be a that air space over clarence e hancock airport and in addition thereto that air space beyond and within three thousand 3000 feet of its perimeter computed at a gliding angle of one foot in height to every thirty 30 feet of horizontal distance from and beyond the nearest point of the perimeter of said airport b that air space over said airport and in addition thereto that air space extending for a distance of ten thousand 10000 feet at a gliding angle of one foot in height to every fifty 50 feet of horizontal distance computed from a point two hundred 200 feet beyond the end of each runway used for instrument flight operations and one foot in height for each forty 40 feet in horizontal distance computed from said point or points for all other flight operations flight hazards declared unsafe any flight hazard including any structure building tower pole wire tree or other thing or portion thereof located within the foregoing flight hazard area as hereinbefore defined and established is hereby determined and declared to constitute a menace to the safety of aircraft using clarence e hancock airport and to the safety of persons and property within said flight hazard area article 5  airport smoking prohibition title this article shall be known as the airport smoking prohibition  gen 1 42400 definitions the following words and phrases whenever used in this article shall be construed as defined in this section air operations area aoa means any area within the perimeter fence barrier unless otherwise specified which however includes at all times aprons taxiways runways and safety area and any area in which an aircraft can maneuver airport structure means any structure owned and operated by the city of syracuse including but not limited to all areas of the terminal building the maintenance facilities the aircraft rescue and firefighting facilities arff and parking garage gen 2 42400 prohibition of smoking a smoking is hereby prohibited in or on the air operations area aoa with no exceptions b smoking is hereby prohibited in or on an airport structure or part thereof with no exception this includes common work areas conference and meeting rooms private offices elevators hallways restaurants cafeterias employee lounges stairs restrooms vehicles and all other enclosed facilities c smoking shall not occur within a distance of fifty 50 feet outside any enclosed area where smoking is prohibited to ensure that tobacco smoke does not enter the area windows ventilation systems or any other means gen 3 42400 violation a violation of section 316a shall be an infraction punishable by a maximum fine of no more than seventyfive dollars $7500 b violation of section 316b and c shall be an infraction punishable by a maximum fine of no more than fifty dollars $5000 gen 4 42400 appendix a to chapter 3 airport rules and regulations of clarence e hancock airport syracuse new york pursuant to the authority vested in me by the provision of local law no 11195 adopted by the common council of the city of syracuse  effective  i frank s pittenger commissioner of aviation of the city of syracuse new york do hereby make and adopt rules and regulations for the control maintenance and protection of clarence e hancock airport and for the conduct of all persons entering upon or using the same article i  definitions whenever used in these rules and regulations the following terms shall have the meanings respectively hereinafter indicated airport airport means the clarence e hancock airport city of syracuse onondaga county new york including all land and improvements owned controlled or operated and maintained by the city of syracuse in connection with its operations of such airport within the boundaries as defined on a master plan of clarence e hancock airport syracuse new york dated  showing projected future developments approved by the commissioner of aviation on  and the common council on  and thereafter modified or amended pursuant to law tower tower means the airport traffic control tower and the personnel who operate its facilities such tower being located on top of the hangar building no 702 and operated by the federal aviation agency personnel commissioner commissioner means the commissioner of aviation or person in actual charge of the airport for the city the first assistant of said commissioner or his representative duly authorized as to the matter involved except as otherwise indicated aircraft aircraft means any and all contrivances capable of use now or in the future for the avigation of or flight in or or space including but not limited to airplanes airships dirigibles helicopters gliders and amphibians airport traffic control zone airport traffic control zone means the airport traffic control zone established or as may be established by the clarence e hancock airport pursuant to the provisions of of the civil air regulations promulgated by the federal aviation agency relating to such establishment ramp and apron areas ramp and apron areas means the areas adjacent to the passenger loading gates at the terminal building or adjacent to the hangars or similar structures designated and made available temporarily or permanently for the loading or unloading of passengers and cargo to and from aircraft and for access to and egress from loading gates hangars or similar structures on the airport landing area landing area means the area of land the runways and taxiways made available temporarily or permanently at the clarence e hancock airport to the public for taxiing landing or taking off of aircraft field area field area means all parts of the airport except areas open to the public at large and the ramp and apron areas local commercial aviation operations local commercial aviation operations means the carrying of one or more persons for hire on a flight where the flight originates and returns to this airport without landing at another airport  and at and from this airport the instruction of a student in aircraft operation and aviation and the renting out of aircraft for a charge cargo cargo means anything transported for hire in an aircraft excepting human beings nonscheduled flight nonscheduled flight means any aircraft flight involving a landing at this airport not made pursuant to a schedule of flights filed by a schedule airline with and approved by the civil aeronautics board charter flight charter flight means a nonscheduled flight to from this airport from or to another location for the transporting for hire of one or more persons or cargo where the pickup location of the same is different from the unloading destination thereof or part thereof ground handler ground handler means any person or persons providing passenger and aircraft services for an aircraft operator including but not limited to aircraft fueling baggage handling aircraft cleaning and maintenance and supplying passenger or cargo ramps gen  article ii  general rules and regulations use of ramp and apron areas no person shall enter upon the ramp and apron areas except a persons assigned to duty thereon b persons authorized by the commissioner of aviation c enplaning and deplaning passengers obstruction of roads ramps taxiways and runways prohibited no person shall occupy the roads walks ramps aprons taxiways or runways in such a manner as to obstruct their proper use conduct of business on airport a no person shall engage in any business or commercial activity within the limits of nor use the airport and its facilities for revenue producing activities of any nature whatsoever without first securing an appropriate permit license contract or express approval in writing as required by the common council and paying the established rates and charges in a manner prescribed or the rates specifically agreed upon by and between the city and such person for such use b every person conducting a business or commercial activity at the airport whether by contract license or permit shall hold the city of syracuse harmless from any and all liability for damages to persons or property resulting from or arising out of the operation or maintenance of such business or commercial activity c upon demand by the city such persons shall secure and maintain in force and effect during all times while such business or commercial activity is being conducted insurance covering injury to persons and property in such reasonable amounts as shall be satisfactory to the city d the commissioner is hereby authorized to collect as a fee a percentage of gross receipts of up to twenty 20 percent from individuals andor corporations conducting a permitted baggage delivery operation at the airport gen  soliciting prohibited editors note was repealed by gen adopted  advertisements prohibited unless approved by the commissioner no person shall post distribute or display signs advertisements handbills circulars printed or written matter at the airport unless authorized by written contract with the city or other specific common council authority dogs no person shall enter the terminal building with a dog or other animals except a seeingeye dog dogs or other animals brought upon any other portion of the airport premises must be restrained by leash or confined in such a manner as to be under control lost articles any person finding lost articles on the airport premises shall deposit them at the office of the airport safety officers such article shall be disposed of in the manner prescribed by law ramp equipmentparking no person shall park or cause to be parked any ramp equipment or aircraft servicing equipment of any kind on the airport except in such areas that may be designated by the commissioner bicycle etc on landing area no person shall ride a bicycle motor scooter motor bike or motorcycle over or upon the landing area of the airport unless permission is first obtained from the commissioner sanitation no person shall deposit or leave any debris garbage paper or any type of waste on the airport except in receptacles provided therefore and any such receptacle furnished by a lessee tenant or concessionaire shall be placed and emptied in accordance with such directives as may be issued by the commissioner all lessees tenants and concessionaires shall furnish suitable receptacles for such purposes on premises on which they operate hauling trash no vehicle used for hauling trash dirt or any other materials shall be operated on the airport unless such vehicles are constructed so as to prevent the contents thereof from dropping sifting leaking or otherwise escaping therefrom areas to be used for trash or garbage containers shall be designated by the commissioner and no other area shall be used such areas shall be kept clean and sanitary at all times additional policing and emergency assistance a the commissioner may at his discretion apply to the sheriff of onondaga county to have any city employee in the department of aviation appointed by the said sheriff as a special deputy sheriff b any airport safety officer may at his discretion call upon the police department of the city of syracuse or any other law enforcement agency having jurisdiction for aid and assistance whenever he deems it necessary or whenever any emergency medical assistance is needed accident reports any person involved in any accident personal aircraft or automotive occurring on the airport shall make as full a report thereof as he is able and of all witnesses thereto to the safety officer on duty or the nearest official of the department of aviation as soon after the accident as possible liability the city shall not be responsible for loss injury or damage to persons or property by reason of fire theft vandalism wind flood earthquake or collision damage  nor does it assume any liability for injury to persons nor for property damage suffered by them while on the airport or while using the facilities of same or for property damage except as otherwise provided by law ordinance or regulation payment of fees and charges a no person shall refuse or attempt to evade payment of any fees or charges as established for use of airport facilities or services all fees and charges are due upon presentation of bill or demand for payment thereof by the commissioner or his duly authorized agent or representative unless otherwise stipulated in writing b no person shall pass by over or under a turnstile coinoperated door or any coinoperated gate designated for vehicles that require the deposit of a coin for such privilege without depositing such coin in such turnstile door or gate disorderly conduct no person shall commit any disorderly obscene or indecent act or use offensive language or commit any nuisance on the airport loitering no person shall loiter or loaf on any part of the airport or in any building on the airport trespass on restricted areas no person shall enter or remain upon any area or in any building or part thereof on the airport not designated as open for public use by the commissioner except when and to the extent and in the manner authorized by him or by a tenant or concessionaire pursuant to authority granted by the commissioner entrances exits no person shall enter or leave the airport or any part thereof other than entrances and exits as are provided therefor damages tenants lessees and grantees shall be fully responsible for all damages to buildings equipment real property and appurtenances in the ownership or custody of the city caused by negligence abuse or carelessness on the part of their employees agents customers visitors suppliers or any other person or persons with whom they may do business lighting facility damages any person damaging any light or fixture by means of contact with aircraft or any type vehicle shall report such damage to the department of aviation office immediately and shall be fully responsible for any costs required to repair or replace the damaged facility structural and decorative changes no tenant lessee or grantee will be permitted to effect structural or decorative changes or additions of any type or any electrical wiring or installation without prior permission of the commissioner in writing the commissioner is hereby authorized to collect a constructionalteration permit fee not to exceed one hundred dollars $10000 from airport tenants desiring to make changes to their leased premises at the airport gen  payment before flight clearance payment for use of airport facilities storage repairs supplies or other services rendered by the airport shall be made before flight clearance will be granted unless satisfactory credit arrangements have been made with the commissioner emergency procedures the commissioner and the chief of fire may prescribe emergency procedures which upon promulgation shall constitute a part of these rules and regulations and shall be effective as a part hereof firearms explosives etc no person except airport safety officers police officers deputy sheriffs post office airport and air carrier employees and members of the armed forces of the united states on official duty shall carry any firearms explosives or inflammable materials on or onto the airport without or in excess of the written permission of the commissioner radio equipment all vehicles operating on the field area must be equipped with at least a functioning radio receiver capable of receiving instructions from the control tower with the following exceptions a emergency vehicles while attending an accident or responding to an emergency alert  b agricultural or maintenance equipment not engaged in work on taxiways and runways proper when authorized to be on other parts of the field areas  and c other vehicles and equipment when and as permitted by the commissioner commissioners general authority a the commissioner shall at all times have authority to take such action as may be necessary to safeguard the people in attendance at or using the airport and to maintain and enforce all of these rules and regulations b in addition to the rules and regulations set forth herein the commissioner is hereby authorized and empowered from time to time 1 to prescribe and promulgate such rules of motor vehicle and aircraft traffic and issue such orders as he may deem necessary in the interest of safety to govern the place manner and time of operating stopping standing parking loading and unloading of aircraft motor vehicles and aircraft servicing equipment and baggage carts and other contrivances on the airport  2 to prescribe and promulgate such aircraft traffic and taxiing patterns and rules governing the operation of the airport and 3 to prescribe and promulgate such other rules and regulations and issue such directives as he shall deem necessary to the efficient and proper operation of the airport and the safety and welfare of persons on or using the airport as shall not be inconsistent with applicable laws regulations or ordinances which patterns rules and regulations when approved by the common council and the board of estimate shall be effective as ordinances in accordance with the provisions of local law no 11195 as amended baggage carriers no person shall remove a baggage carrier or carriers provided by the city of syracuse for transporting baggage from the terminal building at syracuse hancock international airport notwithstanding any fine or penalty provided herein any person guilty of violating this section shall be guilty of an offense and shall be liable to a fine of twentyfive dollars $2500 or to a penalty of twentyfive dollars $2500 to be collected by the city in a civil action gen  article iii  permits gen  12103 department of aviation telephone network at the airport the commissioner shall charge and collect from each tenant at the airport who elects to connect its telephone facilities to the department of aviation telephone network a monthly fee of thirty dollars $3000 per airport dial system telephone line gen  article iv  fire hazards cleaning aircraft no person shall use inflammable liquids in the cleaning of aircraft aircraft engines propellers and appliances unless such cleaning operations are conducted in open air or in a room specifically set aside for the purpose  which room shall be properly ventilated fireproofed and equipped with adequate and readily accessible fire extinguishing apparatus open flame operations no person shall conduct any open flame operation in any hangar located upon the airport unless specifically authorized by contract or by the commissioner storage no person shall store or stock any type of material or equipment on the airport in such a manner as to constitute a fire hazard the determination of what is a fire hazard shall be conclusively made by the fire marshal of the city storage of inflammable material no person shall keep store or discard any inflammable liquids gases or other similar materials in any hangar or other building on the airport provided that such materials may be kept in aircraft in proper receptacles installed in the aircraft for such purposes or in rooms or areas and in the manner approved for such storage by the fire prevention division of the city fire department lubrication oils no person shall keep or store lubrication oils in or about the hangars or other buildings on the airport except in places and in the manner approved by the fire prevention division of the city fire department waste lessees and tenants of hangars shops and other maintenance and repair areas shall provide suitable metal receptacles with selfclosing covers for storage of oily waste rags and other rubbish  all such waste shall be removed from the premises by such lessees and tenants daily or as often as required by the commissioner smoking no person shall smoke in any area on the airport in violation of no smoking signs posted pursuant to order of the commissioner cleaning fluids no person shall use volatile inflammable substances for cleaning floors in hangars or other buildings on the airport floor care all lessees and tenants of the city shall keep the floors of the hangars and other buildings and the apron pits and areas adjacent thereto leased or rented by them respectively free and clear of oil grease rubbish and inflammable materials radio operation no person shall operate any radio equipment in any aircraft when such aircraft is in a hangar on the airport fire extinguishers all tenants and lessees of hangars or shop facilities on the airport shall supply and maintain adequate and readily accessible fire extinguishers in such hangars and shops article v  airport operations faa traffic rules the air traffic rules governing the operation of aircraft on and about an airport as established by the federal aviation agency and currently in effect insofar as applicable to this airport constitute a part hereof as fully as though the same and each and all of them were set forth herein traffic and taxi patterns except upon instructions from the tower no person shall land or taxi any aircraft on or fly the same from the airport in such a manner as to form a taxi or traffic pattern contrary to or in violation of the traffic and taxi patterns promulgated or prescribed by the commissioner pursuant to authority vested in him radio and brakes required no aircraft shall be landed operated on or taken off from the airport unless said aircraft is equipped with brakes that are consistent with safe operation of the aircraft and a functioning twoway radio capable of receiving instructions from the tower for a distance of three 3 miles and unless the pilot of the aircraft has permission from the tower for each such landing or takeoff student flying instructions student flying instructions shall only be given by faa qualified instructors employed by duly authorized fixedbase operator or by prior approval of the commissioner outside storage and repairs no aircraft or motor vehicle shall be stored parked or repaired on the airport except in areas designated by the commissioner for such purposes securing of unattended aircraft no aircraft shall be parked for outside storage on the airport unless same is safely and securely tied down  owners of such aircraft shall be held responsible for any damage resulting from failure to comply with this rule aircraft based at this airportregistration the owner or regular operator of any aircraft based or parked continuously for one week or longer at this airport is required to register such aircraft with the commissioner furnishing the following information 1 the owners name  2 his home and local residence and business addresses  3 his telephone numbers  4 the make and model of said aircraft  5 the federal aviation agency registration number of the aircraft and 6 the name of any such regular operator his local and home residence and business addresses and telephone numbers doubleparking prohibited no person shall park any aircraft on the passenger loading ramps adjacent to the terminal building at the airport in such a manner that there is another aircraft between it and any portion of the terminal building such parking shall constitute double parking on the passenger loading ramp this rule may be waived by the commissioner parking of aircraft a no aircraft shall be parked or tied down except in areas designated for that purpose by the commissioner b no aircraft shall be parked or left standing on any runway or taxiway or in any runway approach zone c no aircraft shall be parked or left standing within seventyfive 75 feet of the edge of any taxiway or within two hundred 200 feet of the edge of any runway on the airport except by permission first obtained from the commissioner commissioner authorized to move aircraft etc should the owner or operator of any aircraft equipment or other contrivance left on the airport or any part thereof in violation of any city ordinance these rules and regulations or any airport field rule or order of the commissioner fail or refuse to move same promptly upon the request of the commissioner or before it interferes with any operation or service of the airport the commissioner may without notice move or cause to be moved such aircraft equipment or other contrivance to some other location on the airport at the owners expense and without liability for damages which may result in the course of such moving to avoid all interference with field operations such removals or disposals of wrecked or damaged aircraft are to be made in accordance with federal and state regulations governing same where no delay is necessary and the owners fail to remove or dispose of the wrecked or damaged aircraft the commissioner may dispose of or remove such aircraft and parts in the most expeditious manner aircraft maintenance on loading ramps no person shall conduct or cause to be conducted any aircraft cleaning maintenance or repair work on the passenger loading ramps adjacent to the terminal building air freight loading air freight and air cargo loading and unloading operations shall be conducted only at places designated by the commissioner time limits in gate area no aircraft shall be parked in the passenger gate area in excess of the time limit established by the commissioner passenger areas it shall be the sole responsibility of the airline operators and fixedbase operators to see that all gate chains gates and doors and other public safeguards on and about the passenger areas are continually and conscientiously used in such a manner as to protect all persons taxiing into and out of hangars prohibited no person shall taxi an aircraft into or out of any hangar on the airport starting or running aircraft engines a no aircraft engine shall be started or run on the airport premises unless a licensed pilot or mechanic shall be attending the controls blocks equipped with ropes or other suitable means of blocking an aircraft shall always be placed in front of the main landing wheels before starting the engine or engines of an aircraft unless such aircraft is equipped with adequate and properly functioning locking brakes which are locked b aircraft engines shall not be run up or warmed up by any person while on any portion of the public ramp and apron area adjacent to the terminal building or in any location on the airport where any hangar shop or other building or person shall be in the aircrafts propeller slipstream or exhaust refusal of clearance the commissioner may delay or restrict any flight or other operations at the airport and may refuse takeoff clearance to any aircraft for any reason he believes justifiable acrobatics prohibited no aircraft shall be flown within the airport traffic zone in maneuvers other than those required in normal routine operation article vi  aircraft fueling and defueling fueling and defueling prohibited while engine is running no aircraft shall be fueled or drained of fuel while the engine is running or while such aircraft is in a hangar or enclosed space smoking prohibited no smoking shall be permitted within fifty 50 feet of any aircraft fuel tank while it is being fueled or drained of fuel grounding of electrical potential required a during refueling and the draining of fuel from an aircraft fuel tank the aircraft and the fuel dispensing or draining apparatus shall both be grounded to a point or points of zero electrical potential b all hoses funnels and appurtenances used in fueling and fuel draining operations shall be equipped with a grounding device to prevent ignition of volatile liquids maintenance of equipment fueling hoses and draining equipment shall be maintained in a safe sound and nonleaking condition distance required from structures all fueling and drainage of aircraft shall be conducted at least fifty 50 feet from any hangar or other building on the airport operating electrical switches prohibited no person shall operate any radio transmitter or receiver or switch an electrical appliance off or on in or on an aircraft during fueling or drainage of fuel from such aircraft spillage of gasoline no person shall deposit or intentionally spill or cause to be deposited or spilled any gasoline oil or any other petroleum product on any ramp or apron area adjacent to any building on the airport only essential personnel permitted only personnel engaged in the fueling maintenance and operation of an aircraft shall be permitted within fifty 50 feet of the fuel tanks of such aircraft during any such operation static spark materials prohibited no person shall use any material or equipment during fueling or drainage of fuel from aircraft which is likely to cause a static discharge adequate fire extinguishers adequate fire extinguishers shall be within ready reach of personnel engaged in fueling and fuel draining operations starting engine prohibited when gasoline is on ground no person shall start the engine of an aircraft when there is gasoline on the ground or paving under such aircraft article vii  motor vehicle traffic and restricted area regulations general no person shall operate any motor vehicle or mobile equipment on the airport otherwise than in accordance with these rules and regulations ramp and apron areas a no person shall operate any motor vehicle or mobile equipment on any apron or ramp area except 1 persons regularly assigned to duty thereon and 2 persons otherwise authorized to do so by the commissioner b no person shall park or cause to be parked any motor vehicle tender truck or other gasolinedispensing equipment on the ramp or apron areas adjacent to the terminal building except when servicing aircraft c when passengers are going aboard or debarking from an aircraft on any of the passengerloading ramps adjacent to the terminal building no person shall drive or operate any motor vehicle or other equipment except baggage tugs on such ramp between such aircraft and the terminals passengerloading gate being used by such passengers landing area a no person shall operate any motor vehicle or mobile equipment on any part of the landing area unless the vehicle or equipment is equipped with a functioning twoway radio maintaining contact with the control tower and he is acquainted with the light signal system used by the tower for control of movements on and approaching the landing area and unless he has obtained prior permission from the control tower which except when prohibited by the commissioner may in specific instances or circumstances waive this twoway radio requirement such person shall at all times while on the landing area maintain a vigilance for and obey radio and light signal instructions from the control tower b no motor vehicle or other equipment shall be parked or left standing on any runway taxiway or within any runwayapproach zone except when and while flight operations at the airport are suspended and then only when and as authorized by the control tower aircraft rightofway over vehicles and equipment aircraft taxiing on any runway or taxiway of the airport shall have the rightofway over vehicular traffic and no overtaking vehicle shall pass any aircraft without first receiving a clearance by radio or a green light signal from the control tower to do so motor vehicles in hangars a no person shall operate any tractor or other motor vehicle in any hangar unless the exhaust on such tractor or other vehicle is equipped with adequate screens or baffles to prevent the escape of sparks and the propagation of flame b no person shall park or store any motor vehicle in any aircraft hangar unless permitted to do so by the commissioner limousines taxicabs etc a no person engaged in the operation of any motor vehicleforhire shall load or unload passengers on the airport except at the place or places and in the manner provided for by city ordinance or as designated by the commissioner from time to time pursuant to provision made by such ordinances and these rules and regulations b no person shall operate any vehicleforhire from or upon the airport unless such operation is pursuant to and in accordance with provision made by city ordinance these rules and regulations or the commissioner from time to time pursuant to and in accordance therewith c all persons operating vehiclesforhire on the airport shall promptly obey the orders of any police officer or deputy sheriff on the airport control of vehicles all motor vehicle and mobile equipment shall be operated under such control by their operators at all timestaking into consideration existing traffic light and road conditions as shall enable the operator by the exercise of reasonable foresight prudence and caution to avoid collision between the vehicle or equipment operated by him with any other moving or stationary object or pedestrian and causing collision between any other moving object with any moving or stationary object or pedestrian driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs no person while in an intoxicated condition or while under the influence of a narcotic drug shall operate a motor vehicle or any mobile equipment on the airport speed limits no person shall operate any motor vehicle or mobile equipment in excess of the following rate of speed a fifteen 15 miles per hour on any ramp or apron area and on the approach drives between the terminal building the public automobile parking lot and the airport entrances and exits on town line road 12th street malden road  b twentyfive 25 miles per hour on any taxiway or runway  c thirty 30 miles per hour on any perimeter or service road  or d six 6 miles per hour on the trucking concourses located in the terminal building and between it and the passenger ramp and apron area adjacent thereto all such areas open to the vehicles of the public at large shall be posted to indicate such maximum speed limits the commissioner may in his discretion and from time to time alter said maximum speed limits and areas and may establish and alter speed limits for other areas roads and passages on the airport  and the establishment thereof when duly promulgated shall have the force and effect of a city ordinance restricted areas all other areas on the airport than those described in section 79 of this article except areas which are leased to lessees under agreement providing for access thereto by persons without the permission of the commissioner are hereby designated as restricted areas  and the parking or operation of a motor vehicle or the entry thereupon by any person is hereby prohibited except on and in accordance with permission first obtained from the commissioner obstruction of roads no person shall obstruct any street road driveway circle or other passageway for the movement of aircraft motor vehicles or mobile equipment on the airport  except when as and for the duration permitted hereby by any city ordinance or by the commissioner a police officers or deputy sheriffs order relative to the moving or except by order of a police officer or deputy sheriff operate a motor vehicle any mobile equipment or bicycle on any street road driveway circle or other passageway on the airport in a direction is hereby authorized to establish and alter from time to time such oneway traffic areas the establishment thereof when duly promulgated to have the force and effect of a city ordinance public parking areas a the commissioner shall establish one parking area on the airport and except as otherwise contracted by the city he may establish such additional number of parking areas thereon as he shall from time to time deem advisable for the efficient and proper operation of the airport for use by the public for the parking of motor vehicles b the commissioner shall determine the location area shape thereof entrances and exits of each such parking area and shall cause to be placed and erected adequate signs guiding traffic to and from the same make and adopt rules and regulations for the use thereof  and with the approval and authorization of the common council and the board of estimate he shall establish the fees or charges if any to be paid for the use thereof he shall cause to be installed and maintained all facilities for the operation of such parking areas and operate the same or he may with the approval and authorization of the common council and the board of estimate lease out the operation or maintenance of one or more of said parking areas on such terms and conditions as he or the common council and the board of estimate may deem advisable for the efficient and proper operation of the airport parking permitted only in regulated areas motor vehicles of the public and of such other persons as may be provided for by city ordinance or contract shall be parked only in such parking areas established by the commissioner for public use and only in accordance with the rules and regulations for the use thereof except as otherwise contracted by the city the commissioner may waive compliance with the requirements of this section by such persons as he deems advisable for the efficient and proper operation of the airport parking fees and charges any person using any such public parking area shall pay when and in the manner prescribed the amount of the fee or charge for such use indicated on a schedule thereof posted at the entrance to said parking area pursuant to direction of the commissioner parking beyond boundary of a parking space no person shall park a vehicle in any such parking area which is marked off to show separate spaces for each vehicle in such a manner as to cause said vehicle to occupy any part of more than one such marked space or any part of the parking area not marked for the parking of a vehicle entry exit parking areas no person shall cause a motor vehicle to enter any public parking area except entrance thereto or to leave therefrom except exit therefrom each as provided and so respectively marked by sign placed thereat by direction or request of the commissioner metered parking areas a the commissioner in his discretion may from time to time and with the approval and authorization of the common council install or cause to be installed in one or more public parking areas parking meters  one for each marked space for the parking of a vehicle therein b whenever a vehicle is parked in any such metered parking space the person parking such vehicle shall immediately deposit or cause to be deposited in the meter for such space the fee for the initial period of time for such parking thereat and before the expiration of such time remove or cause to be removed therefrom said vehicle or deposit or cause to be deposited another like fee for an extension of time for said parking equal to the initial allowed period of time of parking as prescribed by the commissioner and indicated on said meter c any person parking a vehicle in such a metered parking space shall remove said vehicle before or at the expiration of such period or periods of time as may be prescribed and posted by the commissioner as constituting the maximum permitted duration of the continuous parking in such metered space d no person shall deposit in any parking meter any slug device or substitute for a coin of the united states of america or deface injure damage tamper with break destroy or impair the usefulness of any parking meter at the airport  nor shall any person assist advise or participate in any such act posting of traffic signs upon and only upon the request of the commissioner from time to time for the placing erecting removing moving or maintaining of traffic signs or traffic control signals indicating parking limited or prohibited parking standing or stopping maximum speed limits oneway traffic restricted and other limited area prohibited entry or exit entrances or exits to and from the airport or areas thereof limousine and taxicab privileges loading and unloading of vehicles caution and particular dangers the city traffic engineer shall and is hereby directed to place erect remove move and maintain signs or traffic control signals as requested by the commissioner on the airport to comply with said request article viii  enforcement removal from or disallowance of use of airport any person operating or handling any aircraft operating any motor vehicle equipment or apparatus or using the airport or any of its facilities or services in violation of any of these rules and regulations or refusing to comply therewith may be promptly or at such time as the commissioner deems advisable removed from the airport or any part thereof by or pursuant to directive of the commissioner  and such person may be deprived of and refused the further use of the airport or any part thereof or any of its facilities or services for such length of time as may be required in the discretion of the commissioner to insure the safeguarding of the efficient and proper operation of the airport the safety and welfare of persons on or using the airport or the military or defense needs of the united states removal of illegally parked vehicles any vehicle found parked standing or stopped at any place on the airport in violation of any provision of these rules and regulations any other city ordinance any rule or regulation or order of the commissioner or order of a police officer or deputy sheriff may without notice be removed therefrom upon order of the commissioner the police officer in charge or in an emergency requiring the same by any police officer or pursuant to order of any of them  and upon such removal may be towed to and stored at any place on the airport designated by the commissioner or to any garage or other storage area off the airport designated by the commissioner and such removal shall be deemed the abatement of a nuisance and shall together with the incidental storage be at the risk and expense of the owner redemption of removed vehicles before such vehicle may be removed from such garage or storage area the owner or operator thereof shall pay to the commissioner or his authorized representative a reasonable charge for such removal or storage service as was rendered by the airport under the provisions of section 82 or to the operator of such towing and storage service as towed or stored said vehicle off the airport for such services rendered by said operator at the request of authorized airport personnel under said provisions any such charge shall be a lien against the title and right of possession of the owner and other persons having any interest in said vehicle the city shall not be liable for any damage to said vehicle nor for any charge resulting from said removal or storage closing of airport the commissioner may from time to time close or restrict all or any portion of the airport to such use as he may deem advisable in the interest of public safety or for the safeguarding of facilities of the airport aircraft thereon or the military needs of the united states of america article ix  other laws ordinances and regulations and repeals subsequent amendments wherever reference is made herein to any law ordinance or regulations invalidity thereof shall not effect the remaining parts of this ordinance article gen  ambulances short title this chapter shall be known and may be cited as the ambulance  of the city of syracuse definitions as used in this chapter ambulance means any privately owned vehicle equipped or used for transporting the injured or sick central business district means that area within the circle whose radius is onehalf mile measured from the center of the intersection of south salina street and genesee street commissioner of health means the commissioner of health of the onondaga county health district  license required  separate license for each ambulance no person shall engage in the business of operating an ambulance for the transportation of sick or injured persons for hire from one point to another within the city without first obtaining and keeping in force a license as herein provided separate licenses shall be required for each ambulance operated application for license application for license hereunder shall be made upon blank forms prepared by the commissioner of licenses and shall contain a the name and address of the owner of the ambulance  b a description of the ambulance including the make model year of manufacture new york state license number for the current year motor and chassis numbers and the length of time the ambulance has been in use  c the location and description of the place or places from which it is intended to operate  d such other information as the commissioner of licenses shall find reasonably necessary to a fair determination of whether the terms of this chapter have been complied with  inspection before issuance of license upon receipt of an application for a license the commissioner of licenses shall cause to be made by the commissioner of health an inspection of each ambulance for which a license is sought to determine whether it meets the requirements of this chapter and complies with state laws city ordinances and the sanitary onondaga county as to safety and sanitation  only specially constructed vehicles to be licensed no motor vehicle shall be licensed as an ambulance hereunder unless it shall have been constructed specifically as an ambulance for that exclusive purpose office and garage ensuring proper service required for issuance of license and subsequent operation no license shall be issued hereunder unless the licensee maintains an office and garage within the central business district in the city at a location which will permit prompt and continuous centralized ambulance service firstaid equipment required for issuance of license and subsequent operation for issuance of a license and for subsequent operation each ambulance shall carry and have available in good working order at all times all of the first aid equipment the commissioner of health may reasonably require at the time of application for a license the commissioner of licenses shall furnish to the applicant in writing a list of such first aid equipment as the commissioner of health deems minimum requirements the licensee shall carry and have available and in good working order at least such minimum first aid requirements until a new list is furnished the licensee by the commissioner of licenses the commissioner of licenses may furnish such new or revised list of first aid requirements from time to time as he deems necessary each licensee after being furnished same shall comply therewith  radio and telephone equipment required for issuance of license and subsequent operation for issuance of a license and for subsequent operation each ambulance shall be equipped with a twoway radio communication facility authorized by the federal communications commission for such service and issued to the licensee hereunder such radio communication shall be in operation between each such vehicle and the licensees headquarters during the entire twentyfour 24 hours of each day each licensee shall also maintain and provide at his own expense a direct telephone line to police headquarters of the city on a twentyfour 24 hour basis ambulance personnel requirements for issuance of license and subsequent operation for issuance of a license and for subsequent operation the following requirements as to ambulance personnel shall apply a each ambulance shall be driven by a competent driver duly licensed by the state b each ambulance shall be accompanied on all calls by a second attendant to care for the patient c at least one of the attendants on each ambulance shall possess a current certificate of advanced red cross first aid instruction or evidence of equivalent training as determined by the commissioner all full or parttime ambulance attendants working on any ambulance operating in the city must obtain an advanced red cross first aid certificate within four 4 months after such employment and keep same in force thereafter all ambulance attendants and all drivers acting as such shall be required annually and whenever required by the commissioner of health to demonstrate competence in necessary first aid skills including but not limited to transportation of the sick and injured resuscitation control of bleeding and care of broken bones d all full or parttime ambulance attendants working on any ambulance licensed hereunder are required to pass a preemployment physical examination and an annual physical examination by a duly licensed physician such examination shall include tests of the nervous system examinations to exclude communicable diseases and tests to establish a degree of health compatible with the functions of ambulance attendants e no licensee shall permit any of his ambulance service attendants to engage while on duty in occupations inimical to the public health or the proper discharge of his duties liability insurance prior to the issuance of any license hereunder the applicant shall file with the commissioner of health and shall keep the same in force during the life of the license a policy of public liability and property damage insurance with an insurance company authorized to transact business in the state of new york covering each ambulance operated or to be operated by him providing public liability insurance for personal injury or death and property damage in such form as shall meet the requirements of section 17 of the vehicle and traffic law of the state of new york or other provisions of law applicable thereto for motor vehicles engaged in the business of transporting passengers for hire each vehicle shall be insured for the sum of at least fifty thousand dollars $5000000 for property damage and three hundred thousand dollars $30000000 for injuries to or death of any one person and the sum of at least five hundred thousand dollars $50000000 for injuries to or death of more than one person in any one accident the policy shall provide for three hundred thousand dollars $30000000 for liability arising out of a malpractice claim for one person and five hundred thousand dollars $50000000 for liability arising out of malpractice claims by more than one person the policy shall include a provision that it may not be cancelled without also serving upon the commissioner of licenses a notice thereof of at least twenty 20 days or such other time as the applicable laws of the state shall provide within which notice of cancellation may be served each such policy shall name the licensee and the city of syracuse as the insured  issuance of license if the commissioner of health determines by inspection and otherwise that the applicant is in compliance with all the sections of this chapter and its personnel and equipment conform to the stated standards he shall advise the commissioner of licenses to issue a license the commissioner of licenses shall issue a license upon such recommendation by the commissioner of health  license fee the fee for an ambulance operators license shall be twentyfive inspection required periodically each ambulance shall be inspected and approved at least once every six 6 months at an official inspection station of the state a certificate issued by such station shall be filed with the commissioner of health continuous service required  emergency call defined each licensee shall provide continuous night and day service twentyfour 24 hours per day each day in the year including sundays and holidays and shall respond to emergency calls made to him whether public or private and regardless of apparent or supposed ability or inability to pay therefor for the purpose of this section emergency call shall mean any sudden disabling illness or any injury to person occurring in or upon public streets or places in the city or any injury in private homes and places which requires immediate first aid relief an emergency call shall not be construed to include private calls for ordinary illness wishes of sick or injured to be followed no sick or injured person shall be conveyed from a place where he was overcome by sickness or from the scene of the accident in which he was injured by an ambulance to a place to which he is unwilling to go the attendant accompanying the ambulance shall in all cases before removal of the sick or injured person to the ambulance ask of such sick or injured person the place to which he desires to be taken if such person is unconscious or is unable to give any direction in his own behalf the attendant shall ask a relative of such sick or injured where he is to be taken if any relatives are present the wishes of sick or injured persons or their relatives as to destination ascertained as above provided shall be followed in all cases interception of calls  revocation of license for violation of licensee hereunder shall be cause for revocation of the license or licenses of such licensee as provided in section 422 compliance with laws and ordinances each licensee and his employees shall comply articles in this chapter which relate specifically to said types of amusements and assemblages article 2  general provisions as to safety good order and decency duty of licensee to maintain good order  policing it shall be the duty of each person obtaining a license under this chapter to keep good order in and about his place of exhibition and amusement and for that purpose to keep at his own expense a sufficient police force duty of licensee to provide proper exits it shall be the duty of each person giving any exhibition in any hall theater or assembly rooms pursuant to a license obtained under this chapter to provide necessary exits therefrom to keep such exits unlocked during performances and to keep passageways and stairs from such exits to the street adequately lighted indecency and lewdness prohibited no person shall appear within the city in a state of nudity or in dress not belonging to his or her sex or in an indecent or lewd dress or shall make an indecent exposure of his or her person or shall sell or offer for sale any indecent or lewd book picture or other thing or shall exhibit or perform any indecent or immoral play or other representation or shall exhibit or cause to be exhibited on any billboard window or in any public place in the city any lewd immoral or obscene picture or illustrated paper containing an immoral picture or printed matter application of article the provisions of this article shall apply to all licenses and activities subject to the requirements of this no license required by this shall be issued until it shall be found that the premises comply with all laws ordinances and regulations for the protection of the public health and life the safety of buildings and the protection of the public from fire  and that such premises are a safe and proper place for the purposes for which it is to be used gen  article 3  circuses and other assemblages using temporary structures permit required for temporary structure notwithstanding any of the provisions in this chapter authorizing issuance of licenses it shall be unlawful for any person to erect or cause to be erected any temporary structure composed wholly or partly of canvas or similar material to be used as a circus place of amusement or for any religious educational or recreational purposes or for any other public assemblages whatsoever within the limits of the city of syracuse or to use any such structure for such purpose without first having made application to and received a permit to do so in accordance with the provisions hereinafter set forth in this article three months time limit for temporary structure  exception except as provided in section 515 no structure shall be deemed temporary hereunder which is to be used or maintained for a period in excess of three 3 months it shall be unlawful to use or maintain any such structure hereunder in excess of such period of three 3 months plywood structures for religious purposes notwithstanding any other provisions of this article a temporary structure to be used for religious purposes may be constructed composed wholly or substantially in whole of plywood provided application is made for permission to do so in accordance with the conditions and limitations of this article which must be fully complied with time of filing application for permit  advance notice to allow inspection the application for a permit and accompanying plans required by this article shall be submitted to the city clerk at least ten 10 days prior to the date of the opening of any such temporary structure the city clerk also shall be notified at least twentyfour 24 hours prior to the erection of such structure so that he may make or cause to have made an inspection during reasonable daylight hours application for permit  contents the application for a permit under this article shall be filed in writing with the city clerk in such form and showing such relevant information as the city clerk shall require including a the type of construction seating arrangement aisles and structural details  b location of electrical wiring  c location of exits and fire equipment  d whether any open flame is intended to be used within the structure and the provisions to make the same safe  e formula of the solution used or to be used to flameproof the structure  f what provisions have been made for sanitary facilities for persons using the structure  g the name of the person firm or corporation which will use the structure location of principal places of business of such person firm or corporation and names and addresses of the officers of such firm or corporation  and h the length of time the structure is intended to be used for the purpose applied for and the hours of the day or night when it is to be used liability insurance the applicant for a permit under this article shall furnish evidence that a public liability insurance policy in amounts of not less than ten thousand dollars $1000000 for one person and one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 for any one accident shall be in force and effect at the time such temporary structure is to be occupied as a place of assembly by the public bond to save city harmless the applicant for such permit shall deposit with the city clerk a cash bond or surety bond meeting the approval of the corporation counsel in the amount of one thousand dollars $100000 conditioned upon saving harmless the city of syracuse from any and all liability or causes of action which might arise by virtue of the granting of a permit under this article or a license under article 1 of this chapter  and conditioned further that no damage will be done to the streets sewers trees or adjoining property and that no dirt paper litter or other debris will be permitted to remain upon the streets or upon any private property by said applicant such cash or surety bond shall not be returned to the applicant except upon certification by the chief of fire that all conditions of this chapter have been complied with and upon certification by the corporation counsel that no legally timely claim indemnifiable under said bond is pending or known deposit for use of city fire equipment and personnel if the chief of fire determines that the attendance of fire equipment at the location of such temporary structure during the use of such structure as a place of assembly is necessary for the safety of persons and property he shall require that the applicant deposit with the commissioner of finance a sum equal to the reasonable value of the use of such equipment and the furnishing of the necessary personnel for such time as will be required in order to reimburse the city for such expense inspection required before use of structure no license issued under this chapter for any such circus or other assemblage in any such temporary structure shall become operative and effective and no such circus or other assemblage in any such temporary structure shall proceed or be permitted to proceed until an inspection shall have been made by the police fire and building departments and where sanitary facilities are provided by the health department such inspection shall be made by representatives of each department acting in cooperation with each other for the purpose of determining that to the most practical degree possible all factors are present to preclude and prevent danger to the public from injury fire and panic such inspection shall include and must find a that the grounds are safe for use by the public  that no conditions exist which are liable to cause injury  and that the premises are sufficiently clear of straw dry grass or combustible trash  b that the seats platforms poles and all other portions of the structure are sufficiently sound stable and secure to insure the public safety  c that provisions have been made for a sufficient number of aisles and exits to insure lighted and unobstructed passageways to areaways well away from the tent or other place of such circus or other assemblage  d that adequate provisions have been made for first aid in case of injury and for first aid fire apparatus which must be properly distributed throughout the grounds the inspection must also establish that the operating personnel are familiar with the use and location of such facilities  e that the canvas tent or temporary structure of any other material used to house such circus or other assemblage is fireproof or flameproof or has been rendered fireproof or flameproof insofar as the same is practicably possible by the use of recognized standards  f where toilet or other sanitary facilities have been provided that such facilities are adequate to insure the public health and so located as to avoid endangering the public safety required approval by all city authorities concerned no such circus or other assemblage shall be permitted and no license therefor shall be issued under this chapter by the city clerk or other proper authority unless the proper representatives of each of the city departments concerned shall signify by written endorsement of such license or otherwise that in the matters within the jurisdiction of the respective departments there has been a sufficient compliance with the requirements of this article fee for permit the applicant for a permit under this article shall pay to the city a fee of one dollar $100 for such permit such fee shall be in addition to any license fees required for the proposed activity by article 1 of this chapter or by other provisions of law or ordinance assignment of police and firemen at expense of licensee or permittee  safety regulations a unless the licensee or permittee provides at his own expense sufficient policemen at such circus or other assemblage as determined and approved by the chief of police for the protection of the public and prevention of injury and panic the chief of police shall provide such policemen at the expense of the licensee or permittee b no smoking shall be permitted a policeman or responsible employee shall be placed at each entrance to require the extinguishing of lighted cigars cigarettes and pipes arrangements shall be made to give frequent no smoking announcements while the public is assembling and during the performance c no overcrowding shall be permitted d aisles and exits must be kept open and unobstructed at all times except that if a sufficient number of other exits are provided one of such exits or entrances may be reserved during performances for the use of performers and animals used in performances e all areas where rubbish and debris may accumulate especially under seats shall be kept reasonably serviced and cleared by the operating personnel f the applicant shall provide at its own expense sufficient men competent to act as guards so that at least one man shall be on guard at each exit and each entrance in all such structures open to the public continuously while such structure is open to the public and throughout each performance g when deemed reasonably necessary by the chief of fire a sufficient number of firemen shall be assigned at the expense of the licensee or permittee and subject to the deposit provisions of section 520 such firemen shall familiarize themselves with the nature and location of all fire protection features and the location of all exits they shall be so distributed that all sections where the public is admitted are under constant surveillance they shall also assist the police in the prevention of smoking and overcrowding and in the clearing of aisles and exits if any acts using fire or open flames are to be given suitable safeguards shall be provided or the use of such devices curtailed or forbidden proper facilities for calling the fire apparatus to the scene shall be provided and when deemed necessary by the chief of fire a sufficient amount of hose and other fire apparatus shall be kept and maintained at or near the premises in instant readiness to combat any probable fire rules and regulations by city departments each of the city departments referred to in this article is authorized to make suitable and proper rules and regulations to implement and render more fully effective the provisions of this article immediate stoppage of circus or assemblage upon violation of article the chief of police or the chief of fire or their duly authorized representatives shall have the power in the event that any of the provisions of this article or the rules and regulations made thereunder are violated to stop any such circus or other assemblage immediately and to debar it from continuing revocation of license or permit any license under this chapter and any permit under this article issued any such circus or other assemblage may be revoked at any time for cause thereupon such circus or assemblage must cease operation immediately and shall not be permitted to resume unless and article 8  dances and dancing short title of article this article shall be known and may be cited as the public dance the city of syracuse definitions as used in this article and chapter dancing school and academy means places where regular instruction in dancing and deportment forms the principal activity and purpose of the school or academy where there is reasonable evidence of permanent establishment and where the persons in charge thereof are persons who follow the profession of teaching dancing hotel dining room applies to bona fide hotels of good reputation used exclusively as a house for the entertainment and care of travelers and others of the public generally known used in connection with the words public character means known to the manager owner lessee or agent in charge of a public dance hall dancing school or academy or to the person conducting a public dance or to the police or who has such reputation or character or who has pleaded guilty or been convicted of being a public character male or female procurer or vagrant private home and homes means only such buildings as are used exclusively for private dwelling purposes public dance or public ball means all dances balls dancing entertainment cabarets and parties where dancing is held after the original program to which admission can be had by payment of a fee by the purchase possession or presentation of a ticket or token or in which a charge is made for the caring of the clothing or other property or by assessment or contributions of the participants or any other dance to which any of the public generally may be admitted with or without the payment of a fee public dance hall means any room place or space in which a public dance or public ball may be held or any hall or academy in which classes in dancing are held or instruction in dancing is given license or permit required  approval by chief of police unless exemption therefrom is expressly provided in this article it shall be unlawful to hold any public dance public ball entertainment or party where dancing is held after the original program or to hold classes in dancing or to give instruction in dancing in any public dance hall dancing school or academy within the limits of the city without first obtaining a license from the city clerk duly approved by the chief of police  or a permit for same from the chief of police in those cases where this article provides for such permits the chief of police for cause in any case may refuse a license or permit applied for hereunder chief of police authorized to make rules and regulations the chief of police may make and publish reasonable rules and regulations governing the issuing of permits and licenses subject to the provisions of this article and any other ordinances of the city exemption for private dances in private homes dances which are not public dances and are held in private homes and private instruction in dancing given in private homes shall be deemed private dances or private dancing and shall not be subject to the requirements of this article or chapter as to licenses permits or payment of fees exemption for private club dances in private homes dances given in private homes by a bona fide society club or organization where the attendance is restricted to the members of the society club or organization who have been such members before the date of any such dance provided that where the membership of any such club society or organization consists of men only or of women only persons of the other sex to a number not exceeding the number of members of any such society club or organization may be admitted as guests and where the dance is merely incidental to the purposes of such society club or organization shall be deemed to be private and not public dances and such private dances shall not be subject to the requirements of this article as to licenses permits or payment of fees partial exemption for private club dances weddings and parties not held in private homes  permit in lieu of license  no fee dances of the type described in section 5111 and private weddings and parties where dancing occurs if not held in a dances dances which on application to the chief of police are found by him to be held strictly for charitable purposes may be exempted as to fees from the provisions of this article license fee with all provisions of this article and chapter improper behavior by dancers prohibited it shall be unlawful for any persons dancing together to conduct themselves immorally or to dance any suggestive dances or to dance with any suggestive movements or any dance which in any manner may be suggestive of the immoral minors at public dances it shall be unlawful to permit any person who has not reached the age of sixteen 16 years to attend or remain at any public dance unless such person be accompanied by the parent or legal guardian it shall be unlawful for any person to falsely represent himself
