article 9  ticket scalping scalping prohibited no person shall sell or offer for sale any ticket for admission to any athletic contest or place of amusement at a price in advance of prices charged by the managers of said athletic contests or entertainment or in excess of the price printed or stamped by said managers on said tickets article 10  regulating miniature motion picture devices definitions as used in this article and chapter 1 miniature motion picture device shall mean any machine apparatus or other device designed or used to show motion pictures in which the projector screen and other apparatus necessary for showing motion pictures are enclosed in a moveable or portable structure or container and which is used to show motion pictures to members of the public for a sum of money or other thing of value and which is located in a place operated for amusement patronage or entertainment of the public gen  unlawful placing operation and maintenance prohibited no person shall place maintain or operate or permit to be placed maintained or operated in any public place any miniature motion picture device which is in violation of the laws of the state or the ordinances of the city gen  license required no person shall own operate or maintain a miniature motion picture device without first obtaining a license from the city commissioner of licenses in the manner provided for in this article gen  license application  information required miniature motion picture device application for a miniature motion picture device license under this article shall be made in the first instance to the city commissioner of licenses on application forms to be furnished by him the city commissioner of licenses may require from the applicant information in writing signed and verified by the applicant or if a corporation by an officer thereof showing the name and address of the applicant name and address of the manufacturer of the device name and address of the person having responsible charge of the premises upon which the device is placed or to be located for use the location of said premises by street and number and such other information as the commissioner shall deem reasonably necessary such application forms for a miniature motion picture device license so furnished by the commissioner shall also include in substance and require information from the applicant as to the following 1 whether the applicant has or if a corporation whether the corporation or the officers thereof have ever been convicted of a felony or misdemeanor or of any violation or offense against the laws of the state or the ordinances of the city or elsewhere 2 a statement by the applicant that he represents himself to be of good moral character gen  processing applications a upon receipt of an application for a license as provided in section 5134 the commissioner of licenses shall forward such application to the chief of police who shall thereupon make or cause to be made inquiry and investigation in regard to the character and qualifications of the applicant prior to the issuing of any license the chief of police shall also as a part of his investigation require each applicant to be fingerprinted or if the applicant is a corporation the officer who executed the application and the same shall be shown on the application forms which shall provide sufficient space therefor the chief of police shall have a reasonable time to make such investigation upon completion of the investigation he shall return such application form to the commissioner of licenses with his approval or disapproval thereof which may be made by affixing his signature to such approval or by use of a stamp bearing a facsimile of his signature space shall also be provided on such forms for approval of the license bureau and the identification bureau in the police department such approval may be indicated by use of a stamp b the license application shall also contain space for approval by the electrical inspector of the bureau of safety and the fire marshal of the syracuse fire prevention bureau the electrical inspector or his agent shall inspect each device and the premises in which it is located to determine whether the device and the premises are in conformance with the city electrical code the fire marshal or his agent shall inspect each device and the premises to determine whether the device or premises are in conformance with the city fire code gen  character and record of licensee the licensee shall be of good moral character no license shall be issued under this article to any person who has been convicted of a felony or a misdemeanor or of any crime or offense against the laws of the state or the laws or ordinances of the city or elsewhere relating to immoral lewd or obscene conduct or exhibitions or the promotion of immoral lewd or obscene conduct or exhibitions gen  restriction as to location of miniature motion picture devices near schools parks playgrounds and places of worship no license shall be granted for any miniature motion picture device located within five hundred 500 feet of the lot lines of a public or private school or place of worship gen  license fees the fee for a license under this article shall be two hundred fifty dollars $25000 per year or fraction thereof for each device payable in advance gen  issuance of license upon receipt of an application from the chief of police approved by him the commissioner of licenses shall issue the license upon payment of the license fee and upon purchase of the identification tag or seal required by section 5141 hereof each license shall be signed by the commissioner of licenses either by his signature or by use of a stamp bearing a facsimile of said signature gen  expiration date of licenses every license under this article shall expire on the thirtyfirst day of december next succeeding the date of issuance thereof gen  identification tags or seals for games  fee owners or operators of miniature motion picture devices licensed under this article shall be required to purchase a tag or seal for each device in operation in any public place the fee for each tag or seal purchased shall be five dollars $500 such tag or seal shall be affixed to the device in a prominent place the tag or seal shall bear a serial number and the owners or operators name and license number gen  expiration date of tags or seals all tags and seals issued under this article shall expire on the thirtyfirst day of december next succeeding the date of issuance thereof gen  notification to commissioner of licenses when devices placed in city every owner or operator of a miniature motion picture device shall within twentyfour 24 hours of the placement of any such device in the city notify the commissioner of licenses of said placement and shall give the serial number of the tag or seal attached to said device and the serial number and name of the device gen  transfer of licenses or identification tags or seals no license tag or seal shall be transferred from one device to another except in accordance with the procedures of section 541 of article 5 gen  maintenance of order in amusement centers every licensee of a miniature motion picture device shall maintain good order on the premises in which such device is located gen  use by minors no minor under eighteen 18 years of age shall be allowed to operate any miniature motion picture device regulated by this article gen  minimum floor space a in the event a miniature motion picture device is located on premises wherein any item andor services is sold to the public the device or devices shall be enclosed in an area by a partition or partitions consisting of opaque material with a minimum height of six 6 feet b minimum distance between each device shall be three 3 feet and at least forty 40 square feet of gross floor area shall be provided for each device c in the event a device or devices are located in an enclosed area as described in a at least forty 40 square feet of gross floor area shall be provided for each device within said enclosed area gen  revocation of licenses any license issued under this article may be revoked by the commissioner of licenses for violation of any provision of this article after a hearing held upon at least five 5 days written notice thereof served on the licensee either personally or by registered mail addressed to the licensee at the address at which the device is authorized to operate in the event of the conviction of the licensee of a felony misdemeanor or violation against the laws of the state or ordinances of the city the license shall be immediately revoked the chief of police shall immediately notify the commissioner of licenses of any such conviction or violation coming to his knowledge or attention gen  seizure  penalty any miniature motion picture device operated or maintained in violation of the terms of this article may be seized in compliance with the terms and provisions of the statutes of the state any person who shall operate or maintain any device without first obtaining a license as provided by this article shall be guilty of a misdemeanor gen  effective date this ordinance article shall take effect immediately gen  editors note the catchline for the above section has been supplied by the editor none being present in the legislation from which it is derived article 11  juice bar ordinance title this article shall be known as the juice bar  gen  declaration of legislative findings the common council finds that juice bars establishments that do not serve alcohol have an alcohol beverage control license andor prepare and serve food exist in the city of syracuse in an effort to evade current licensing requirements specifically the requirements set forth in business certificate of use ordinance and that their operation currently creates a public nuisance to the neighborhoods where they operate in particular that their operation results in significant calls to the police after midnight for fights weapons possession illegal parked vehicles and excessive noise all of which substantially and seriously interfere with the interest of the public in the quality of life and total community environment commerce in the city property values and the public health safety and welfare the common council further finds that the continued unregulated operation of juice bars including their hours of operation is detrimental to the health safety and welfare of the city of syracuse and of the business thereof and the visitors thereto it is the purpose of this article to regulate and license juice bars and require that they obtain a juice bar license before they may operate and that they are to not operate after  pm the council further finds that the regulations and licensing requirements imposed by this article constitute an additional and appropriate method of law enforcement in response to the proliferation of juice bars gen  definitions juice bar shall mean a business on the premises that meets all the following criteria 1 does not serve alcohol or have an alcohol beverage control license  2 does not prepare and serve food except as an incidental part of the business  and 3 the business has live or recorded music and permits dancing with or without music owner means an owner andor operator of a juice bar premises shall mean the building in which the juice bar is located as well as accessory structures and uses including parking lots and the land on which the building is located gen  license required no owner shall operate or maintain a juice bar in the city of syracuse without obtaining from the commissioner of finance a juice bar license gen  application an application for a juice bar license shall be made to the department of finance on forms prescribed by the commissioner of finance the application shall request relevant information relating to the owner and the juice bar to be conducted at the premises including the existence of necessary licenses and permits for the juice bar gen  inspections and investigations a upon receipt of an application for a juice bar license the chief of police or hisher designee the commissioner of community development or hisher designee the director of code enforcement or hisher designee and the chief of fire or hisher designee shall inspect the premises to determine whether the owner is complying with the laws and ordinances which they are charged with enforcing said chief of police commissioner director and chief of fire and members of their staff shall have the right to enter upon any premises for which a juice bar license is sought for the purpose of making such an inspection during normal business hours and shall also have the authority to seek warrants where necessary b upon receipt of an application for a juice bar license the city of syracuse zoning administrator or hisher designee shall review the location to ensure that the operation of the juice bar at that location will be in compliance with the zoning ordinance gen  issuance of juice bar licenses no juice bar license shall be issued unless the owner has satisfied the following conditions 1 the owner has paid the annual juice bar license fee of two hundred fifty dollars $25000  2 the owner has all necessary licenses and permits for the juice bar  3 the owner does not owe the city any money for delinquent taxes water charges civil penalties parking tickets or other duly incurred charges fines or penalties  4 the owner of the premises does not owe the city any money for delinquent taxes water charges civil penalties parking tickets or other duly incurred charges fines or penalties  5 corporations partnerships andor limited liability companies for which the owner andor the owner of the premises are a principal member or owner do not owe the city any money for delinquent taxes water charges civil penalties parking tickets or other duly incurred charges fines or penalties  and 6 all applicable city officials in section 5155 have inspected and investigated the juice bar the juice bars premises and the juice bar location and have approved the owners application for a juice bar license upon completion of the requirements given to the owner by the applicable city officials in section 5155 and the approval of the owners application by said city officials the commissioner of finance shall issue a juice bar license to the owner for the juice bar in accordance with the terms of this section gen  operation of juice bars a no juice bar shall remain open after  pm b the owner of any juice bar shall comply with all provisions of federal and state statutes and rules and regulations and all city of syracuse local laws ordinances and rules and regulations relating to the conduct of the juice bar and the occupation use and maintenance of the premises in which the juice bar is located c the owner of any juice bar shall comply with all the notices orders decisions and rules and regulations made by the chief of police chief of fire commissioner of community development director of code enforcement city of syracuse zoning administrator and other city departments governing the occupation and use of the premises in which the juice bar is located d the owner of any juice bar shall cause the juice bar license to be posted in a conspicuous place visible to the public on the premises of the juice bar e the owner of any juice bar shall not permit at any time a greater number of persons on the premises than the capacity approved by the city of syracuse f the owner of any juice bar shall maintain good order on and about the premises at all times the owner of any juice bar shall also be responsible for removing refuse from the premises and obstructions from the sidewalk adjacent to the premises as well as for operating the juice bar in accordance with the requirements of all state statutes and rules and regulations and all city of syracuse local laws ordinances and rules and regulations and for operating the juice bar so that neither the juice bar nor its patrons become a source of disruption to other building tenants or a source of disruption on the sidewalks streets or other private property in the vicinity of the juice bar the term failure to maintain good order shall include but not be limited to the following 1 allowing or permitting the premises to become disorderly including allowing or permitting offenses against public order 2 gambling 3 prostitution 4 illegal possession use gift sale or offer for sale of alcoholic beverages 5 illegal possession use gift sale or offer for sale of cigarettes or tobacco products 6 food stamp or welfare fraud or criminal diversion of prescription medications and prescriptions 7 litter 8 possession use gift sale or offer for sale of illegal drugs 9 noise control ordinance violations 10 possession of stolen property 11 operating beyond the legal hours of operation 12 illegal possession use gift sale or offer for sale of dangerous weapons 13 violations of the new york state uniform fire prevention and building the city of syracuses zoning ordinance property conservation code building code electrical code mechanical code and elevator code gen  expiration of license juice bar licenses shall be valid until december 31 of the year for which the juice bar license is issued unless the license is suspended or revoked gen  transfer of license juice bar licenses cannot not be transferred or assigned gen  suspension or revocation of license a juice bar licenses issued pursuant to this article may be suspended or revoked by the commissioner of finance in accordance with the provisions of this article based on a hearing on notice under this article b the commissioner of finance is authorized in the event an owner issued a license under this article has been ticketed arrested or cited for any of the violations set forth in section 5157 to conduct a hearing on notice to the owner to determine whether the juice bar license should be suspended or revoked based on the violations set forth in the notice the hearing shall be held within three 3 business days of the owner being ticketed arrested or cited for any of the violations set forth in section 5157 c the notice of hearing to be given to the owner shall be served pursuant to of the new york civil practice law and rules cplr upon the owner d a juice bar license shall be suspended or revoked where it has been established that one or more violations of section 5157 has occurred and no remedy short of suspension or revocation of the juice bar license will abate the violations of section 5157 and stop the juice bar from being a public nuisance gen  severability in the event any clause sentence paragraph section or part of this article shall be finally adjudged by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid unlawful andor unconstitutional such determination shall not affect impair or invalidate the remainder thereof but shall be limited to the portion directly involved in the determination and the remainder of this chapter shall remain in full force and effect gen  access to premises for inspections in addition to the requirements set forth in section 5155 officers and employees of any city departments with responsibility to enforce or assist the commissioner of finance in enforcing this article shall have the right of access to any juice bar subject to the terms of this article for the purpose of making an inspection during normal business hours and the city of syracuse shall also have the authority to seek inspection warrants where necessary to properly administer this article gen  penaltiescriminal and civil a criminal penalties any owner who operates andor maintains a juice bar without a juice bar license or in violation of the provisions of the article shall be guilty of an offense and upon conviction shall be punishable by a fine of not less than fifty dollars $5000 nor more than one hundred fifty dollars $15000 or imprisonment for not more than fifteen 15 days or both for each offense b civil penaltyimposition of cumulative civil penalty any owner who operates andor maintains a juice bar without a juice bar license or in violation of the provisions of the article shall be subject to a cumulative civil penalty of fifty dollars $5000 per day for each separate violation the penalty may be collected by the corporation counsel by action or special proceeding against the owner c enforcement of civil penalty 1 the corporation counsel may maintain an action or special proceeding in a court of competent jurisdiction for the recovery of civil penalties together with costs and disbursements 2 in addition to any action or special proceeding for civil penalty as provided above the corporation counsel may bring such action or special proceeding as necessary to enjoin the owner from continuing to operate or maintain any juice bar in violation of the terms of this article gen  enforcement the enforcement by the city of syracuse of this article in the manner provided herein shall not be deemed to limit in any manner the city of syracuses authority to enforce the provisions of other federal state and local laws ordinances rules and regulations against juice bars covered by this article gen  bathing and public bath unclothed bathing in public places no person shall unless covered by proper garment traversed by said vehicle bus does not mean or include motor propelled vehicles used exclusively for sightseeing purposes or exclusively as hotel buses or any taxicab or any airport bus as defined in chapter 25 of these revised general ordinances or other motor propelled vehicle which is rented from a fixed stand in the street or from a private or public garage and the destination of which is under the direction of the passenger or passengers transported therein gen  bus license permit or consent required except in the case of interstate buses under article 3 of this chapter it shall be unlawful for any person to use or operate any bus as owner driver or otherwise upon any street avenue alley or other public place of the city or in competition with another common carrier which is required by law to obtain the consent of the local authorities of the city to operate over the streets thereof unless a license or a permit or consent to use or operate each such bus has first been procured as provided in this chapter minimum age for licensees permittees or holders of consents no license permit or consent to use or operate any bus within the city shall be granted to any person operated upon the streets of the city and to provide for transfer systems to be used by such buses deviations from licensed route no person shall operate or permit to be operated any bus within the city off or away from the route stated and fixed in the license for the operation of such bus without the consent of the common council pickup and discharge of passengers no bus shall pick up or discharge passengers at any point on any street or public place within the city except at such points and places as shall be designated by the chief of police alteration of physical structure of licensed buses except in the case of interstate buses under article 3 of this chapter it shall be unlawful to reconstruct materially alter modify or add to the body or seating arrangements of any bus after the license therefor is issued without first applying for and receiving the consent of the common council trailers prohibited it shall be unlawful to drive or operate any bus within the city while there is attached thereto any trailer or any other passenger carrying vehicle interior illumination it shall be unlawful to drive or operate any bus within the city during the period from a halfhour after sunset to a halfhour before sunrise unless the inside of the body thereof shall be effectually illuminated riding on running boards fender etc it shall be unlawful for any person operating any bus within the city to permit any person other than his employees to stand upon the running board or step thereof or sit upon the fender or dash or doors thereof provided however that firemen and policemen when in uniform may ride upon any part of such bus no smoking on buses no person shall smoke or carry lighted cigarettes cigars or pipes in or on any of the motorbuses operating in the city counterfeiting or fraudulent use of bus tickets tokens and transfers no passenger employee or other person shall with intent to defraud counterfeit or falsely issue or wrongly use any ticket token or transfer of any bus company entitling or purporting to entitle the holder thereof to a passage upon any bus or with like intent to sell exchange or deliver or receive or use in any way such ticket token or transfer policemen and firemen to ride free policemen and firemen of the city when in uniform may ride free upon any bus route signs no person shall operate a bus within the city unless he shall carry on the front thereof a sign plainly lettered and readable by night and day giving the route to be traversed such sign shall be approved by the chief of police liability insurance no license permit or consent shall be granted or continue in effect under this chapter except upon compliance with the requirements herein pertaining to liability insurance interstate buses shall comply with the requirements of this chapter pertaining to liability insurance compliance with laws ordinances and traffic regulations bus licenses permits and consents shall be granted upon the condition that the recipient shall at all times obey the laws of the state all ordinances and traffic regulations of the city in regard to traffic in and over the streets and public places of the city and all laws ordinances and regulations relating to the operation of motor vehicles and the carrying of passengers for hire in such vehicles purpose of fees for licenses permits and consents the streets and public places of the city article 2  licensing of intrastate buses applicability of article this article shall apply to buses operating entirely within the city limits and to intrastate buses having specific terminals within the city as provided in section 820 license application  contents an applicant for a bus license under this article shall file with the city clerk an application in writing accompanied by a map of its proposed route and termini showing the streets avenues alleys and public places upon which it is intended to operate and containing a verified statement of the operating schedule or headway to be maintained the number of buses to be operated and the tariff of fares to be charged for such service intrastate buses having terminus within city a license may be granted under this chapter for the operation of a bus from a specific terminus within the city to a village suburban settlement or other specific terminus outside the city between which termini there is no other frequent and convenient public transportation service such license shall be on the condition that passengers shall not be received on or discharged from such licensed bus within the city limits except at the city terminus  provided however that on outgoing trips passengers may be taken on or along the route within the city and on incoming trips passengers may be discharged along the route within the city publication of license application the city clerk shall cause public notice of license applications to be published at least twice in the official paper of the city procedure for passing upon application  public hearing after completion of publication provided in section 821 the city clerk shall present the application together with the proof of publication to the common council at its next meeting following such publication the common council shall at that meeting hold a public hearing on the application approval or disapproval by common council and mayor  modifications after such meeting of the common council and public hearing held thereat the common council may by ordinance approved by the mayor approve or modify and approve as modified any and all such routes operating schedule or headway and the granting of the license the common council may refuse to grant the license if in its opinion it is for the best interests of the city so to do the mayor may in his discretion refuse to approve the granting of the license if he deems it for the best interests of the city so to do issuance of license upon approval of the application as provided in section 823 and upon payment of the license fee and compliance with the requirements as to liability insurance hereinafter provided a license shall be issued to the applicant by the city clerk countersigned by the mayor acceptance of license deemed agreement to operate on approved route and schedule acceptance of the license shall be deemed an agreement by the applicant to operate its vehicle over the route and upon the schedule approved as provided in section 823 such acceptance shall also be deemed an agreement that for failure to comply with such approved route and schedule the license may be revoked liability insurance before receiving the license the applicant shall file with the city clerk a liability policy together with a receipt showing that the premium thereon has been paid the policy shall cover severally each of the buses mentioned in the license it shall be executed by an insurance company properly licensed to transact passenger and public liability insurance in the state of new york the policy shall be in favor of the city and the licensee it shall cover city public and passenger liability in the maintenance operation use and movements in the city of the buses it shall protect the city against loss or expense arising or resulting from claims for damages against it in consequence of any accident arising by reason of any negligence on the part of the city in connection with the maintenance operation use or movements of said buses or any of them it shall contain a covenant that in the event of the insolvency or bankruptcy of the licensee such insolvency or bankruptcy shall not release the insurance carrier from payment of damages for injuries sustained or loss occasioned during the life of such policy the policy shall be conditioned that in case execution against the licensee is returned unsatisfied in an action brought by an injured person or his personal representatives in case of death resulting from an accident because of such insolvency or bankruptcy that then an action may be maintained by the injured person or his personal representative against such insurance company under the terms of the policy for the amount of the judgment in the said action the policy shall be in the sum of not less than five thousand dollars $500000 for injury or death to any one person and not less than twentyfive thousand dollars $2500000 for any one accident the policy shall contain a covenant that it can be canceled by the insurance company only by filing with the city clerk a written notice to the effect that it will be canceled by the insurance company at  noon on the twentieth day after the filing of said notice in the event of such cancellation notice the licensee shall provide and file a new policy and receipt with the city clerk within such twenty 20 days the liability policy shall be approved by the corporation counsel of the city as to form and sufficiency before the issuance of a license or any renewal thereof a licensee under section 820 who operates a bus on a route partly within and partly without the city shall not be required to furnish a liability insurance policy as provided in this section except to cover liability on the portion of the route within the limits of the city form of license each license shall show the date of the approval by the common council of the license application and the kind serial number make and carrying capacity of each bus to be operated pursuant to said license duration of license every license shall expire on june thirtieth next following its issuance unless sooner revoked license fees the annual license fee shall be three hundred dollars $30000 for each bus except that in the case of licenses for intrastate buses having a terminus within the city and governed by the provisions of section 820 the annual license fee shall be one hundred fifty dollars $15000 article 3  interstate buses exemption from intrastate bus license requirement in the case of any bus operated over the streets and public places of the city carrying passengers for hire from or to a specific terminus in the city to or from specific termini outside received or accepted such personal property for sale at auction the said book when written as hereinbefore required shall be the inventory of items to be sold at auction inventory and other records to the receipt of merchandise after the commencement of said sale restriction as to auction privilege in cases of businesses established less than six months  exceptions a no person without written permission from the city clerk shall dispose of his goods wares or merchandise at public auction either by himself or another unless said person shall have been in business continuously in the city as a wholesale or retail merchant at the same location at which said auction is conducted for a period of six 6 months preceding such auction such permission shall be granted by the city clerk in his discretion for good cause b this section shall not apply to 1 sales conducted by licensed auctioneers of the property of persons not regularly engaged in the wholesale or retail sale of merchandise  or 2 any sale which shall be duly authorized as a goingoutofbusiness sale under article 2 of this chapter restrictions as to adding goods to original stock during any sale by auction no additions whatever shall be made to the stock of merchandise set forth in the inventory book unless such additions shall be recorded in said book and appropriately labeled as merchandise so added upon offering for sale any such merchandise so added the auctioneer shall announce that such articles have been added to the stock of merchandise since the auction started misrepresentation by auctioneers prohibited no auctioneer of personal property shall misrepresent the quality kind or value of any article at any auction sale misrepresentation by any person prohibited no person shall sell or offer for sale any goods wares and merchandise by auction or advertise for sale by auction any goods wares or merchandise falsely representing or pretending that such goods wares or merchandise in whole or in part are a part of a bankrupt or insolvent stock or damaged goods or goods saved by fire or make any false statement as to the purchases history or character of such goods wares or merchandise representations as to jewelry and timepieces  labeling  description a it shall be unlawful for any person licensed hereunder to offer for sale by auction any jewelry article watch or clock to which there is not attached a card or ticket or label containing a true and correct statement plainly written or printed in english specifying the kind and quality of the metal of which such article is made or composed or the percentage of karat or purity of such metals if such articles are plated or overlaid then such tag or label shall contain a true statement of the kind of plate b when precious stones are for sale or sold by auction as such or as part of an article of jewelry such written statement shall set forth the true name weight and quality of such stones when semiprecious stones are offered for sale or sold by auction as such or as part of an article of jewelry such written statement shall set forth the true name of said stones when imitations of precious or semiprecious stones are offered for sale or sold by auction as such or as part of an article of jewelry said imitations shall be described or defined as synthetic or imitations of such stones as they purport to represent c when watches and clocks are sold the true names of the manufacturers shall be stated in writing no parts of the movements or mechanism thereof shall be substituted or contain false and misleading names or trade marks secondhand or old movements shall not be offered for sale in new cases without a true statement to that effect used and rebuilt watches shall be so indicated in accordance with the state law d all tags or labels required by this section shall remain securely attached to any such article or merchandise and shall be delivered to the purchaser as a true and correct description and representation of the article sold e it shall be deemed prima facie evidence of intent to defraud if such written statement is not a true and correct description and representation of such article sold sale of certain articles between  pm and  am prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to sell dispose of or offer for sale in the city at public auction or to cause or permit such sale disposal or offer between the hours of  pm and  am the following morning any gold silver platedware precious stones watches clocks jewelry bricabrac rugs clothing china porcelain crockery glassware linens laces leather goods furniture springs mattresses electric household appliances musical instruments or radios whether the same shall be their own property or whether they shall sell the same as agents or employees or otherwise gen  thirtyday limit for auction sales  extensions no sale at a public auction shall continue for more than thirty 30 days sundays and legal holidays excepted from the day of the beginning of the sale such sale may continue for thirty 30 additional days upon written permission of the city clerk such permission shall be granted by the city clerk in his discretion for of a license he may upon his own motion or upon complaint made by any person revoke any license issued hereunder before so revoking any such license he shall cause to be served upon the licensee a notice specifying the grounds of complaint or the alleged reasons for revocation such notice shall fix a time and place at which the city clerk shall hear and determine the said complaint the person against whom said compliant is made shall have an opportunity to be heard in answer to said complaint at the time specified in said notice and to make defense thereto the city clerk may revoke the license of any person against whom charges brought as above are in his opinion substantiated when a license is revoked the city clerk shall notify the licensee in writing and give the reasons for such revocation penalty any person who shall violate or fail or refuse to comply in any way with any of the provisions of this article shall be liable to a fine or penalty of not more than one hundred fifty dollars $15000 for each offense in case the person convicted of such violation is fined and does not immediately pay such fine or penalty he may be committed to the onondaga county penitentiary for the term of one day for each and every dollar of said fine or penalty not paid not exceeding one hundred fifty 150 days each day said business is carried on without the procurement of and payment for the license required under this article shall constitute a separate offense article 2  goingoutofbusiness sales purpose of article the purpose of this chapter article is to regulate sales to the public of goods wares and merchandise in anticipation of going out of business definitions as used in this article publish or publishing of advertisement or advertising means any and all means of conveying to the public notice of sale or notice of intention to conduct a sale whether by word of mouth newspaper advertisement magazine advertisement handbill written notice printed notice printed display billboard display poster radio announcement television and any and all means including oral written or printed sale means the sale or an offer to sell to the public goods wares and merchandise of any kind and all kinds and descriptions on hand and in stock in connection with a declared purpose as set forth by advertising on the part of the seller that such sale is anticipatory to the termination closing liquidation windup discontinuance conclusion or abandonment of the business in connection with such sale and any and all other sales advertised or conducted in such manner as to reasonably convey to the public that upon disposal of the stock of goods on hand the business will cease and be discontinued exemptions the following persons shall be exempt from the provisions of this article 1 persons acting pursuant to an order of the process of a court of competent jurisdiction  2 persons acting in accordance with their powers and duties as public officers such as sheriffs and marshals  3 duly licensed auctioneers selling at auction general regulatory and licensing powers of city clerk the city clerk is authorized to supervise and regulate sales as defined in section 922 and to issue appropriate licenses therefor license required it shall be unlawful for any person to publish or conduct any sale of the type herein defined without a license therefor license application the application for such license shall be filed with the city clerk the application shall be in writing and shall be verified under oath by the applicant the application shall contain a the true name of the owner of the goods wares and merchandise to be offered for sale and the name of the operator of the sale if a person other than the true owner  b a description of the place where such sale is to be held  c the nature of the occupancy whether by lease or sublease and the effective date of termination of such occupancy  d an itemized list of the goods wares and merchandise to be offered for sale  e the source from which the stock was purchased or if not acquired by purchase the manner of such acquisition  f any additional information which the city clerk may require prelicensing investigation upon the filing of the license application the city clerk shall cause the same to be examined and investigated to determine the truth of the statements therein made issuance of license if after such investigation the city clerk is satisfied as to the truth of the statements in such application he may then issue a license permitting the publication and conduct of such sale duration of license  renewal permitted such license shall be for a period not exceeding thirty 30 days except that a renewal may be granted as hereinafter provided renewals  procedure upon satisfactory proof by the licensee that the stock itemized in the original application has not been disposed of the city clerk may renew such license for an additional thirty 30 days or any part thereof such proof shall be furnished to the city clerk it shall contain an itemized list of stock on hand and shall be verified under oath by the applicant license and renewal fees upon filing an application for an original or renewal license the applicant shall pay to the department of engineering bureau of code enforcement and licensing a fee of fifty dollars $5000 if any such application be disapproved such payment shall be returned to the applicant less the sum of five dollars $500 which shall be retained by the city to defray the cost of investigating statements contained in such or statement of fact which is untrue deceptive or misleading b no licensee shall advertise by display or otherwise any merchandise he does not intend to sell at prices set forth in said advertisements this also applies to tags on merchandise show windows shall be so arranged as to clearly show to which merchandise specific tags or show cards apply if any merchandise on display in a window or authorized to suspend or revoke at any time for cause after a hearing any license granted in accordance with this article penalty any person who shall violate or who shall neglect or refuse to comply imprisonment not exceeding sixty 60 days or by both such fine and imprisonment and each day of violation shall constitute a separate offense and be subject to punishment as such article 3  junk new york applicable thereto interest rates records sales of pledges and other pawnbrokers activities declared subject to state law the provisions of the general business law now existing or as hereafter amended relating to pawnbrokers including provisions as to rates of interest records to be kept sale of unredeemed pledges and disposition of proceeds and other pertinent provisions thereof shall be applicable to all persons carrying on the business of pawnbroker and to all licensed pawnbrokers in the city rules and regulations by city clerk the city clerk as the licensing agency of finance andor the department of public works for the purposes of resolving any discrepancies with the applicants application without holding a formal administrative hearing this informal meeting shall be held within seven 7 business days after the commissioner of finance receives the written request for a hearing from the applicant in the event that any outstanding issues are not resolved an administrative hearing shall i be held before a hearing officer chosen by the commissioner of finance who shall not be an employee of the department of finance  ii be recorded by a stenographer  iii take place no later than fifteen 15 business days after the informal meeting the commissioner of finance may adjourn the date only upon the applicant presenting compelling reasons in writing that an adjournment of the hearing date is warranted  iv the applicant shall be allowed to be represented by counsel and shall be allowed to call witnesses on their behalf and conduct crossexamination of all witnesses c upon receipt of the transcript of the administrative hearing the corporation counsel or hisher designee shall have the transcript and all exhibits from the hearing forwarded to the hearing officer the hearing officer shall review the transcript and exhibits and within thirty 30 days from receipt of the transcript and exhibits render a written recommendation to the commissioner of finance as to whether the application for a license should be approved d thirty 30 days after receiving from the hearing officer a transcript of the denial hearing all exhibits submitted at the hearing and the hearing officers written recommendation the commissioner of finance shall conduct a de novo review of the transcript all exhibits submitted at the hearing and the hearing officers written recommendation the commissioner of finance shall determine whether the application for a license should be approved if the determination of the commissioner of finance is that the application be denied the commissioner of finance shall issue a written order containing hisher determination the order shall be drafted within thirty 30 days by the corporation counsel or hisher designee and then signed by the commissioner of finance e any such order issued pursuant to subsection d above shall be served on the applicant pursuant to the provisions of of the new york civil practice law and the corporation counsel or hisher designee shall have the transcript and all exhibits from the hearing forwarded to the hearing officer the hearing officer shall review the transcript and exhibits and within thirty 30 days from receipt of the transcript and exhibits render a written recommendation to the commissioner of finance as to whether the application for a license should be approved d thirty containing hisher determination the order shall be drafted within thirty 30 days by the corporation counsel or hisher designee and then signed by the commissioner of finance e any such order issued used in this article transient retail business means a business conducted in a store hotel house building or structure for the sale at retail of goods wares or merchandise excepting food products and which is intended to be conducted for a temporary period of time and not permanently if the place in which a business is conducted is rented or leased for a period of six 6 months or less such fact shall be presumptive evidence that the business carried on therein is a transient business license required before any person shall commence a transient retail business in the city said person shall obtain a license so to do from the city clerk license application any person desiring to conduct a transient retail business in the city shall present to the city clerk a verified application stating a the name and permanent address of the person desiring to conduct such business  b the place where and the time during which said business is to be conducted  c the name and local address of the person to be in immediate charge of said business  d the character of the merchandise to be dealt in  e the estimated amount of the gross sales which will be made bond the applicant for a license hereunder shall file with the city clerk a cash deposit or bond in an amount of not less than five hundred dollars $50000 and not more than one thousand dollars $100000 the amount to be fixed by the city clerk in proportion to the estimated amount of business to be done under such license conditioned that such person will make a full and complete report of the gross amount of sales made in such transient retail business in the city will file such reports as may be required with the city clerk will faithfully comply with the general municipal law in relation to taxation of transient merchants and with the provisions of this article and will pay the amount of the tax therein levied said bond shall be approved by the corporation counsel as to form and by the city clerk as to its sufficiency reports of stock inventory and sales the licensee shall before the beginning of business file with the city clerk a verified report of the stock on hand and the aggregate value thereof with which it is intended to conduct said business he shall thereafter as further stock is received and within two 2 days after the receipt thereof file a verified report with the city clerk of such added stock and of the aggregate value thereof he shall on monday of each week file a verified report of the stock sold during the preceding week and the amount for which the same was sold at the completion of said transient business he shall file a verified report setting forth the total amount of stock sold and the total amount for which it was sold contents of license licenses hereunder shall state the place where the business is to be conducted and the date of expiration of the term of such business pursuant to the license renewal of license licenses hereunder may be renewed from time to time upon compliance with the provisions of this article tax pursuant to the provisions of the general municipal law as amended a tax shall be levied upon all persons now conducting or who may hereafter conduct a transient retail business in the city tax base and computation the tax under section 995 shall be based upon the gross amount of sales and shall be computed at the same rate as other property is taxed for the year in the city if at the time such tax becomes due and payable the tax rate for the current year of the city has not been fixed the same shall be estimated by the assessors thereof and such rate as estimated shall be the rate at which said persons shall be taxed penalty any person failing to pay said tax or violating any of the provisions of this article shall be guilty of a misdemeanor article 9  secondhand dealers definitions as used in this article identification means an official document issued by the united states government any state county municipality or any ordinance article required all heating system ventilation system air conditioning system refrigeration system fire suppression system and flammable and combustible liquid piping and tank system work shall be done in compliance with this mechanical licensing ordinance article 4 mechanical systems exempted from the mechanical licensing ordinance nothing herein shall make the requirements of this article applicable to the following types of electrical heating appliances or systems a selfcontained prefabricated baseboard or space and radiant heaters  b selfcontained prefabricated heating andor combination heater and airconditioner wall units  and c infrared heatinglighting units gen  new york state uniform fire prevention and building new york state uniform fire prevention and building s requirements and minimum standards pertaining to mechanical installations and maintenance as hereinafter and from time to time amended is hereby adopted and made part of the mechanical licensing ordinance of the city of syracuse gen  construction with other laws whenever a provision of this article is found to be inconsistent with any provision of any applicable statute local law ordinance code or regulation the provision or requirement which is the more restrictive or which establishes the higher standard shall prevail a greater penalty shall not be considered as being more restrictive or establishing a higher standard in the event that any portion of this article or the application thereof to any person or circumstance is adjudged invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction such judgment shall be limited in its operation to the part provision or application directly involved in the controversy in which such judgment shall have been rendered and shall not affect or impair the validity of the remainder of this article or the application thereof to other persons or circumstances gen  liability this article shall not be construed to relieve or lessen the responsibility of any person owning operating controlling installing altering or repairing heating systems ventilation systems air conditioning systems refrigeration systems fire suppression systems andor flammable and combustible liquid piping and tank systems for damages to person or property caused by defect therein nor does the city of syracuse hereby assume any liability or responsibility therefor by reason of inspections authorized herein or permits or licenses issued as herein provided gen  board of mechanical examiners 1 composition a there shall be established a board of mechanical examiners to examine applicants for various mechanical licenses as set forth and defined in this article and to perform such other duties as set forth under the provisions of this article such board shall consist of eight 8 voting members as provided herein b the voting members of the board shall include two 2 hvac contractors  one 1 refrigeration system contractor  one 1 mechanical contractor  one 1 mechanical engineer who is a licensed professional engineer in new york state and is not employed by a mechanical contracting company regulated by this article  one 1 individual who is a licensed fire protection engineer  one 1 flammable and combustible liquid piping and tank system contractor  and one 1 fire suppression system contractor c there will be three 3 nonvoting members on the board who will serve without compensation the chief of the syracuse fire department or his designee the director of the division of code enforcement or his designee and the city engineer or his designee d the members of the board shall elect a chairperson who shall refrain from voting unless his vote is necessary to break a tie and a secretary from the voting members of the board to serve for a twoyear term 2 quorum of the board four 4 voting members of the board shall constitute a quorum and the votes of a majority of all voting members present shall be necessary for any official action in the event that the chairperson is not present at a meeting an acting chairperson will be selected from among those members of the board present at such meeting 3 appointment and term a the voting members of the board shall be appointed by the mayor and shall serve for fouryear terms or until their successors are appointed except that the mayor may provide that four 4 of the members first appointed hereunder shall serve for a twoyear term b the designees of the director of the division of code enforcement city engineer and the chief of the syracuse fire department may serve on the board as long as they are employed in that position with the city of syracuse 4 powers and duties the board shall be responsible for the establishment and maintenance of a city licensing system for mechanical contractors they shall establish the minimum qualifications for each mechanical license issued pursuant to this article and they shall review and approve applicants for mechanical licenses based upon the qualifications established herein and they shall develop or adopt examinations therefor the board shall be responsible for conducting hearings to investigate alleged deviations from this articles requirements it shall conduct the hearings as detailed in section 91234 5 meetings meetings shall be called at the discretion of the chairman or at the written request of a board member provided that such written notice is delivered to the chairman at least five 5 working days in advance of such special meeting such special meetings shall be held within ten 10 working days of receipt of said request a quorum of the members must be present in order to open any meeting all meetings of the board must be open to the public as is required by public officers law open meetings law unless an executive session is called in conformance with said laws 6 rules and regulations the board shall establish and publish rules and regulations governing its administration of examinations gen  licenses 1 categories licenses shall be issued in one 1 or more of the following categories as defined in section 9115 above a master hvac mechanical license b limited hvac mechanical license c residential hvac mechanical license d special hvac mechanical license e master refrigeration mechanical license f limited refrigeration mechanical license g special refrigeration mechanical license h water based fire suppression mechanical license i chemical based fire suppression mechanical license j flammable and combustible liquid mechanical license 2 license required a no person or persons shall engage in or conduct the business of installing altering maintaining or repairing any heating system ventilation system air conditioning system refrigeration system fire suppression system andor flammable and combustible liquid piping and tank system in the city of syracuse unless licensed therefor pursuant to this article or unless working under the direct supervision of a person who is licensed pursuant to this article or unless working under the general supervision of a supervisor or company officer who is licensed pursuant to this article and who carries the full responsibility of the mechanical work performed under his jurisdiction as his primary duty b no proprietorship partnership firm or corporation which is engaged in or is conducting the business of installing altering maintaining or repairing any heating system ventilation system air conditioning system refrigeration system fire suppression system andor flammable and combustible liquid piping and tank system in the city of syracuse which requires a license by the terms of this article shall perform such work without at least one 1 person in his full time employ duly licensed in accordance with the provisions of this article and said license holder shall assume the responsibility for his own work and that of any unlicensed workers under his jurisdiction c in the event of the death disability for a period of thirty 30 days or termination of the license holders employment the proprietorship partnership firm or corporation which employed said license holder may only continue in business for sixty 60 days to complete existing permit work without a license holder and to give the proprietorship partnership firm or corporation adequate time to obtain to obtain a qualified license holder d a license shall not be required by provisions of this section for persons executing the following classes of work 1 the connection or disconnection of portable plugin appliances to permanently installed receptacles 2 manufacture assembly or testing of heating systems ventilation systems air conditioning systems refrigeration systems fire suppression systems andor flammable and combustible liquid piping and tank systems machinery apparatus materials or equipment by an individual proprietorship partnership firm or corporation engaged in manufacturing thereof as its principal business but not including any permanent wiring other than that involved in testing or making electrical connections on such machinery apparatus or equipment 3 a public utility company engaged in the emergency servicing of heating equipment and the employees of such public utility company who are duly certified by their employer as qualified to provide emergency service to heating equipment so long as acting under the direction and for the benefit of said public utility company 3 who may obtain a license a a license shall be granted to an applicant who has proven to the satisfaction of the board that he is a competent mechanical contractor qualified to do heating system ventilation system air conditioning system refrigeration system fire suppression system andor flammable and combustible liquid piping and tank system contracting construction and installation work and by passing the specific licensing examination therefor to show that he possesses a working knowledge of the natural laws and functions of said mechanical field and the appliances apparatus and devices for heating systems ventilation systems air conditioning systems refrigeration systems fire suppression systems andor flammable and combustible liquid piping and tank systems used and required in the scope of work for which he is making application combined with a practical working knowledge of the city ordinances new york state uniform fire prevention and building generally accepted standards relating to heating systems ventilation systems air conditioning systems refrigeration systems fire suppression systems andor flammable and combustible liquid piping and tank systems work b no person shall be examined by the board for any of the licenses conferred by this article unless he shall possess the following level of experience 1 master hvac mechanical license a minimum of ten 10 years experience directly related to the heating ventilating and air conditioning hvac industry of which five 5 years shall have been working directly on the installation and maintenance of heating systems ventilation systems and air conditioning systems and three 3 of those five 5 years shall have been on new construction of commercial andor industrial installations 2 limited hvac mechanical license a minimum of five 5 years experience directly related to the heating ventilating and air conditioning hvac industry of which a minimum of three 3 years shall have been working directly on the installation and maintenance of heating systems ventilation systems and air conditioning systems 3 residential hvac mechanical license a minimum of five 5 years experience directly related to the installation and maintenance of heating systems ventilation systems and air conditioning systems in new or existing residential structures intended or designed for or used only as the home or residence of not more than two 2 distinct families and small commercial buildings of up to two thousand five hundred 2500 square feet utilizing air conditioning of up to a maximum of five 5 tons furnaces of up to a maximum of two hundred 200 mbh input and boilers of up to a maximum three hundred ninetynine 399 mbh input 4 special hvac mechanical license a minimum of five 5 years experience directly related to the installation alteration maintenance and repair of any commercial kitchen hood exhaust and makeup air systems connecting ductwork grease filter fire andor motorized dampers 5 refrigeration mechanical licenses a minimum of five 5 years experience directly related to the installation of refrigeration systems 6 fire suppression mechanical licenses a minimum of five 5 years experience directly related to the layout installation alteration maintenance and repair of fire suppression systems 7 flammable and combustible liquid mechanical license a minimum of five 5 years experience directly related to the installation alteration maintenance and repair of flammable and combustible liquid piping and tank systems c the board may in its discretion adjust the requirements of this section in unusual cases where a persons training and experience shall in the opinion of the board be the substantial
