article 3  milk and milk products definitions as used in this article vehicle means any cart truck wagon or vehicle whatsoever commissioner of health means the commissioner of health of the onondaga county health district  license required it shall be unlawful for any person to peddle milk or milk products or deliver the same from any vehicle to the inhabitants of the city or to any firm copartnership or corporation or in and upon any of the public streets squares or alleys of the city without first having been duly licensed to do the same by the commissioner of licenses as hereinafter provided  license application to commissioner of licenses  contents application for a license hereunder shall be made in writing to the commissioner of licenses of the city by the person to be licensed on forms to be furnished by said commissioner the application shall contain such information as to name and address of the applicant sanitation of the vehicle to be used and related matters affecting public health as said commissioner may reasonably require  investigation by commissioner of health upon receipt of an application for a license the commissioner of licenses shall cause to be made an investigation by the commissioner of health to determine whether the applicant meets the requirements of law of the sanitary the county of onondaga and the rules and regulations therein contained no license shall be issued until the commissioner of health has advised the commissioner of licenses that the applicant has met with his approval  mayor and commissioner of licenses to sign licenses licenses hereunder shall be signed by the commissioner of licenses and countersigned by the mayor either by their respective signatures or by use of a stamp bearing a facsimile of their signatures  separate license required for each vehicle a separate license shall be required for each vehicle used license fee the fee for a license under this article shall be twenty dollars $2000 payable in advance gen   gen  vehicle identification plates every licensee shall cause the licensed vehicle or vehicles to be numbered by the number indicated by the commissioner of licenses who shall furnish to such licensee at the time of issuance of the license without additional charge a metal plate bearing such identification number and the year of issuance of license such plate shall be at all times affixed to and remain affixed to the vehicle so licensed in a conspicuous place where same may be plainly seen during the life of such license  duration of license each license shall expire unless sooner revoked as herein provided on december thirtyfirst of the year in which issued revocation of license when it shall appear to the commissioner of health that such licensee has sold or delivered or caused or permitted any person for him to sell or deliver in the city any adulterated or unwholesome milk or milk products or has in any manner violated any of the applicable provisions of law or of the sanitary onondaga county or of this article the said commissioner shall be empowered to recommend to the commissioner of licenses in writing that such license should be revoked upon such recommendation the commissioner of licenses shall institute a proceeding to revoke the license according to law  prohibited hours of delivery of fluid milk and cream no person shall deliver or cause to be delivered by vehicle or otherwise and fluid milk or cream to any wholesale establishment for use or sale on the premises except between the hours of  am and  pm of any day  or to the residence of any consumer or to any store or other place of business for sale off said premises except between the hours of  am and  pm of any day penalty for violation of section 1436 any person violating section 1436 shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall upon conviction be punishable by a penalty not exceeding twentyfive dollars $2500 and not exceeding thirty 30 days imprisonment or both for the first offense and not exceeding a fine of fifty dollars $5000 or not exceeding sixty 60 days imprisonment or both for any subsequent offense article 4  food and mobile food vendors checks due to the interaction between the vendors and the general public the city has an interest in protecting the health safety and welfare of the public accordingly the city will conduct a criminal background check on each applicant for a license under this article in accordance with 16 of the new york state executive law the commissioner of finance will make a determination in accordance with a of the new york state correction law specifically a the criminal background check shall initially be reviewed by an individual who is not directly involved in the final determination for purposes of this section this individual shall be called a screener b the screener shall review the criminal background check and determine if the applicant has been convicted of i any felony in the five 5 years preceding the date of the application for a crime involving a theft  b fraud  c the sale of marijuana  or d the sale of controlled substances ii any misdemeanor in the two 2 years preceding the date of the application for a crime involving a theft  b fraud  c the sale of marijuana  d the sale of controlled substances  e selling stolen goods  f unlawfully dealing with a child  or g violations of the alcoholic beverage control law c in the event that the background check is free from convictions for any of the offenses enumerated above the screener shall communicate to the commissioner of finance that the applicants background is clear even if there are other convictions contained within the background check a background check with convictions for offenses others than the ones set forth above shall have the same effect as a background check with no convictions d in the event that the applicants background check does contain one of the above enumerated offenses the screener shall deliver to the commissioner of finance the background report along with a notation of which offense or offenses of the above enumerated offenses necessitate further review e the commissioner of finance shall communicate to the applicant via certified letter that the background check revealed one of the above enumerated offenses the commissioner of finance shall include a copy of the full background check with this correspondence the letter shall inform the applicant of the opportunity to provide any information to the commissioner of finance regarding rehabilitation andor good conduct the applicant shall furnish such information if any in writing to the director of code enforcement within ten 10 days of the date of the certified letter sent from the director of code enforcement f after the ten 10 days have elapsed the commissioner of finance shall then review the background check in accordance with a of the correction law of new york state even if the applicant has not submitted any information regarding rehabilitation andor good conduct gen  requirements for the issuance of a license no license shall be issued by the commissioner of finance until a the applicant license and shall provide that the policy shall not be terminated or canceled without thirty 30 days written notice to the commissioner of finance e applicant submits written approval from the fire chief in the event a propane tank heatproducing device or open flame is to be used in conjunction with the applicants food vending f applicant submits written approval of the issuance of a permit gen  effective date this article shall take effect immediately gen  secs 14541457  reserved article 5  end of academic year solid waste collection program for the special neighborhood district purpose and intent at the end of each academic year a large amount of solid waste is generated in the special neighborhood district adjacent to syracuse university to more effectively handle the large amount of household solid waste set out to the curb in this neighborhood district the city of syracuse hereby establishes a voluntary solid waste collection program for the special neighborhood district adjacent to syracuse university that shall be referred to as the end of academic year university area trash collection program this program is voluntary to participate in and in exchange for registration and payment of the requisite fee the department of public works shall provide extra trash pickups to registered properties throughout the designated program dates gen  applicability this program shall be available to all property owners in the special neighborhood district and is voluntary in order to be eligible for this program you shall be the owner of property in the special neighborhood district adjacent to syracuse university and shall have completed a registration form provided by the department of public works to optin to this special trash collection program and paid the required registration fee a registration form along with the applicable fee must be submitted for each property the owner wishes to register for this special trash collection program gen  program dates the time period for the program shall be not less than a three week period commencing and ending on the dates set by the commissioner of the department of public works the dates set by the commissioner shall be in accordance with the final examination and graduation schedules of the local colleges and universities gen  registration a registration for the program shall be submitted to the department of public works prior to the start date of the program property owners wishing to register their property or properties shall complete the registration forms supplied by the department of public works each property shall be registered separately and requires payment of a fee b the information requested from the property owner on the registration form shall include but not be limited to 1 address of property being registered  2 property owners name and physical address post office boxes are not acceptable  and 3 the name and physical address of the property manager if the property owner lives outside the counties of onondaga cayuga madison oswego or cortland c the registration form shall also include the following information 1 the due date that all registration forms must be received by the department of public works  2 the start and end dates of the voluntary program  3 a notice that any illegal setouts placed at the curb after the end date of the voluntary program could be subject to a separate fee for each occurrence  4 a notice that the program is voluntary and property owners are not required to participate gen  fees the fee to property owners to participate in the voluntary program shall be two hundred twentyfive dollars $22500 per property being registered the property owner may pay the fee at the time of registration or if the fee is not paid at the time of registration the fee shall be added to the property taxes of the property registered gen  size of setouts throughout the duration of the voluntary program each setout of household waste shall not exceed two cubic yards any setouts of household waste exceeding two cubic yards will be considered illegal and may be subject to additional fines regardless of registration in the program property owners participating in the voluntary program may request special pickups for extralarge setouts from the department of public works gen  severability in the event any clause sentence paragraph musical instruments no person shall operate play or perform or shall assist or take part in operating playing or performing on any organ bugle or other musical instrument in or of the streets or public places of the city without permission of the mayor or common council drunkenness no person shall be in a state of intoxication in any highway street alley or public place in the city or in any private house or place to the annoyance of any person article 2  disorderly houses and gambling disorderly houses legislative findings in the interest of protecting the general welfare and public safety this common council finds that certain properties within the city exhibit a continued pattern of activities that disrupt the quiet enjoyment of the surrounding neighborhoods and threaten public safety these activities are criminal in nature and include but are not limited to excessive noise open container violations illegal gambling prostitution assaults and general mayhem in order to restore public safety this common council hereby amends chapter 16 article 2 section 166 to provide the chief of police with an additional mechanism for dealing with these public safety issues no person shall keep or maintain or inhabit or in any way be connected with or in any way contribute to the support of any disorderly house or house of ill fame or knowingly own or be interested in as a proprietor or landlord of any such house a disorderly house is hereby defined as one which exhibits an ongoing pattern of criminal activities including not limited to excessive noise open container violations illegal gambling prostitution assaults and general mayhem that disrupt the quiet enjoyment of the surrounding neighborhoods and threatens public safety the chief of police or his designee is hereby authorized to declare a house apartment or any similar dwelling place hereinafter referred to as the premises as disorderly and as such a threat to public safety if the following criteria are met one 1 or more arrests and three 3 or more documented chronic complaints to the police regarding a pattern of criminal activity have been made on or in connection with the premises for any of the violations set forth in section 452 chapter 45 of the revised general ordinances of the city of syracuse entitled nuisance abatement in a thirtyday period  and documented chronic 911 calls for police assistance or complaint driven calls to other sources that are referred to the police department consisting of at least three 3 calls in a thirtyday period  or notwithstanding the foregoing to the extent such arrests chronic complaints or 911 calls relate to or involves domestic violence in violation of new york penal law 05 or 12010 shall not be considered by the chief of police as a qualifying arrest complaint or 911 call for purposes of enforcement of this chapter notwithstanding the foregoing to the extent such arrests chronic complaints or 911 calls relate to or involve requests for police protection or assistance based on a reasonable fear of injury to a person or property including but not limited to violations of new york penal law stalking and 21551 violating orders of protection such arrests chronic complaints or 911 calls shall not be considered by the chief of police as a qualifying arrest complaint or 911 call for purposes of enforcement of this chapter the chief of police or his designee shall designate a premise disorderly pursuant to this section by notice personally delivered to the property owner of record or by certified mail in addition if necessary the chief of police is authorized to use such other methods of service for the aforementioned notice as is authorized by applicable law such notice shall request that the property owner attend an informal meeting with the police and other relevant city officials to address the concerns that lead to the premises being designated as disorderly the property owner will then have thirty 30 days after such meeting to submit to the chief of police or his designee a plan in writing that addresses the issues causing the premises to be declared disorderly failure by the property owner to respond to the request for such a meeting or to address the issues cited by the chief of police or his designee within thirty 30 days shall subject the property owner to the fine set forth in section 18 of chapter 1 of the revised general ordinances of the city of syracuse to be adjudicated in syracuse city court or such other court of competent jurisdiction in accordance with applicable law gen  gambling except as provided in chapter 5 article 7 of these revised general ordinances relating to bingo no person shall keep or be an inmate of a gambling house or room or visit veterinarian stating that the dog is too young to be vaccinated or because of old age or another reason the life of the dog would be endangered by the administration of vaccine an electronic copy of the rabies certificate or certified statement information shall be made and maintained with the clerks electronic copy of the application and dog license in the case of a dog being redeemed or adopted 16304 shall be imposed c if the dog continues to disturb the peace after the owner has been notified pursuant to section 16304 and subsection 16b then the dog officer shall notify the owner either by after the aforementioned notice has been received by the owner in addition the dog officer shall issue an appearance ticket to impose the fine authorized by section 16 herein d if the dog control order authorizing the dog control officer to enter upon the property in order to seize the dog pursuant to this article the corporation counsel shall assist the dog control officer in effectuating this process gen  penalties a any violation of shall be deemed an offense and shall be punishable by a fine of not less than one hundred dollars $10000 nor more than one hundred fifty dollars $15000 suffer or permit such dog to go unconfined on the premises of such person a dangerous dog is unconfined as the term is used in this section if such dog is not securely confined indoors or confined in a securely enclosed and locked pen or a dog run area upon the premises of said person and if such premises do not display a sign clearly legible and visible from outside the premises that a dangerous dog is harbored therein such pen or dog run area must also have either sides six 6 feet high or a secure top if the pen or structure has no bottom secured to the sides the sides must be imbedded into the ground no less than one foot any pen structure or fence constructed shall comply with any ordinances or local laws heretofore enacted by the city of syracuse b no person owning or harboring or having the care of a dangerous dog shall suffer or permit such dog to go beyond the premises of such person unless such dog is securely muzzled and restrained with a chain having a minimum tensile strength of three hundred 300 pounds and not exceeding three 3 feet in length c no person shall own or harbor any dog for the purpose of dog fighting or train torment badger bait or use any dog for the purposes of causing or encouraging said dog to unprovoked attacks upon human beings or domestic animals d no person shall possess with intent to sell or offer for sale breed or buy or attempt to buy within the city any dangerous dog e the owner of a dangerous dog shall maintain in full force and effect a liability insurance policy of one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 for personal injury or death of any person resulting from an attack of such dangerous dog gen    enforcement a in the event that a dog control officer or any person has probable cause to believe that a dangerous dog is hearing pursuant to section 121 of the agriculture and markets law in the event that a dog control officer has probable cause to believe that a dangerous dog is being harbored or housed in violation of subsections 16308a and b and presents a clear and present danger to persons or domestic animals the dog control officer may seize and impound the dangerous dog immediately and shall within fortyeight 48 hours seek court order of impoundment pending a hearing pursuant to the agriculture and markets law b in addition to the order of confinement or destruction of the dog which may be impounded pursuant to section 121 of the agriculture and markets law the court may impose penalties as provided in section 163010 herein gen    penalties a any person violating any provision of this or other domestic animals d any person found guilty of violating this section shall pay all expenses including shelter food and veterinary expenses necessitated by the seizure of any dog for the shall be adjudged invalid such adjudication shall apply only to the section paragraph subdivision or clause so adjudged and the balance of this article shall remain valid and effective gen  article 87  protection of dogs   short title  scope this article shall be known as the syracuse dog protection shall apply to the division of dog control of the department of parks and recreation gen  findings often referred to as mans best friend dogs are companions valued for the animals loyal behavioral traits and ability to be kept in close proximity to people in domestic situations some dogs are left outdoors without means to protect themselves these animals are exposed and vulnerable to changing weather conditions in the city of syracuse weather conditions are famously known to change quickly and dramatically by way of example dangerous conditions include temperatures at extreme ends of the spectrum subzero wind chills sun thunderstorms and high humidity no dog should be left outside tethered and exposed to the weather for prolonged periods when the temperature falls below the freezing point of water with temperatures below the freezing point a dog may experience harm and damage to its skin causing pain similarly dogs left outside tethered and exposed for prolonged periods when the temperature rises to greater than 90 fahrenheit are believed likely to experience heatstroke or other bodily harm consistent with municipal home rule law and the revised general ordinances of the city of syracuse this article provides for the health and wellbeing of dogs in the city of syracuse by regulating the manner in which dogs may be kept outdoors this article is intended to provide greater protection for tethered dogs than found within new york state agriculture and markets law b and 353 at the time of adoption humane treatment of dogs not only provides these animals with a better quality of life but may also reduce the likelihood of dogs having harmful behaviors towards other animals it is believed that most dogs tethered outside for prolonged periods do not have adequate protection specifically excluded from coverage under this article shall be those dogs who are used as working dogs or hunting dogs as it is believed that the risks of harm to such dogs is not present in the same way gen  prohibition no person who owns or has custody or control of a dog shall knowingly leave such dog tethered outdoors for longer than a period of two 2 continuous hours at such time as when either 1 the actual air temperature is lower than 32 fahrenheit not accounting for wind chill 2 the actual air temperature is greater than 90 fahrenheit no accounting for humidity levels or 3 during such period of time as extreme weather conditions exist where any such condition in 1 2 or 3 above is actually known to such person or reasonably should have been known to such person actual harm or injury need not be shown to prove a violation of the prohibition in this subsection a rebuttable presumptions extreme weather conditions shall be presumed to have been present in the event that a weather alert was in effect for a region reasonably construed and commonly understood to be affecting the region in which the dog was left outdoors and during such time as the dog was left outdoors a dog exhibiting signs of frostbite shall be presumed to have been left outdoors for longer than a period of two 2 continuous hours at such time as when the actual air temperature was lower than 32 fahrenheit a dog exhibiting signs of heatstroke shall be presumed to have been left outdoors for longer than a period of two 2 continuous hours at such time as when the actual air temperature was greater than 90 fahrenheit b exceptions this article shall not apply 1 to working dogs  2 to hunting dogs  3 to dogs on a leash or other restraint under direct supervision or control of persons actively engaged in recreational activities including walking jogging or running  and 4 to dogs required to be tethered under an applicable law rule regulation or court order c definitions for purposes of this article the terms listed below have specific definitions as follows 1 extreme weather conditions shall include inclement weather being weather conditions that are likely to adversely affect the health or safety of the dog including but not limited to rain sleet ice snow wind or extreme heat and cold and otherwise consistent with the provisions of new york state agriculture and markets law b 1 b as may be amended from time to time 2 weather alert shall mean a broadcast of the national weather service regarding one of the following weatherrelated events reasonably construed to be affecting the region in which the dog was left outdoors blizzard warning severe thunderstorm watch or warning severe weather statement tornado watch or warning winter storm watch or warning 3 outdoors shall mean a location outside a permanent structure capable of habitation or occupancy by people during an extreme weather event or period of time with temperatures falling below 32 fahrenheit or greater than 90 fahrenheit depending on the applicable weather conditions such as a house apartment building or office building examples of nonsuitable outdoor structures include without limitation wire cages and noninsulated structures including those made of plastic eg calf hutch 4 tether shall include the actions of leashing fastening securing chaining tying or otherwise restraining a dog to any stationary object outdoors 5 working dog shall mean any dog that is trained to herd andor protect livestock control bird andor wildlife populations or otherwise is actually or has been used in connection with farming or agricultural purposes 6 hunting dog shall mean any dog that is trained to aid in taking of wildlife and is actually or has been used for such purposes consistent with applicable law or regulation including environmental conservation law local permits gen    enforcement penalties and registration obligations a enforcement officers this article shall be enforced by the city of syracuse dog control officers city of syracuse police officers onondaga county sheriffs office or designee and may also be enforced by any police officer local dog control officer peace officers animal control officer new york state police having jurisdiction within onondaga county or any other officers as may be designated by the common council via ordinance from time to time where any such officer shall be an enforcement officer such enforcement officers shall have the authority to enforce the provisions of this article and to take such necessary and related enforcement actions including without limitation accepting recording and investigating complaints issuing appearance tickets obtaining supporting depositions and preparing and submitting criminal and civil complaints to a court of competent jurisdiction b classification of offense any person who violates the prohibition found within section 163014 of this article shall upon conviction thereof be guilty of a violation as defined in of the new york stale penal law as may be amended from time to time each calendar day in which such person violates section 163014 of this article shall constitute a separate offense c penalties and registration the court in its discretion may impose a sentence of imprisonment to be fixed by the court for a term not to exceed fifteen 15 days consistent with 4 of the new york state penal law a sentence to pay an amount to be fixed by the court not exceeding the amount of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 consistent with 4 of the new york state penal law or both the court may also elect to cause the dogs underlying the basis of the conviction to be surrendered or otherwise forfeited by the person after such conviction the surrender or forfeiture shall be to an enforcement officer as provided herein above in lieu of or in addition to any other penalty imposed under this article the court may impose upon any person who fails to comply with section 163014 of this article a civil penalty enforceable and collectable by the city of syracuse in the amount of one hundred fifty dollars $15000 for a first offense two hundred fifty dollars $25000 for a second offense and five hundred dollars $50000 for each additional offense d disposition of fines all fines collected pursuant to this article shall be the sole property of the city of syracuse kept and accounted for separately to be used for promoting animal welfare within the city of syracuse including programs of public education gen    severability if any clause sentence paragraph section subdivision or other part of this article or its applications shall be adjudged by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid or unconstitutional such order or judgment shall not affect impair or otherwise invalidate the remainder of this article which shall remain in full force and effect except as expressly limited by such order or judgment gen    reverse preemption this law shall be null and void on the day that statewide or federal legislation goes into effect incorporating either the same or substantially similar provisions as are contained in this law or in the event that a pertinent state or federal administrative agency issues and promulgates regulations preempting such action by the city of syracuse the syracuse common council may determine via resolution whether or not identical or substantially similar statewide legislation has been enacted for the purposes of triggering the provisions of this section gen    effective date this article shall take effect immediately gen  article 9  offenses against religious worship and the sabbath disturbance of worshippers no person shall disturb any person violating the provisions of section 1633 shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and shall upon conviction thereof be liable to a fine not exceeding ten dollars $1000 or by imprisonment in the twenty dollars $2000 and by imprisonment in said penitentiary not exceeding twenty 20 days article 10  public assemblies and parades  display of flags assemblies and parades in streets permission required a purpose it is the purpose of this section to give sufficient time prior to the described events involving a large concentration of persons upon the city streets to permit city departments and others affected thereby to discharge their duties in providing 1 protection for said persons  2 protection for the traveling public  and 3 continuity and coordination of emergency services to the community b permits required no persons society or organization of any name or nature shall assemble congregate parade or march in or of the streets of the city without first securing a permit therefor in accordance with this section c written application for a permit upon forms available for such purposes shall be made at the office of the chief of police not less than fortyeight 48 hours preceding the event the applicant must demonstrate that the event is being conducted for lawful purposes and that it will not interfere unduly with the public health and safety the applicant shall state the number of persons expected to participate in the event the location or route to be followed the duration of the event and such other related information as may be required d upon reviewing and approving said application the chief of police shall transmit a copy of said permit to the mayor the chief of fire the traffic division command officer and such other city departments that may be affected by the event and the ambulance service for the community e the applicant shall carry a copy of said permit on his person during said event and shall be the designated person available to police officers for the transmission of messages and instructions to all persons attending the event f all persons attending the event shall obey the lawful commands of police officers and shall at all times conduct themselves in a lawful manner g exemptions no permit shall be required for movements of school children when under the supervision of school personnel nor for lawful assemblages congregations parades or marches solely upon the public sidewalks  display of flag at public assemblies  prohibited flags all assemblies warranted by law held in any of the streets of the city where public discussions are held shall have the american flag conspicuously displayed at all times during the holding of such assemblies no red or black flag and no banner ensign or sign having upon it any inscription opposed to organized government or which is sacrilegious or which may be derogatory to public morals shall be displayed at any such assembly or in any public place or carried streets of the city in any procession or parade penalty for violation of section 1636 any person who shall violate any provision of section 1636 shall upon conviction thereof be punished by a fine of not more than one hundred dollars $10000 or by imprisonment for not exceeding ten 10 days or by both such fine and imprisonment article 11  offenses against property trespassing generally any person found general ordinances of the city  however inasmuch as an art 14  1650 already existed said provisions have been included as art 135 and the last section of the article has been renumbered from  1650 to  16491 cross reference glass beverage containers pt o  1731 legislative intent the city recognizes that the carrying of an open container of any alcoholic beverage must be adequately controlled for the following reasons 1 the presence of intoxicated individuals on the street or public places is annoying and disturbing to workers shoppers merchants church goers and others walking in the downtown area or other parts of the city 2 an open container law will limit consumption to specific areas such as restaurants bars and private residences and discourage drinking of alcoholic beverages in the streets and other public places 3 an open container law will curtail potential problems in the streets and in parks which may occur when groups of individuals have consumed an excessive amount of an alcoholic beverage in public places and may become disorderly 4 an open container law as herein provided will assist in eliminating litter in public areas it has been found that individuals who consume alcoholic beverages in public to an excess fail to properly dispose of bottles furthermore broken glass is dangerous to pedestrians and particularly children and automobiles when thrown into city streets gen   gen  definitions 1 alcoholic beverage as used in this article shall mean and include alcohol liquor spirits wine beer and every liquid or solid patented or not containing alcohol spirits wine or beer and capable of being consumed by a human being 2 public place shall mean a place to which the public or a substantial group of persons has access including but not limited to any highway street road sidewalk lane public parking lot shopping area playground school property park or any and all publicly owned land located within the city except that the definition of a public place shall not include the specific confines of those premises duly licensed for the sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages on the premises or within 3 public parking lot shall mean a parking area for one or more vehicles designed to be used by patrons of any commercial industrial professional or eleemosynary place of business 4 container shall mean any bottle can glass cup or similar article designed to hold or capable of holding a liquid 5 special event shall mean and include a fair block party or other community gathering at any public place except a public park gen  restrictions unless otherwise authorized and except as hereinafter provided no person shall drink or consume an alcoholic beverage or possess with intent to drink or consume an open container containing an alcoholic beverage in or on any public place public parking lot school property city cemetery public park or on private property without the invitation or permission of the owner possession of an open container containing an alcoholic beverage by any person shall create a rebuttable presumption that such person did intend to consume the contents thereof in violation of this section this section shall not apply 1 within the specific confines of those premises duly licensed for the sale or consumption of alcoholic beverages on the premises or within  or 2 at any park as abandoned and unclaimed vehicles to citys use pt l  1516 purposes the outdoor storage of abandoned junked or discarded motor vehicles upon public or private property within the city of syracuse is dangerous unsightly and a detriment to the preservation of public health the protection of property and the safety and welfare of the residents of the city of syracuse the outdoor storage of abandoned junked or discarded motor vehicles upon such properties constitutes an attractive nuisance to children and a peril to the safety and welfare of the residents of the city of syracuse since the fuel tanks frequently contain gasoline or gasoline fumes and may be subject to explosion in case of fire such storage depreciates the value of neighboring properties and is unsightly and discourages the orderly progressive development of the city of syracuse the control of the outdoor storage of abandoned junked or discarded motor vehicles upon public or private property is therefore regulated for the preservation of the public health safety and welfare of the residents of the city of syracuse   gen  definitions as used in this article the following terms shall mean as indicated below a motor vehicle every vehicle so defined as such by the new york vehicle and traffic law and as the same may be amended b abandoned the term abandoned with regard to a motor vehicle shall mean the intent of the owner of the motor vehicle not to use the motor vehicle on the public highways the intent of the owner of the motor vehicle may be determined by the physical condition of the motor vehicle the length of time since the motor vehicle has last been used on the public highway and whether the motor vehicle is licensed or unlicensed c junked the term junked shall mean any motor vehicle in such condition as to cost more to repair to place such motor vehicle in operating condition than the maximum retail value of the motor vehicle d discarded the term discarded shall mean any motor vehicle which the owner thereof does not intend to recover possession thereof or any motor vehicle to which ownership cannot be reasonably determined e unlicensed motor vehicle the term unlicensed motor vehicle shall mean any motor vehicle which is not validly licensed with the proper authorities   gen  outdoor storage of abandoned junked or discarded motor vehicles on public or private property parties prohibited no responsible person shall sponsor conduct host invite or permit a nuisance party gen  police authorized to cease nuisance parties any police officer or peace officer who observes a nuisance party occurring may order that the nuisance party be ceased and order all nonresidents on the premises where the nuisance party has occurred to leave the premises immediately gen  remaining on premises prohibited no person shall remain on the premises where a nuisance party has been ordered to be ceased by an officer of the city of syracuse police department unless the person resides at the premises where the nuisance party has occurred gen  penalties any violation of the provisions of this article shall constitute an offense punishable by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars to enforce the provisions of aa of the general municipal law and of the education law  editors note did not specifically amend the   hence inclusion has been at the discretion of the editor data collection 1 as used in this section racial profiling means the practice of stopping a suspect based on a broad set of criteria which casts suspicion on an entire class of people without any individualized suspicion of the particular person being stopped 2 the public safety committee of the common council of the city of syracuse shall work with the syracuse police department to ensure that adequate efforts are made to identify and eliminate any instances of racial profiling by police officers in the performance of their official duties 3 the chief of police of the city of syracuse shall develop policies and procedures on how to identify and prevent racial profiling by police officers and shall submit them to the public safety committee of the common council of the city of syracuse for review not later than  if the public safety committee approves such policies and procedures the policies and procedures shall be included in a the new recruit basic training curriculum  b any inservice training for veteran officers  and c any supervisory training for all superior officers 4 the citizen review board shall establish a procedure whereby any person who alleges that an incident of racial profiling has occurred may register a complaint the citizen review board shall periodically analyze such complaints and shall share the data with the chief of police the mayor and the common council this data shall be made available to the public 5 all appearance tickets and arrest reports for quality of life offenses to be prosecuted in community court shall include fields for the officer to note the race of the person to whom the appearance ticket was issued or who was arrested whether a search of the person or their vehicle was conducted at the time of the issuance of the appearance ticket or arrest and whether the search resulted in the seizure of any weapons or drugs 6 the syracuse police department shall collect data from any issued appearance ticket or arrest regarding the following information a identifying characteristics of the individuals who receive appearance tickets or are arrested for any quality of life offense to be prosecuted in community court including the race gender and age of the individual  b the offense  c whether a search was undertaken after the stop  d where a search was initiated the results of the search including whether drugs or weapons were found  e whether the stop resulted in an appearance ticket or arrest the syracuse police department shall maintain statistical information on the data required by this section and shall report that information monthly to the public safety committee this data shall also be available to the public the data collection shall commence not later than  7 individual data acquired under this section shall be used for statistical purposes and may not contain information that may reveal the identity of any individual who is stopped or any law enforcement officer 8 not later than one year after the effective date of this section the public safety committee shall transmit the necessary data collected by the syracuse police department to a university with experience in the analysis of such data for annual preparation of an analysis and report of its findings the public safety committee shall forthwith transmit the universitys annual report to the chief of police the mayor and the common council of the city of syracuse the universitys annual report shall be made available to the public gen  railroads footnotes  1  cross reference pollution control regulations for railroads pt o  2326 article 1  carriers maximum speed of railroads within city it shall be unlawful for any railroad company or any of its officers or employees to propel its cars or locomotives at grade across or along any street within the city limits at a greater rate of speed than one mile in eight 8 minutes maintenance and repair of tracks  notice requiring reduced speed on unsafe tracks every railroad corporation or the lessee of any such corporation using or maintaining tracks in any street avenue or public place in the city shall keep and maintain said tracks in such permanent repair as to assure public safety and the safety of property situated or abutting upon the street avenue or public place along or said tracks are maintained or elsewhere in the event the tracks of any railroad corporation or the lessee of any such corporation using or maintaining tracks in any street avenue or public place in the city shall be in such condition that the operation of cars or trains of cars over the same shall endanger or menace public safety or damage or endanger property situated or abutting upon a street avenue or public place along or said tracks are used or maintained or elsewhere the commissioner of public works is hereby empowered in his discretion to serve a written notice upon any corporation using or maintaining such tracks to immediately make repairs necessary to protect the public safety and the safety of property situated or abutting upon the street avenue or public place in and along which said tracks are used or maintained or elsewhere said notice shall specify the portion or section of tracks where a dangerous condition exists and the repairs which are required to be made in the event the corporation upon which said notice is served shall fail within ten 10 days from the receipt of such notice to make the repairs specified therein and a dangerous condition still exists the commissioner of public works shall cause to be served upon the corporation operating cars or trains of cars upon and along the tracks described in said notice a second written notice stating the maximum rate of speed at which cars or trains of cars shall thereafter be operated upon or along the tracks described therein until the repairs specified in said first notice have been made and the commissioner of public works has inspected and approved of the same after receipt of said second notice defining the maximum rate of speed of said cars and until the repairs specified in said first notice have been made and the commissioner of public works has inspected and approved the same it shall be unlawful for any corporation upon which such notices have been served or any of its agents or employees or any person to operate a car or train of cars upon or along the tracks specified in said notices at a rate of speed greater than that designated in said second notice snow removal by railroads every railroad company occupying any railroad track which traverses any street of the city shall at all times remove accumulations of snow from such street or so level the same as to render the said street free from obstruction to the public use and travel and from danger to person and property one man operation of certain railroad oilelectric engines declared unsafe  prohibition a the common council hereby finds and declares 1 certain railroads have heretofore proposed to operate oilelectric engines within the corporate limits of the city with oneman control and oneman guard  2 within the yard limits of the city such operation would be upon tracks passing numerous unguarded crossings  3 notwithstanding that every improvement is to be encouraged if it pays due regard to the safety of our people and especially those of immature years  4 nevertheless such safety has been openly impaired in similar experiments in binghamton new york and in other municipalities  and 5 a method can be pursued which will be both safe and meet the demands of the claimed improvement b no person corporation trustee receiver or other court officer shall run or operate or cause to be run or operated on any railroad or tracks within the city and fuelelectric engine unless said engine shall be manned with a crew of not less than one engineer and one fireman penalty for violation of section 204 each separate violation of the provisions of section 204 shall be punishable by a fine of not less than one hundred dollars $10000 nor more than five hundred dollars $50000 each day that such engine shall run in violation of the provisions of section 204 shall be deemed to give rise to a separate offense article 2  passengers and riders boarding or other unsafe riding of moving trains or cars prohibited no person within the city limits shall step or jump upon or off the step or platform of any car while the car is in motion nor in any manner hang upon or to any step platform rail bumper or coupling of any car or locomotive while such car or locomotive is in motion unsafe passing between cars of stationary trains prohibited no person within the city limits shall pass between the cars of any stationary train unless such cars are uncoupled and a space made for the application and does not meet with the approval of the engineer he shall inform the owner in writing that the installation as installed does not meet with the approval of the engineer is a violation of this chapter and that its use will be a further violation of this chapter and as such will subject him to the penalties herein provided repairs  permit not required repairs as defined in section 232 to fuel or refuseburning plants or chimneys may be made without first securing a permit emergency alterations nothing in this article shall be construed to prohibit the making of emergency alterations to any chimney fuel or refuseburning plants or device when the necessity for such alteration arises outside of the business hours of the division  provided that the owner contractor installer or other person permitting or making such alterations shall report the same to the division on the first business day after such emergency alterations are commenced and apply for a permit therefor permit not an exemption for violation of chapter the issuance by the engineer of any permit for the construction reconstruction or alteration of any plant or chimney connected with a plant shall not be held to exempt any permittee or any other person who is in possession of any such permit from prosecution on account of the emission of dense smoke fly ash soot cinders noxious acids fumes or gases caused or permitted by any such person article 8  railroads locomotives  fuel and equipment all persons owning operating or controlling steam railroads or locomotives shall use a low volatile solid fuel or oil or diesel or electric engines or locomotives equipped with mechanical fuel burning devices and overfire air devices as defined in section 232 in operating their locomotives within the corporate limits of the city the foregoing provision shall apply to all locomotives either in service or being prepared for service in transfer yard or switching operations but shall not apply to road engines which are served in roundhouses or fire building stations so equipped as to enable them to comply with the other provisions of this chapter regarding the emission of dense smoke section shall apply to overfire air systems these regulations are intended to standardize the installation of overfire air systems which are used to control the emission of off period smoke when so used it is necessary that he system be in operation only during the stoker off periods for a sufficient length of time to prevent smoking systems designed and installed according to these regulations may also be used to provide overfire air for stoker installations in which the furnace volume is limited and it is necessary or desirable to take advantage of subdivision b3 of section 2327 stoker regulations in installations of this type the overfire air system must operate at all times while the stoker is running a number and size of jets the minimum number and size of jets shall be determined from the following table the installer may employ more or larger jets if desired jet sizes shown in the table are nominal diameters of standard iron pipe stoker size lbshr minimum number and size of jets 100 300 3 301 500 4 501 800 41 8011000 51 or 41 10011250 51 or 41 12511500 51 or 61 b spacing of jets jets which are directed from front to rear of firebox or vice versa shall be located symetrically with respect to a vertical plane drawn longitudinally center of the stoker retort jets located six 6 inches or less from the side wall of the boiler firebox shall be directed away from the wall at an angle of six 6 to eight 8 degrees c height of jets above tuyeres the height of the port openings above the top of the stoker tuyeres shall be not less than sixty 60 percent of the required stoker clear height as specified in subdivision d of section 2327 d port openings port sizes specified in subdivision a hereof and plate i refer to ip sizes iron pipe ports shall be reamed at both ends e duct work ducts connecting the fan with the jet header shall be smooth iron or steel pipe having a cross sectional area not less than that of the outlet of the blower housing all pipe ends shall be reamed it is recommended that long radius ells be used where bends in the duct line are necessary and all other precautions be employed to keep friction loss at a minimum a capped oneeighth inch ip connection to the header or a tapped oneeighth inch opening with plug in the duct line as close to the header as possible shall be provided in order that the static pressure may be checked after installation pressure loss in the duct line will be computed from plate ii as explained in subdivision f2 of this section to find the equivalent length of duct for this purpose proceed as follows determine the actual length of straight duct without fittings between the fan and the header to this add the lengths shown in the following table for each fitting in the line pipe size valves fittings 2 7 feet  4 feet  3 13 feet  8 feet  4 20 feet  13 feet  5 28 feet  18 feet  6 36 feet  24 feet  8 53 feet  35 feet  equivalent lengths given under fittings may be used for standard ells tees and crosses for longradius and fortyfive 45 degree ells use onehalf of these amounts f capacity of fan or blower 1 the minimum required capacity of the fan in cubic feet per minute cfm and the static pressure in inches of water sp required at the jets shall be determined from plate i as follows take twothirds of the length of the firebox and locate this dimension on the bottom horizontal line draw a line vertically upward until it intersects the sloping straight line which represents the size of air ports to be used the static pressure required at the jets will be read from this point by its relation to the curved static pressure lines from the point of intersection draw a line horizontally to the left and read the cfm per port on the vertical scale multiply this figure by the number of ports to be employed to give the required cfm of the blower 2 to obtain the static pressure required at the fan or blower add to the static pressure at the jets found in paragraph 1 above the pressure loss in the duct line between the fan and the header determined from plate ii as follows on the left hand vertical scale locate the cfm of the fan determined in paragraph 1 above and draw a line horizontally to the right until it intersects the sloping line representing the size of the duct pipe from this point extend a line vertically downward and read the pressure loss per hundred feet of pipe on the bottom scale multiply this figure by the equivalent length of duct as determined by subdivision e hereof and divide by one hundred 100 article 12  administration enforcement and penalties fees the fees for the inspection of plans issuing of permits and inspection of furnaces or other fuelburning apparatus or devices shall be one dollar $100 payable by the applicant upon acceptance of the application by the engineer fees not refundable after application accepted no refunds of permit fees will be made once an application is accepted acceptance of application not assurance of permit acceptance of an application by the engineer does not necessarily mean that the permit will be granted abatement remedy for emission of dense smoke the escape of dense smoke as prohibited in section 233 may be summarily abated by the engineer an action may be brought by the engineer in the name of the city for such purpose such abatement may be in addition to the penalty hereinafter provided violations and interference prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to refuse to comply with or to assist in the violation of any of the provisions of this chapter or in any manner to hinder obstruct delay resist prevent or otherwise interfere or attempt to interfere with the engineer or his duly authorized representatives or police officers in the performance of any duty herein enjoined or to refuse to permit such inspectors or officers to perform their duty by refusing them or either of them entrance at reasonable hours to any premises in which the provisions of this chapter are being violated or to refuse to permit the inspection or examination of such building establishment premises or enclosures for the purpose of the enforcement of this chapter agents employees tenants and other persons liable for violations of sections 233 234 and 235 all persons participating in any violation of sections 233 dense smoke 234 soot etc or 235 fly ash either as owners proprietors lessees agents tenants managers superintendents captains engineers firemen or janitors or otherwise shall severally be liable therefor and subject to the penalties fixed by this chapter enforcement procedure for repeated or unremedied violations after any owner agent occupant manager or lessee of any premises has been previously notified of three 3 or more violations of this chapter within any consecutive twelve 12 month period in respect to the emission of dense smoke soot cinders fly ash or noxious acids fumes or gases the owner or agent of said premises shall be notified to show cause at a hearing before the engineer on a day certain not less than ten 10 days from the date of notice why such violations continue and what if any remedial measures have been taken if no remedial action has been taken by the violator within ten days after such hearing it shall be the duty of the engineer to institute court proceedings against the violator to invoke the penalties of this chapter for all violations thereof if after a permit for such work as is necessary to eliminate the emission of dense smoke soot cinders fly ash or noxious acids fumes or gases in violation of this chapter has been issued by the engineer the work is not progressing to the satisfaction of the engineer it shall be the duty of the engineer to institute such court proceedings as herein provided enforcement against single violations not waived notwithstanding the provisions of section 2336 the engineer shall have the right to institute court proceedings as herein provided for any one violation of this chapter and nothing herein shall waive that right penalties any person found violating the provisions of this chapter shall upon conviction thereof be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be liable to a fine of not to exceed one hundred dollars $10000 or imprisonment for not to exceed thirty 30 days or both for each such violation violations regardless of the number on any one day shall be considered as one violation for that day abatement proceedings shall be in addition to any penalties prescribed in this section streets and sidewalks footnotes  1  cross reference department of public works pt c street sidewalk or public ground shall restore such street sidewalk or public ground and pavement to as good condition as it was before the restoration is to conform with the city standards as promulgated by the department of public works bureau of technical services a copy of said standards shall be available for purchase at a cost of twentyfive dollars $2500 per set from said department b back filling of any trench in any street or public ground shall not be commenced until the work shall be inspected and accepted by the commissioner of public works as provided in section 2436 such back filling shall be firmly settled with rammers or pounders to such an extent that all the earth which has been taken from the trench shall be replaced therein and not left rounded above the surface of the street in case the trench will receive more earth than was obtained from the excavation therefrom other material of a proper and suitable quantity shall be furnished and pounded in the pavement or other surface improvement shall be replaced within twentyfour 24 hours from the time the excavation is made except in case the pavement to be replaced is asphalt or asphaltina when further reasonable time will be allowed the street shall be left in as good and satisfactory condition as before excavation was begun all refuse or surface earth timbers stone or other material shall be fully and entirely removed from the street immediately by the owner or his plumber or other contractor if not so removed it may be done by the commissioner of public works at the owners expense if the contractors hired by the city on roads newly reconstructed by the city in order to waive the moratorium restriction a letter must be sent to the commissioner of the department of public works requesting the waiver and citing the rationale for the waiver request and said request must be granted approval by the commissioner of the department of public works 3 there shall be a moratorium on request must be granted approval by the commissioner of the department of public works 4 in the event of a gas or electrical emergency all moratorium requirements will be waived gen   gen   gen sidewalk hereafter constructed or reconstructed on public property for public use within the city of syracuse or a person firm corporation nonprofit corporation or organization shall be constructed in a manner that will facilitate use by physically handicapped persons at points of intersections between pedestrian and motorized lines of travel and at other points where necessary to avoid abrupt changes in grade a sidewalk shall slope gradually to street level so as to provide an uninterrupted line of travel the city engineer shall prescribe standards of slope gradient width and slipresistant qualities which will assure that a sidewalk will accommodate a person in a wheelchair or other handicapped persons the city engineer may waive the aforementioned requirements if in his opinion good engineering practice requires such work not be performed at an intersection and if in his opinion such construction creates a safety hazard gen  article 10  poles lights wires and other fixtures determines and declares 1 that the provisions of ground transportation services in the city of syracuse at a reasonable cost is in the public interest  2 that alternative means of ground transportation in the city of syracuse are necessary to insure that such transportation is available to the public at all times  3 that there is a need for ground transportation between the airport and the city  4 that an efficient taxicab system is desirable at the airport  5 that ground transportation other than taxicabs is also desirable at the airport b the common council further finds determines and declares that a public purpose would be served and the interests of the people of the city of syracuse would be promoted by the regulation by the city of all ground transportation services operating within the jurisdiction of the city  that the existing rules regulations and laws governing the provisions of ground transportation services are incomplete unconsolidated and unclear c the common council further finds determines and declares that the consolidation and revision of the laws and regulations governing ground transportation services as provided by this chapter will be performing an essential public and government function gen    transportation board a it is hereby established in and for the city a transportation board such board shall consist of nine 9 ground transportation services and the issuance of additional ground transportation licenses notice of such public hearings shall be advertised in a daily newspaper published in the city once a week for two 2 consecutive weeks the hearings shall be held not less than four 4 nor more than ten 10 days after the date of last publication of such notice b a determination of the question of the need for additional ground transportation services shall be made only after consideration of requirements or demands of the public existing transportation facilities traffic and parking conditions potential congestion of traffic and such other relevant facts as the chief shall deem advisable or necessary to take into consideration c if the chief shall determine after such a public hearing that passenger seating capacity of each such vehicle  3 whether the applicant has been previously licensed as a taxicab owner and if so in what jurisdictions  4 whether the applicants license for a taxicab has ever been suspended or revoked and if so for what cause  5 a statement whether the applicant or any officer director stockholder or person directly or indirectly interested in the application was the former holder of or was an officer director stockholder or partner in a corporation or a partnership which was the former holder of a taxicab license which had been revoked or suspended  6 a statement that neither the applicant nor any officer director stockholder partner employee nor any other person directly or indirectly interested in the application has been convicted of a felony or any crime involving violence dishonesty deceit indecency degeneracy gambling crime involving moral turpitude or the illegal use sale or possession of a controlled substance  7 such other information as the commissioner may deem necessary b the commissioner of licenses shall forward each application for a ground transportation license to the chief for his review c the commissioner of licenses gen   gen  disqualification of drivers a no person shall be permitted to drive a taxicab or airport bus within the jurisdiction of the city who has been 1 convicted of a misdemeanor under the laws of this or any other state other than a misdemeanor involving the illegal use of a motor vehicle at any time within a twelvemonth period immediately preceding the issuance of the license or during the term of the license 2 convicted of a felony under the laws of this or any other state other than a felony involving the illegal use of a motor vehicle at any time within a sixtymonth period immediately preceding the issuance of the license or during the term of the license 3 convicted of a crime under the laws of this or any other state involving the illegal use of a motor vehicle including but not limited to the crime of driving while intoxicated and the offense of driving while ability is impaired at any time within a onehundredtwentymonth period immediately preceding the issuance of the license or during the term of the license 4 adjudged a narcotic addict pursuant to of the new york mental hygiene law or had been convicted of a crime pursuant to of the new york penal law or equivalent statute in other jurisdiction 5 found to have been responsible for causing more than two 2 motor vehicle accidents in a threeyear period immediately preceding the license application or during the term of the license b disqualification of a person under subsection a1 2 or 3 above may only occur provided that the nature of the criminal conduct for which the person was convicted has a direct bearing on his fitness or ability to perform the duties or responsibilities necessarily related to the provision of ground transportation services or if such person poses an unreasonable risk to the safety or welfare of the general public as a taxicab driver or airport bus operator all persons disqualified under this section shall receive written notification setting forth the reasons for such disqualification gen   gen   gen  applications a applications for a taxicab drivers license or airport bus drivers license must be filed with the commissioner of licenses on forms provided by the york state cdl license 2 be eighteen 18 years of age 3 be of sound physical and mental condition and not suffering from any infirmity of body or mind which might render him unfit for the safe operation of a licensed vehicle an applicant shall at his own expense submit to a physical examination by a duly qualified physician and submit the resulting medical report as part of his application such physical examination shall have been conducted no more than three 3 years prior to the date of application at the direction of the chief an applicant at his own expense may be required to submit to a physical examination by a duly qualified physician and submit the medical report concerning his condition to the chief 4 be of good moral character 5 not be addicted to the use of drugs or intoxicating liquors 6 have a thorough knowledge of the laws of the state affecting or regulating the operation of motor vehicles of the traffic ordinances of the city and of this chapter 7 be able to read and write with understanding of the english language b all applicants shall take and complete a taxi drivers orientation course as approved by the city of syracuse c the commissioner of licenses shall forward each application for a drivers license to the chief for review d the commissioner of licenses shall issue a drivers license only to those applicants whose applications have been approved by the chief and who have complied in all other respects with the provisions of this chapter gen   gen   gen  photographs each applicant for a drivers license shall file with his application three 3
