article i  generally definitions as used in this chapter the following terms shall have the meanings indicated towing the moving of a motor vehicle by another vehicle for compensation towing company a person engaged in the towing business or offering towing services whereby motor vehicles are towed or otherwise removed from one place to another by use of vehicle designed or adapted for that purpose vehicle owner the owner of a vehicle or another person authorized by the owner to operate the vehicle gen  purpose the purpose of this chapter is to safeguard and protect the public against fraud and exorbitant rates and similar abuses on the part of itinerant towing companies and to license persons engaged in towing businesses gen  license required no person shall maintain or operate a towing company or operate a towing vehicle for hire within the city of syracuse without first having obtained a towing company license this requirement shall not apply to those towing operations specially exempted under section 4511 gen  application procedure  license requirements a an application for a towing company license shall be made to the commissioner of licenses on forms prescribed by the commissioner of licenses the application shall contain the name and address of the owner and operator of the towing company as well as the name and address of the owner of the premises where the towing company is to be located and of the premises where towed vehicles are to be stored and the telephone number which may be called to retrieve towed vehicles if a partnership corporation or other business association is involved the names and addresses of the partners officers or principals shall be listed on the application all addresses of persons involved shall be home addresses listing street and number b the application shall also contain the hours during which the applicant will be open for towing and for retrieval of towed vehicles the application shall also contain a complete listing of the vehicle make year and license plate number of all towing vehicles to be used or operated by the applicant the application shall also contain a complete listing of all towing and storage fees to be charged by the applicant c before said license is issued the applicant shall present proof to the commissioner of licenses that all safety regulations prescribed by the state of new york motor vehicle bureau have been complied with and all policies of insurance required by the state of new york have minimum limits of one hundred thousand dollars $10000000two hundred thousand dollars $20000000 bodily injury and fifty thousand dollars $5000000 property damage with the city of syracuse named as an additional insured d the commissioner of licenses may require such additional information as may be necessary in order to enforce this chapter and to ensure the safety of all persons the commissioner of licenses shall forward each application for a towing license to the chief of police or his designee for his review e upon receipt of an application for a towing company license the chief of police shall cause an inspection to be made by the appropriate authorities of the location of the towing company and of the premises where towed vehicles are to be stored to determine whether public safety problems exist and the chief of police shall cause an investigation to be made of the background of the owner and the operator of the towing company the chief of police and his representatives shall have the right to enter upon all such premises for the purpose of making such inspections during normal business hours gen  operation of towing companies a the owner and operator of a towing company shall comply with all provisions of federal state and local laws and ordinances relating to the conduct of the towing business and the use and maintenance of the towing company premises b the owner and operator of a towing company shall comply with all the notices orders decisions and rules and regulations made by the chief of police and local officials with jurisdiction over the occupation and use of towing company premises c the owner and operator of a towing company shall cause the towing company license to be posted in a conspicuous place on the premises of the towing company and shall also cause a copy of said license to be available for inspection in each towing vehicle used by the company the commissioner of licenses shall issue a decal which shall be displayed on the rear window of each towing vehicle in an area not obstructing the drivers view every license shall receive one decal the cost of which shall be included in the cost of the license any additional decals needed will cost twentyfive dollars $2500 per decal d all towing companies shall maintain all licenses required by the new york state vehicle and traffic law and all equipment utilized shall comply with said law and all applicable rules and regulations of the commissioner of motor vehicles and all regulations and requirements set by the chief of police the equipment shall be in good operating condition and all towing company personnel shall be properly trained and fully competent to perform their specific functions and shall so perform those functions in a courteous and orderly manner e no towed vehicles shall be stored on a public street f a towing company shall upon request of a vehicle owner paying to retrieve a towed vehicle deliver a receipt to such person at the time of payment such receipt shall contain at least the following information 1 the name business address and telephone number of the towing company 2 the date of the vehicle was towed and the date of the retrieval by the vehicle owner 3 the license plate and vehicle make of the vehicle towed 4 the starting and ending location of the tow 5 an itemization of all fees charged including towing storage and any other charges g a towing company shall be responsible for all damage done to a vehicle resulting from the negligence of the towing company andor its agents or employees h a towing company shall maintain accurate records concerning all vehicles towed which shall contain at least the information required in subsection f above such records shall be retained for at least three 3 years after a towed vehicle has been retrieved i a license holder shall inform the commissioner of licenses within thirty 30 days of any changes in the information which has been supplied on a license application j the chief of police may promulgate rules and regulations to govern the operation of towing companies so as to provide for the orderly operation of said companies and to ensure the public safety of all persons gen  license fees  term a the annual fee for a towing company license shall commissioner of licenses of a renewal fee in the amount required by section 456 gen  denial of license a the commissioner of licenses may deny a license or deny the renewal of a license to any applicant who does not comply with the provisions of this chapter or any rule or regulation promulgated under this chapter who makes a material misrepresentation on a license application the commissioner of licenses shall give written notification to an applicant of the reasons for the denial of a license any applicant who is denied a license or renewal of a license may within ten 10 days from the date of denial request a hearing from the commissioners of licenses b the chief of police shall have the power to investigate and inquire into license applications under this chapter and to require and enforce by subpoena the attendance of witnesses at such investigations gen  transferability any license or registration required by this chapter shall not be transferred to another person or vehicle gen  towing from privately owned property without vehicle owners permission a no person shall tow remove impound or otherwise disturb any motor vehicle other than an abandoned vehicle as gen  article ii  enforcement scope of responsibility any person who has obtained a towing license pursuant to this chapter shall be responsible for the conduct of himself his agents servants and employees gen  liability any person who is found guilty of violating any provision of this chapter shall be subject to the penalties described herein gen  license revocation and other disciplinary action no person described in section 4512 shall have any license or permit issued by the city pursuant to this chapter revoked or suspended or be subjected to any disciplinary action provided in this chapter except for misconduct shown after a hearing upon stated charges pursuant to section 4512 gen  procedure a person against whom penalties are proposed shall have written thereof and the reasons therefor shall be furnished a copy of the charges preferred against him and shall be allowed at least ten 10 days for answering the same in writing a hearing upon such charges shall be designated by the chief of police in writing for that purpose in case a deputy or other person is so designated he shall for the purpose of such hearing be vested with all the powers of the chief of police and shall make a record of such hearing which shall with his recommendations be referred to the chief for review and decision the person against whom charges are preferred shall be entitled to be represented by counsel to summon witnesses on his own behalf and to cross examine those witnesses who testify against him the burden of proving misconduct shall be upon the person alleging the same compliance with technical rules of evidence shall not be required gen  reserved penalties a any person violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a violation and upon conviction thereof shall be liable to a fine not to exceed one hundred fifty dollars $15000 or by imprisonment for a period not to exceed fifteen 15 days or both in addition to civil penalties b if the person is found guilty of the charges pursuant to section 4515 the penalty may consist of suspension or revocation of any licenses or permits issued by the city pursuant to this chapter and a penalty not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000  provided however that no license may be suspended for a period exceeding ninety 90 days gen  private right of action any person who is aggrieved by the violation of any of the provisions of this chapter shall have a cause of action in his own behalf in any court of appropriate jurisdiction for damages for civil penalties provided in this chapter and such other remedies as may be appropriate together with reasonable attorneys fees to be fixed by the court gen  hearing any person whose license is revoked pursuant to this chapter within thirty 30 days from the receipt of the notice of revocation may request a hearing which shall be conducted according to the provisions contained in section 4515 gen  review any person aggrieved by a decision of the chief of police pursuant to this chapter may apply to the supreme court for relief by a proceeding under article 78 of the civil practice law and rules such proceeding shall be governed by the provisions of article 78 of the civil practice law and rules except that it must be instituted as therein provided within thirty 30 days after service of the chiefs decision on the person alleged to be aggrieved gen  article iii  miscellaneous severability if any clause sentence paragraph section or part of this chapter shall be adjudged by any court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid such judgment shall not affect impair or invalidate the remainder thereof but shall be confined in its operation to the clause sentence paragraph section or part thereof directly involved in the controversy in which such judgment shall have been rendered gen  effective date the provisions of this chapter shall take effect on  gen  child access prevention definitions dwelling unit shall have the same meaning as set forth in section 2710 of the property conservation as the same shall be amended from time to time firearm means a any pistol or revolver  or b a shotgun having one or more barrels less than eighteen 18 inches in length or any weapon made from a shotgun whether by alteration modification or otherwise if such weapon as modified has an overall length of less than twentysix 26 inches  or c a rifle having one or more barrels less than sixteen 16 inches in length or any weapon made from a rifle whether by alteration modification or otherwise if such weapon as modified has an overall length of less than twentysix 26 inches for purposes of this definition the length of the barrel on a shotgun or rifle shall be determined by measuring the distance between the muzzle and the face of the bolt breech or breechlock when closed and when the shotgun or rifle is cocked  the overall length of the weapon made from a shotgun or rifle is the distance between the extreme ends of the weapon measured along a line parallel to the center line of the bore such definition except as otherwise indicated shall include both loaded and unloaded firearms except that it shall not include any antique firearm as defined in federal or new york state law or any curio or relic as defined under united states law which is possessed by a licensed collector in accordance with united states law possess means to have physical possession or otherwise to exercise dominion or control over tangible property rifle means a weapon designed or redesigned made or remade and intended to be fired from the shoulder and designed or redesigned and made or remade to use the energy of the explosive in a fixed metallic cartridge to fire only a single projectile rifled bore for each single pull of the trigger safety locking device means a design adaptation or attachable accessory that will prevent the use of the weapon by an unauthorized user and includes but is not limited to a trigger lock which prevents the pulling of the trigger without the use of a key or a combination handle which prevents the use of the weapon without the alignment of the combination tumblers shotgun means a weapon designed or redesigned made or remade and intended to be fired from the shoulder and designed or redesigned and made or remade to use the energy of the explosive in a fixed shotgun shell to fire smooth bore either a number of ball shot or a single projectile for each single pull of the trigger gen  prohibition no person who is the lawful owner or custodian of a rifle shotgun or firearm as defined in section 471 shall store or otherwise place or leave such rifle shotgun or firearm in a dwelling unit in such a manner or under circumstances that it is out of his immediate possession or control without having rendered such rifle shotgun or firearm inoperable by employing a safety locking device or by securing such rifle shotgun or firearm in an enclosure constructed entirely of wood or metal which is locked and the conventional or intended means of disengaging the lock is not accessible to anyone other than the lawful owner or custodian of such rifle shotgun or firearm gen  sale of certain weapons  locking devices therefor  provision of notice or application law 1 no person firm corporation limited liability corporation llc limited liability partnership llp or partnership deliver or transfer any such weapon to an individual unless the transferee is provided at the time of sale delivery or transfer with a safety locking device that is capable of preventing the weapon from discharging 2 no person firm or corporation within the city of syracuse shall sell deliver or transfer any weapon as defined in section 26500 of the penal law of the state of new york to an individual casual sale unless the transferee is provided at the time of sale delivery or transfer with a safety locking device that is capable of preventing the weapon from discharging 3 every person firm or corporation engaged in the retail business of selling rifles shotguns or firearms in the city of syracuse as those terms are defined in section 26500 of the penal law of the state of new york shall in the place where such weapons are displayed or delivered to the purchaser post a notice conspicuously stating in bold print that effective  storing or leaving a weapon in any household without any provision of this section shall be an unclassified misdemeanor punishable by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 or by imprisonment not to exceed one hundred fifty 150 days or by both such fine and imprisonment gen   gen  prohibition on the sale and possession of bomb bags definition bomb bags small rectangular packets which contain a mixture of sodium bicarbonate and citric acid that when squeezed make a loud disturbing and threatening noise gen  possession no person shall carry on his or her person or have in his or her possession in any public building public facility public place street or park a device commonly known as a bomb bag as defined in section 481 of this chapter gen  sale no person or place of business shall sell or offer to sell a device commonly known as a bomb bag as defined in section 481 of this chapter within the city of syracuse gen  penalty any person violating any provision of this chapter shall be guilty of a violation of this chapter and punishable by a fine of not more than one hundred fifty dollars $15000 andor imprisonment not exceeding fifteen 15 days gen  severability should any section or provision of this chapter be declared unconstitutional or invalid by the courts such decision shall not affect the validity of the balance of this chapter gen  neighborhood planning councils neighborhood planning council program a establishment eight 8 neighborhood planning councils will be established the eight 8 neighborhood planning councils will correspond to the citys eight 8 planning areas see map attached to general  as established in 1997 1 area 1 downtown 2 area 2 westside 3 area 3 southside 4 area 4 valley 5 area 5 eastside 6 area 6 eastwood 7 area 7 northside 8 area 8 lakefront b name the name of the planning council project shall be tomorrows neighborhoods today tnt or such other name as shall be subsequently designated by ordinance c mission the tnt neighborhood planning council project creates a comprehensive process for involving all neighborhood residents businesses and organizations in planning for their neighborhoods that identifies and builds upon community assets and helps direct the citys resources into priority areas in the most costeffective way the process will strengthen the involvement of citizens that is crucial for a healthy city improve the quality of life in the city and build the capacity of syracuse to solve problems and create the future it wants d inclusion the city of syracuse neighborhood planning office or its equivalent will work with existing neighborhood organizations social service agencies faithbased organizations local businesses schools and governmental operating units to organize and establish the eight 8 neighborhood planning councils e support the neighborhood planning office or its equivalent will provide technical assistance to the neighborhood planning councils including recruiting skills organizational methods rules and procedures urban planning collaboration and conducting forums f notification the neighborhood planning office or its equivalent shall notify all neighborhood and community organizations and groups known to and recognized by the city of syracuse of the adoption of this chapter within thirty 30 days of adoption g rules and procedures the neighborhood planning office or its equivalent shall support each of the eight 8 planning councils in the development of rules and procedures for their operation the rules and procedures shall not violate any provisions of the city charter or any other city regulation the rules and procedures may be amended by a majority vote of any neighborhood council provided they are not inconsistent with any other city regulation the neighborhood planning councils must be democratically organized and use methods of public participation that are open to all stakeholders in the area including adherence to the new york state open meetings law when applicable h neighborhood planning council boundaries there shall be one neighborhood planning council for each planning area except in the case of lakefront and downtown the planning areas shall be determined by physical boundaries include at least one business district a city park at least one city school and several identifiable neighborhoods the common council shall determine by ordinance the boundaries of the tnt neighborhood planning councils and shall have the power to change the boundaries by ordinance input and recommendations on boundaries may be solicited from the neighborhood planning office the community development advisory committee and the tnt neighborhood planning councils the boundaries of any neighborhood planning council may be amended if proposed by the involved tnt neighborhood planning council and approved by ordinance gen  function of neighborhood planning councils a creation of area and neighborhood plans each tnt neighborhood planning council will create an assetdriven continuous fiveyear plan for its area which will include a comprehensive vision for the diverse neighborhoods within the area fiveyear goals and objectives prioritized action plans resource requests budgets recommendations to operating city departments and timelines for completion these plans will be compiled by the neighborhood planning office and submitted to each of the citys operating departments for consideration in the creation of annual and capital workplans and budgets b conveners of community stakeholders each tnt neighborhood planning council will serve as a community roundtable where issues of pertinence and concern can be discussed where education on complex community issues and action can take place and where people from many different parts of the community business nonprofit government grassroots can come together as equals to address issues of common concern c facilitation tnt neighborhood planning councils can serve as a vehicle to address area problems where there are divergent points of view that need to be aired and where solutions need to be sought that find the common ground between different points of view the neighborhood planning office or its equivalent will ensure that sufficient training in facilitator skills is provided to the facilitators d advisement the tnt neighborhood planning councils shall advise city government ie the mayor common council cdac and operating departments on matters concerning the general health safety and welfare of their neighborhoods this shall be a reflection of the needs and wants of the neighborhoods as articulated in the fiveyear plans e development of neighborhood directories each tnt neighborhood planning council may develop in partnership with area schools businesses nonprofits andor grassroots groups a descriptive neighborhood directory that serves to market the area and its unique attributes and virtues f sustaining the organization the neighborhood planning councils shall develop an organization that will maintain itself and its leadership and make a good faith effort to recruit a diverse and representative group of stakeholders g citywide convention annually tnt neighborhood planning councils will gather to discuss issues germane to the city as a whole the actual date shall be established during the first quarter of the year gen  membership and leadership a general membership tnt neighborhood planning councils shall be made up of residents to the maximum extent feasible all residents property owners business owners and employees within the planning area are eligible to be members of the planning council the membership may be made up of other neighborhood stakeholders including common councilors institutional representatives social services agency personnel who work in the area property owners and business owners whose businesses are located in the area as long as people live work own property or business within the area they are eligible to be members of the tnt neighborhood planning councils b neighborhood association membership each neighborhood association with a minimum of ten 10 members shall have a representative seat on the neighborhood planning council for the area in which they primarily operate a neighborhood association for purposes of this chapter is defined as a group of citizens organized with or without paid staff whose mission is to improve the quality of life in the city such as neighborhood groups neighborhood watch and park associations the neighborhood planning office or its equivalent shall maintain a list of eligible neighborhood associations the representative is the voice of the neighborhood association at the tnt neighborhood planning council meetings and votes on behalf of hisher association this representative is elected annually by his or her neighborhood association c leadership teams each tnt neighborhood planning council may elect a team of not less than two 2 and not more than nine 9 members to serve as the facilitator team for the areas neighborhood planning council elections must be democratic process elections shall be conducted each year during the month of september except that the initial elections shall be held during january 200 and the initial oneyear terms shall expire  and initial twoyear terms shall expire  neighborhood residents shall be encouraged to take a leadership role in serving as members of the leadership team a majority of the leadership team shall be neighborhood residents in no case shall any person serve on more than one neighborhood planning council leadership team at any one time leadership teams shall identify one member of the team to serve as the primary liaison between the team and the neighborhood planning office or its equivalent d facilitators coordinating council there shall be convened at least once annually a meeting of all the facilitator leadership teams from all eight 8 neighborhood planning councils to identify areas of common interests and needs to serve as a leadership training vehicle to finalize budgets and plans to discuss allocation of resources and to advise and inform city government on issues of concern to the various neighborhoods these representatives shall serve in a nonvoting capacity e conflict of interest elected officials city department heads and neighborhood planning staff may not be elected to serve as a leader of the tnt neighborhood planning council if a neighborhood planning council leader is elected to any city office he or she must resign immediately from the leadership team f terms of office the term of office for the leadership team shall be two 2 years except that at the first annual election onehalf of the total number of leadership team members shall be elected for oneyear terms ie if four 4 members two 2 positions elected for oneyear terms and two 2 elected for twoyear terms  or if five 5 members three 3 members elected for oneyear terms and the remaining two 2 positions elected for twoyear terms subsequent annual elections shall be elections for twoyear terms which will result in staggered terms there will not be a limit on the number of terms consecutive or otherwise to which a leadership team member may be elected gen  relationship to governmental operating departments a neighborhood planning office to further the neighborhood enhancement partnership between the city and its citizens the citys neighborhood planning office or its equivalent shall have primary responsibility for providing staff support technical assistance and research support to the neighborhood planning councils both in the development of the governance structures and in the development and implementation of the fiveyear plans as may be available considering resources and priorities of the administration b operating departments the mayor or hisher designated representative shall appoint a representative from each of the citys operating departments to attend and advise the neighborhood planning councils this shall include code enforcement economic development neighborhood planning parks and recreation police and public works governmental representatives shall be selected to serve in the areas where they live andor work to the degree possible these representatives shall serve in a nonvoting capacity they shall be appointed annually with vacancies filled immediately c syracuseonondaga county planning agency within the scope of annual city budgets and neighborhood planning office or its equivalent socpa shall provide technical support gis mapping historic preservation general urban planning and zoning administration and training to assist the neighborhood planning councils in the development of their plans d city school district the board of education of the syracuse city school district or the superintendent of the syracuse city school district if so designated by the syracuse board of education shall have the right to appoint school district representatives to serve on each of the tnt neighborhood planning councils these representatives shall serve in a nonvoting capacity gen  relationship to city budget a operating department budgets each operating department of the city will consider the area plans in their annual and capital budget preparations and in response to neighborhood plans and overall city priorities include the plans as may be feasible the information shall be provided annually to the appropriate city operating departments prior to the date for submittal of proposed departmental budgets to the office of management and budget pursuant to the city charter b capital budget those aspects of the area plans that require capital expenditures should be considered by the operating department responsible for carrying out the plans in their annual capital budgeting process c final approval final approval as to which aspects of the area plans are to be funded by annual city operating and capital budgets shall be determined in accordance with the budget process established by the city charter d office of management and budget the office of management and budget has responsibility for reviewing the neighborhood plans created tnt neighborhood planning councils which have been submitted either during the city budget process or as part of the fiveyear plan omb in accordance with the city charter is further responsible for determining which portion of the tnt neighborhood plans shall be included in the annual city budget submitted to the mayor omb in accordance with the city charter will also determine which capital programs identified by tnt neighborhood planning councils will be submitted to the mayor and common council for consideration in the annual capital budget the mayor and common council shall finalize which portions of the neighborhood plans shall be included in the annual city budget items included in the capital program shall be considered in the same manner as the departmental capital program under the city charter e neighborhood planning council funding each neighborhood planning council or its equivalent shall develop an annual plan and budget request which covers their services provided to the city of syracuse in order to receive reimbursement each neighborhood planning council and the city shall enter into an annual written agreement with the citys department of community development for the proposed services to reflect items which may be included in the annual city budget or community development block grant funding the city of syracuse neighborhood planning office andor the neighborhood planning council shall maintain or assure its maintenance by others all records of funding and disbursement of funding to assure that expenditures are consistent with requirements of law and any guidelines set forth by the common council the financial records shall be open for inspection subject to audit and maintained in such a fashion that they can be audited gen  relationship to community development advisory committee cdac insofar as a cdac exists with respect to the citys annual federal community development block grant plan the cdac is the citizen participation group directly involved with the development of the community development block grant annual program a planning council delegate to cdac as provided for in the cdac bylaws each neighborhood planning council shall elect one member to represent the area on the cdac b role and function the area representative shall serve as a liaison between the cdac and the neighborhood planning council each area representative shall serve on cdacs committee structure work on the cdbg allocations process and otherwise function as a full member of the cdac as provided for in the cdac bylaws with the same voting power as any other representative gen  review and revision a initial review eighteen 18 months after the creation of the neighborhood planning councils a comprehensive review of the program shall be conducted by the neighborhood planning office or its equivalent this review shall cover the area boundaries the governance structures and organizations the functions and responsibilities the types of matters addressed and fiscal accountability this review shall be provided to the common council b periodic review every two 2 years reviews shall be conducted by the neighborhood planning office or its equivalent after each review any needed revisions will be made together with recommendations to the common council gen   gen  business certificate of use article i  in general short title this chapter shall be known as the business certificate of use  gen  purpose the purpose of this chapter is to establish regulatory controls to ensure that certain businesses are operated in accordance with law do not have a serious negative impact upon surrounding residential neighborhoods or do not endanger the health safety or welfare of persons in the city of syracuse gen  definitions as used in this chapter the following terms shall have the meanings indicated bar shall mean one or more of the following 1 a premises where alcoholic beverages are sold for consumption on the premises  2 a premises operated for profit or pecuniary gain or as a place of assembly where alcoholic beverages are provided by the operator of the premises his or her agents servants or employees or are brought onto said premises by persons assembling there business and businesses shall mean a bar food store drugstore or restaurant as defined herein drugstore shall mean a premises where prescription drugs are sold at retail together with dry goods food or beverages food store means a premises with a total floor space less than twenty thousand 20000 square feet which is devoted in whole or part to the sale of dry goods and food and beverages to be consumed off the premises owner means an owner andor operator or future owner andor operator of the business specified on a particular certificate of use for a particular business location premises shall mean the building in which the business is located as well as accessory structures and uses including parking lots and the land on which the building is located restaurant shall mean a premises where food is sold to be consumed on or off the premises this definition shall not include a premises where a nonalcoholic beverage or snack is available but is incidental to the conduct of the business at the premises or a college or universitys dining halls gen   gen  certificate of use required no owner shall operate or maintain a business within the city of syracuse without first having obtained a certificate of use or conditional certificate of use authorizing the operation of said business by said owner at the specific business location gen   gen  application a an application for a certificate of use shall be made to the department of finance on forms prescribed by the commissioner of finance the application shall request relevant information relating to the owner and the business to be conducted at the premises including the existence of necessary licenses and permits for the business b applications for a certificate of use are to be submitted by the owner including an owner who does not yet own andor operate the subject business but will own andor operate the subject business within the next ninety 90 days gen   gen  inspections and investigations a upon receipt of an application for a certificate of use the chief of police or hisher designee the commissioner of community development or hisher designee the director of code enforcement or hisher designee and the chief of fire or hisher designee shall inspect the premises to determine whether the owner is complying with the laws and ordinances which they are charged with enforcing said chief of police commissioner director and chief of fire and members of their staff shall have the right to enter upon any premises for which a certificate of use is sought for the purpose of making such an inspection during normal business hours and shall also have the authority to seek warrants where necessary b upon receipt of an application for a certificate of use the city of syracuse zoning administrator or hisher designee shall review the location to ensure that the operation of the business at that location will be in compliance with the zoning ordinance c the commissioner of finance or hisher designee shall determine that the owner does not have an expired conditional certificate of use is not serving a period of suspension has not had a previous certificate of use or conditional certificate of use revoked is not the subject of pending charges brought for violations of the terms and conditions of a certificate of use or conditional certificate of use and that the owner has procured all necessary licenses and permits for the business gen   gen  issuance of certificates of use and conditional certificates of use a no certificate of use shall be issued unless the owner has satisfied the following conditions 1 the owner has paid all fees required by section 499  2 the owner has all necessary licenses and permits for the business  3 the owner does not have an expired conditional certificate of use a certificate of use or conditional certificate of use that is under suspension a previous certificate of use or conditional certificate of use revoked andor has charges pending for violations of the terms and conditions of a certificate of use or conditional certificate of use  4 the owner does not owe the city any money for delinquent taxes water charges civil penalties parking tickets or other duly incurred charges fines or penalties  and 5 all applicable city officials in section 496 have inspected and investigated the business the businesss premises and the business location and have approved the owners application for a certificate of use b a conditional certificate of use may be issued where the commissioner of finance or hisher designee has decided to issue a conditional certificate of use to the owner and the owner has satisfied the following conditions 1 the owner has paid all fees required by section 499  2 the owner has all necessary licenses and permits for the business  3 the owner does not have an expired conditional certificate of use a certificate of use or conditional certificate of use that is under suspension a previous certificate of use or conditional certificate of use revoked andor has charges pending for violations of the terms and conditions of a certificate of use or conditional certificate of use  4 the owner does not owe the city any money for delinquent taxes water charges civil penalties parking tickets or other duly incurred charges fines or penalties  and 5 the owner indicates in writing on a form provided by the commissioner of finance their intention to take the necessary action to comply with the requirements given them by the applicable city officials in section 496 for the approval of their application for a certificate of use c a conditional certificate of use shall contain a date by which the owner must comply with the requirements for approval by the applicable city officials in section 496 such conditional certificate of uses expiration date may be extended by the commissioner of finance for an additional period where the owner provides the commissioner with satisfactory evidence of a good faith effort to meet the requirements d upon completion of the requirements given to the owner by the applicable city officials in section 496 and the approval of the owners application by said city officials the commissioner of finance shall issue a certificate of use to the owner for the business in accordance with the terms of this section e certificates shall be issued or denied within ninety 90 days after an application is completed nothing herein shall require the commissioner of finance to issue or deny a certificate of use within such period if the necessary reviews and approvals by the city officials in sections 496 and 497 have not been completed gen   gen  operation of businesses a the owner of any business shall comply with all provisions of federal and state statutes and rules and regulations and all city of syracuse local laws ordinances and rules and regulations relating to the conduct of businesses and the occupation use and maintenance of the premises in which the business is located b the owner of any business shall comply with all the notices orders decisions and rules and regulations made by the chief of police chief of fire commissioner of community development director of code enforcement city of syracuse zoning administrator and other city departments governing the occupation and use of the premises in which the business is located c the owner of any business shall cause the certificate of use to be posted in a conspicuous place visible to the public on the premises of the business d the owner of any business shall not permit at any time a greater number of persons on the premises than the capacity approved by the city of syracuse e the owner of any business shall maintain good order on and about the premises at all times the owner of any business shall also be responsible for removing refuse from the premises and obstructions from the sidewalk adjacent to the premises as well as for operating the business in accordance with the requirements of all state statutes and rules and regulations and all city of syracuse local laws ordinances and rules and regulations and for operating the business so that neither the business nor its patrons become a source of disruption to other building tenants or a source of disruption on the sidewalks streets or other private property in the vicinity of the business the term failure to maintain good order shall include but not be limited to the following 1 allowing or permitting the premises to become disorderly including allowing or permitting offenses against public order 2 gambling 3 prostitution 4 illegal possession use gift sale or offer for sale of alcoholic beverages 5 illegal possession use gift sale or offer for sale of cigarettes or tobacco products 6 food stamp or welfare fraud or criminal diversion of prescription medications and prescriptions 7 litter 8 possession use gift sale or offer for sale of illegal drugs 9 noise control ordinance violations 10 possession of stolen property 11 operating beyond the legal hours of operation 12 illegal possession use gift sale or offer for sale of dangerous weapons 13 violations of the new york state uniform fire prevention and building the city of syracuses zoning ordinance property conservation code building code electrical code mechanical code and elevator code gen   gen  fees the fee for a certificate of use both for applications for a certificate of use and for renewals of certificates of use shall be two will be charged to the owner in addition to the aforementioned fees there shall also be a fee of twentyfive dollars $2500 for any application for a certificate of use submitted after the owner has any application for a certificate of use submitted after the owner has been given a tenday notice as set forth in section 4913b gen   gen  expiration of certificate certificates of use shall be valid transferred or assigned in the event of any change involving the operator of the business the type of business or the business location a new certificate of use shall be required if the certificate holder changes the type of business at the location or relocates the business or if another person wishes to operate the same business or a new business at the location b the owner of any business that has a certificate of use shall notify the commissioner of finance within five 5 business days following the date when such owner transfers assigns sells closes or moves the business upon being notified the commissioner of finance shall cancel the certificate of use for the business the failure to notify the commissioner of finance is a violation of this chapter and will subject the owner to the penalties set forth in section 4922 gen   gen  article ii  administration failure to apply for certificate of use a in the event the owner or the business subject to the provisions of this chapter shall fail to apply for a certificate of use as required herein the commissioner of finance shall notify the owner or the business in writing of such failure to comply provide a copy of the application form and give notice of a thirtyday period during which the owner or the subject business shall file the required application along with the applicable fee b in the event the owner or the business provided notice pursuant to section 4913a does not submit the required application within the applicable thirtyday period the commissioner of finance shall notify the owner or the business in writing of the failure to comply and provide a final tenday notice during which period the owner or the subject business shall file the required application and the applicable fee this final tenday notice shall include a notice of the city of syracuses authority to seek criminal and civil penalties for failure to apply for and obtain a certificate of use c in the event the owner or the business provided the tenday notice pursuant to section 4913b fails to apply within the applicable tenday period the owner or the business shall be subject to criminal and civil penalties and all available city remedies for failure to comply with this chapter gen   gen  operation of business a the owner of a business subject to the provisions of this chapter must obtain a certificate of use or conditional certificate of use prior to the commencement of any business operations in the event an application is approved the commissioner of finance shall issue the owner a certificate of use in accordance with the terms of this chapter b in the event the application is not approved the owner shall be advised as to the specific requirements which must be met to qualify for a certificate of use c in the event the commissioner of finance determines after the city of syracuses review of the application that the business is not qualified for a certificate of use based on any requirement which the commissioner of finance determines cannot be complied with by means of an extension of time under section 4914b above the commissioner shall notify the owner in writing of the reasons the application cannot be approved and provide notice to the owner of the right to a hearing on such determination which hearing shall be requested within fifteen 15 days of the date of such notice of determination d a hearing when requested shall be held before the commissioner of finance or hisher designee the hearing shall take place no later than fifteen 15 business days after the commissioner of finance receives the request from the owner for the hearing the commissioner of finance may adjourn the date only upon the owner presenting compelling reasons in writing that an adjournment of the hearing date is warranted such an adjournment shall in no circumstances be later than twenty 20 business days from the originally scheduled date for the hearing following such hearing the commissioner shall make a determination as to whether the business qualifies for a certificate of use under the terms of this chapter gen   gen  suspension or revocation of certificate of use a any certificate of use or conditional certificate of use issued pursuant to this chapter may be suspended or revoked by the commissioner of finance in accordance with the provisions of this chapter either based on a hearing on notice under this chapter or based on a closing of the business location pursuant to chapter 45 of the revised general ordinances of the city of syracuse the city of syracuse nuisance abatement ordinance b the commissioner of finance is authorized in the event a business issued a certificate of use has failed to maintain good order at the subject business to conduct a hearing on date for the revocationsuspension hearing d the commissioner of finance shall be authorized to suspend a certificate of use pending the hearing provided for in section 4915b and c where the owner has failed to maintain good order at the subject business and the commissioner determines based on the information provided the city that such suspension is necessary to protect the health safety or welfare of persons in the city of syracuse e in the event the chief of police of the city of syracuse has commenced enforcement proceedings against a property owner to abate a nuisance in accordance mail sent to the owner at hishertheirits last known address on file with the citys department of finance gen   gen  failure to maintain good order at the business location a for the purposes of this and purpose a syracuse living wage purpose of this legislation is to ensure that employees of contractors and subcontractors with the city of syracuse earn an hourly wage that will enable such employees and their families to live above the federal poverty level and reduce or eliminate their reliance on taxpayerfunded social services gen  definitions the following definitions shall apply in no event be deemed to include the syracuse industrial development agency the syracuse economic development corporation the syracuse housing authority or any agency not governed by the charter of service contract gen  living wage a wages an employer shall pay an hourly wage to each of its employees of twelve dollars nineteen cents $1219 per hour if the employer provides health benefits as defined herein or fourteen dollars forty cents $1440 per hour if the employer does not provide health benefits an employer of an employee that customarily and regularly receives more than thirty dollars $3000 per month in tips may use that employees tips as a credit against the employers living wage obligation to the employee tip credit up to the maximum tip credit that the employer can claim at that time under the fair labor standard act flsa only tips actually received by the employee may be counted in determining whether the employee is a tipped employee and in applying the tip credit the living wage rates set forth herein are subject to annual adjustment under paragraph d a contractor shall be obligated to pay an hourly living wage to employees paid under any service contract that is executed extended or renewed on or subsequent to the effective date of this chapter b health benefits an employer who pays the lower living wage rate of twelve dollars nineteen cents $1219 per hour shall provide health benefits as defined in section 502h to each of its employees and their dependents in order to be applicable the lower living wage rate shall only apply in the case of an employee who actually receives health care benefits as defined in section 502h and not in the case when said health benefits are just made available to the employee if the employer is providing employee health benefits less than those specified in the definition in section 502h such employer shall be required to pay the living wage rate of fourteen dollars forty cents $1440 per hour unless the employee health benefits are increased to meet such definition c proof of health benefits in order to qualify for the wage rate of an employer providing health care benefits under paragraph a an employer shall furnish proof of health care coverage and payment thereof satisfactory to an appropriate agency or department designated by the city such proof shall be provided by an employer not later than thirty 30 days after execution of the service contract that proof must include a sworn statement from the employer or its carrier on behalf of the employer regarding the availability of employee health care coverage the designated city agency or department shall make this documentation available to the mayor common councilors members of the living wage advisory committee or other appropriate agencies of the city upon request d rate adjustment the wage rates under paragraph a of this section shall be adjusted annually where required under this paragraph effective april 1st of each year following the effective date of this chapter the percentage used to calculate the adjustment of the wage rates shall be the percentage change in the consumer price index cpi for all urban consumers northeast urban all items for the immediately preceding calendar year january  from the end of the next previous calendar year ie  adjustment will be based on the percentage increase if any of the cpi for all urban consumers northeast urban all items annual 2005 from the cpi for all urban consumers northeast urban all items annual 2004 in no event shall the wage rates be adjusted downward in the event the cpi change is either negative or there is no change the annual wage rates for the previous year shall remain in effect e notice of rate adjustments the city shall publish an annual notice announcing the annual rates as soon as it has received the applicable consumer price index this notice shall be provided promptly to all agencies contractors and subcontractors affected by this chapter and shall specify the rates to become effective on april 1 f reduction in wages or hours nothing in this section or chapter shall require or authorize an employer to reduce the wages or hours of any employee in order for that employer to come into compliance this section shall not be construed so as to reduce wages established under any collective bargaining agreement or applicable prevailing wage law g changes in job titles or job functions an employer shall not violate the intent of this chapter by changing an employees job title or making a nonsubstantial alteration in job functions or responsibilities solely to avoid the payment of a living wage h compensated days off an employer shall provide to each employee twelve 12 compensated days off per year time employees shall accrue compensated days off on a prorated basis an employee shall be eligible to use such accrued days off after the first six 6 months of employment or consistent with employer policy whichever is sooner employers may count paid holidays and any combination of paid sick or family leave vacation or personal days toward provision of the twelve 12 days off gen  exemptions for employers an employer shall be exempt from the requirements of this chapter if it employs fewer than five 5 employees as fulltime equivalents for that employer for each week in the immediately preceding twelve 12 months gen  requests for proposals and service contracts all requests for proposals and service contracts subject to this chapter shall include the following or substantially equivalent language a this contract is subject to the living wage the city of syracuse the chapter requires that absent an exemption all contractors having a service contract with the city shall pay their employees the living wage then in effect for the period during which services are being covered by this contract b the city shall have the authority to suspend or terminate a service contract and consider other penalties for violations of this chapter gen  retaliation and discrimination barred a an employer shall not discharge reduce the compensation of or otherwise discriminate against an employee for making a complaint participating in any proceedings reporting noncompliance or otherwise asserting his or her rights under this chapter b a violation for retaliation as provided under paragraph a of this section is punishable by a fine of up to five hundred dollars $50000 for each week that an adverse action is in force and until the aggrieved employees are made whole the total fine for a particular adverse action shall not exceed ten thousand dollars $1000000 c an employer shall not use any payments received under a city service contract to discourage impede or promote unionization including but not limited to the preparation or distribution of materials which advocate for or against unionization holding meetings intended to influence employees to support or resist unionization hiring legal counsel or other consultants to provide advice or assistance in discouraging impeding or promoting unionization or otherwise acting to impede a union from communicating with employees or fulfilling its representational responsibilities d employers are prohibited from discriminating against any employee or job candidate in hiring promotion or retention based on race national origin ethnicity religion age gender disability or sexual orientation gen  obligations of employers a an employer shall comply with the living wage and other requirements of this chapter b an employer shall post in a conspicuous place on its premises where notices to employees and applicants for employment are customarily posted a notice provided by the city informing employees of their rights under this chapter such notice shall also state the current living wage rate and the procedure for filing a complaint pursuant to this chapter c an employer shall permit access by the city to work sites and payroll records to investigate and monitor compliance with this chapter on prior notice to employer by city during normal business hours d an employer shall maintain payroll records with the name job title hourly wage rate and benefits paid to each employee and shall submit a certified payroll on a semiannually basis to an appropriate agency or department designated by the city the documents may be redacted or edited to protect confidential and proprietary information the designated city agency or department shall make this documentation available to the mayor common councilors and members of the living wage advisory committee upon request employers shall maintain related payroll records for a period of five 5 years after termination of an individuals employment gen  compliance for contractors and subcontractors a the city shall develop rules and regulations to receive and investigate complaints and procedures to determine compliance with this chapter the city is affirmatively obligated to do onsite visits andor to review payroll records to monitor compliance in order to ensure compliance all records reviewed shall be kept confidential and all parties with access to these records shall be required to keep that information confidential except as necessary to enforce this chapter b upon a determination site visits or review of payroll records that an employer has not complied with a provision of this chapter the city shall provide the employer with written notice of such noncompliance the notice shall include a demand for compliance within thirty 30 days a warning that the service contract may be suspended or terminated after such date for noncompliance and a statement that compliance must be demonstrated by submission of payroll records to the city that establish proof of restitution made to affected workers c an employer may request a hearing within thirty 30 days after receipt of a notice of noncompliance the city shall conduct a hearing within thirty 30 days at which the parties may present documentation thereafter the city shall issue written findings and a decision within thirty 30 days subject to the provisions of section 5010e d an employer shall have the right to appeal a determination of noncompliance in an proceeding in new york state supreme court e if an employer fails to comply with a demand for compliance within thirty 30 days or does not prevail after a hearing the city shall impose any or all of the following 1 suspend or terminate the service contract and as yet unpaid  2 demand repayment of monies provided under the service contract in whole or in part  3 require restitution in the form of payment by the employer to the employees of any unpaid living wages  and 4 upon a determination that an employers noncompliance with the requirements of this chapter was willful or egregious the city may bar an employer from any further service contract for a period of five 5 years f service contracts payments that have been suspended for noncompliance according to this section may be renewed but only after the employer submits written proof satisfactory to the city that the employer has come into full compliance with this chapter gen  living wage advisory committee within ninety 90 days of the enactment of this law the city shall create and convene a living wage advisory committee the purpose and york state supreme court f in lieu of seeking redress complaint to the city under paragraphs a b c and d of this section an employee may elect to bring an independent civil action against an employer injunctive relief reinstatement back wages and punitive damages h the city shall not disclose the identity of an employee to an employer except where necessary to investigate pursue or defend a complaint gen  reports to the mayor common council and living wage advisory committee an appropriate agency or department designated by the city shall provide on a date one year subsequent to the
