redemption pursuant to the applicable provisions of the city of syracuse tax and assessment act as amended a proposed list of tax delinquent properties to be sold at public auction such public auctions may be held up to four 4 times a year pursuant to this section 2 the tax delinquent properties selected by the commissioner of assessment shall be presented to the common council and mayor in an ordinance which shall authorize the sale of such tax delinquent properties at public auction to be held by the city in accordance with the provisions of this section of the city of syracuse tax and assessment act such ordinance shall authorize the commissioner of assessment to review and approve the bids received at the public auction and the mayor to approve the bids and to execute deeds transferring the citys right title and interest to the successful bidders 3 the department of assessment shall at least sixty 60 days in advance of the scheduled date of the public auction notify in writing the owners of the tax delinquent properties which have been selected for public auction that unless redeemed the subject property will be sold at public auction to be held not less than sixty 60 days from the date of such notice such written notice shall be sent by first class mail addressed to the owner of the tax delinquent property at the tax billing address for such tax delinquent property contained in the tax billing records of the city of syracuse such notice shall include the amount of delinquent taxes including interest fees and penalties which must be paid to redeem the subject property and remove such property from the public auction process authorized by this section 4 in addition to the written notice referred to in paragraph 3 above the list of auction properties shall be advertised at least once at least sixty 60 days in advance of the scheduled date of the auction in the citys official newspaper and a copy of the published list of tax delinquent properties shall be posted in the department of finance and the department of assessment 5 at least thirty 30 days prior to the scheduled date of the public auction certified mail notices shall be sent by the department of assessment to the owner and any mortgagors and lienholders of record which notice shall inform the property owner and such other persons that the subject tax delinquent property is on the list for public auction and that the city of syracuse appropriate officers intends to take title to the tax delinquent property by tax deed for transfer to the successful bidder at such public auction unless such property is redeemed by payment of the sums due in the manner authorized by this section and the applicable terms of the city of syracuse tax and assessment act or by an installment payment contract where applicable 6 the redemption of property contained on the list of tax delinquent properties to be sold at public auction shall require payment of the actual cost of the title search and related administrative expenses in any instances where redemption takes place within sixty 60 days of the scheduled date of the public auction 7 the department of assessment may elect to give additional notice in writing or by newspaper advertisements to those notices specifically required by this section such notices shall be deemed additional notices and the failure to give any such notices or the failure of any person to receive such additional notices if given shall not have any legal effect on the validity of a public auction held pursuant to this section or the transfer of title to such property to the successful bidder 8 the department of assessment and the department of finance shall compute and make available to property owners and other interested persons the amounts due with interest fees and penalties to redeem the subject property and remove the property from the public auction payment shall be required in the full amount including expenses described in paragraph 6 above by certified check or cash on or before the last business day before the date of the public auction specified in the public auction notices issued pursuant to this section notwithstanding the terms of this paragraph eligible property owners may be permitted to enter into an installment payment contract commonly referred to as a tax trust agreement at the discretion of the commission of finance in accordance with the terms of a of the city of syracuse tax and assessment act section 1970 hereof such installment payment contract shall require a minimum downpayment of ten 10 percent of the delinquent tax amount including interest fees and penalties and expenses required by paragraph 6 above where applicable such installment payment contract must be entered into on or before the last business day prior to the actual auction date in order to qualify the property for removal from the public auction 9 the public auctions to be conducted as authorized by this section shall be conducted either by the commissioner of assessment or such city officer or employee as may be designated by the commissioner of assessment or by a qualified professional auctioneer andor auction company selected by the commissioner of assessment in accordance with the applicable professional services contract procurement provisions of the charter of the city of syracuse and applicable local laws ordinances rules and regulations 10 qualifications for bidders a the commissioner of assessment shall establish qualifications for bidders at the public auction and shall require prospective bidders to execute necessary documents to evidence their acceptance of the terms of the public auction in no event shall the record owner of the tax delinquent property or any person acting on behalf of such record owner be eligible to bid at such public auction on their property b failure to comply with these provisions or any other condition established by ordinance or this local law shall result in forfeiture of any sum paid toward the purchase price and transfer of the property shall not be authorized by this section 11 taking by tax deed a the commissioner of assessment and commissioner of finance prior to the auction if possible and in any event prior to the actual transfer of any tax delinquent property struck down at a public auction authorized by this section shall have provided notice to all persons with an interest in the tax delinquent property which is legally required prior to taking of the tax delinquent property by tax deed pursuant to the city of syracuse tax and assessment act b notwithstanding any inconsistent paragraph of this section in the event the taking of the tax deed by the commissioner of finance on a tax delinquent property struck down at the public auction is delayed for any reason the successful bidder shall be notified by the commissioner of assessment and the transfer of the subject property to the successful bidder shall take place promptly after taking the tax deed has been completed in the event the tax deed process cannot legally be completed the successful bidder shall be notified and the sum paid by such successful bidder shall be refunded to said bidder including the buyers premium paid if any 12 the commissioner of assessment andor commissioner of finance shall take all steps necessary to receive from onondaga county the necessary approval of the enforcement and collection of the county portion of delinquent taxes levied by the city of syracuse by public auction in the event onondaga county approval is not received prior to the date of the public auction any and all tax delinquent properties for which such approval has not been received in writing shall be removed from the scheduled public auction 13 the commissioner of assessment shall be authorized to remove from the public auction such listed tax delinquent properties which the commissioner determines should not be or could not legally be sold at a public auction factors to be considered by the commissioner of assessment in making such determination to remove shall include but not be limited to bankruptcy filing death of the owner environmental problems erroneous or illegal assessments errors in giving required notices and legal advice from the corporation counsel 14 qualifying bids a the minimum bid on any tax delinquent property at a public auction held pursuant to this section shall be ten 10 percent of the delinquent taxes including interest fees and penalties due on the subject property at the date of the public auction or ten 10 percent of the assessed value of the subject property for the current tax year whichever is less provided that in no event shall the minimum acceptable bid be less than one thousand dollars $100000 and all bids following the initial minimum bid shall be required to be in one hundred dollar $10000 increments ie initial bid one thousand dollars $100000  next bid must be at least one thousand one hundred dollars $110000 etc in addition the successful bidder except for bidders who qualify under the terms of paragraph b of this subdivision must submit at the public auction upon acceptance of the successful bid at least twentyfive 25 percent of the successful bid price or one thousand dollars $100000 whichever is greater in cash or personal check and execute all documents necessary to effectuate the transfer of the property the successful bidder shall be required to present the balance of the purchase price together with the actual cost of the title search and related administrative expenses on the subject property referred to in subdivision 6 above to the commissioner of assessment within two 2 weeks of the date of the auction by certified check or cash and to execute any additional documents necessary to effectuate the transfer of the property in addition in the event a buyers premium is applicable to the successful bid price such payment shall be a condition of the public auction and shall be the responsibility of the successful bidder to be paid in cash or personal check at the public auction b notwithstanding the terms of paragraph 14a above a successful bidder on a one or twofamily dwelling who has been approved by the commissioner of assessment as a certified owner occupied home buyer in accordance with the commissioner of assessments authority to establish qualifications for bidders pursuant to this local law shall only be required to submit at the public auction upon acceptance of the successful bid at least ten 10 percent of the successful bid price or one thousand dollars $100000 whichever is greater in cash or personal check and execute all documents necessary to effectuate the transfer of the property such successful bidder shall be required to present the balance of the purchase price together with the actual cost of the title search and related administrative expenses on the subject property referred to in subdivision 6 above to the commissioner of assessment within fortyfive 45 days of the date of the auction by certified check or cash and to execute any additional documents necessary to effectuate the transfer of the property in addition in the event a buyers premium is applicable to the successful bid price such payment shall be a condition of the public auction and shall be the responsibility of the successful bidder to be paid in cash or personal check at the public auction c the closing of the transfer of title to the successful bidder shall take place promptly following the completion of all applicable requirements of this section 15 in the event a tax delinquent property which has been designated for public auction does not receive a qualified bid or any bid at all or in the event the purchaser of a tax delinquent property at public auction fails to complete the purchase of the tax delinquent property for any reason such tax delinquent property shall be subject to enforcement and collection of delinquent taxes under any method available to the city of syracuse under the tax and assessment act including a subsequent public auction 16 purchasers at public auction shall be responsible for the payment of real property taxes effective with the next quarterly payment due and owing on the subject property following the date of the closing of the transfer of the property to the successful bidder the assessment and tax rolls shall be changed to reflect the new owner in the manner required by law and the purchaser shall be provided with new tax bills to reflect the actual amounts due on the property failure to receive such new bills shall in no event relieve the purchaser of the responsibility to make the required payments in a timely manner 17 the commissioner of assessment shall be authorized to combine adjoining tax delinquent parcels owned by the same property owner for auction as a combined single parcel at the commissioners discretion 18 if any clause sentence paragraph section or part of this local law establishing section 22c of the city of syracuse tax and assessment act section 19481 shall be adjudged by any court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid such judgment shall not affect impair or invalidate the remainder thereof but shall be confined in its operation to the clause sentence  33 notice conduct etc of actions to set aside vacate etc special assessments no action or proceeding to set aside vacate cancel annul review reduce or otherwise question test or affect the legality or validity of any assessment for a local improvement shall be maintained nor shall the legality or validity thereof be subject to question except in an action or proceeding brought for that purpose as herein provided if in the proceedings relative to any such assessment entire absence of jurisdiction on the part of the common council to order the improvement on account of which the assessment was made or any fraud or substantial error other than such errors or irregularities as are specified in the preceding section are alleged to have existed or to have been committed any party or parties aggrieved thereby who shall have filed objections thereto within the time hereinbefore specified and limited therefor may apply to the supreme court at any special term thereof held within the judicial district in which said city is situated for an order vacating or modifying such assessment as to the lands in which he or they have an interest upon the grounds in said objections specified and no other upon due notice of such application to the corporation counsel such court may proceed to hear the proofs and allegations of the parties and determine the same or may appoint a referee to take the proof and report the same or to hear try and determine the same if it shall be determined that there was total want of jurisdiction on the part of the common council to order the improvement on account of which the assessment was made the court may order such assessment as to such party or parties to be vacated if it shall be determined that the common council had jurisdiction to order the improvement and that any such fraud or error has been committed and that the part or parties applying for such relief has or have suffered substantial damage by reason thereof the court may order that said assessment be modified as provided herein as to such party or parties and as so modified it be confirmed a like application may be made to secure a modification or reduction of any such assessment on account of fraud or such substantial error occurring in the performance of the work of the improvement on account of which such assessment is made and shall be determined in like manner if in any such proceeding it shall be determined that fraud or any such substantial error has been committed by reason of which the expense of any local improvement upon the lands of any such aggrieved party has been unlawfully increased the court may order that such assessment be modified by deducting therefrom such amount as is in the same proportion to such assessment as is the whole amount of such unlawful increase is to the whole amount of the expense of such local improvement an order so made in any such proceeding shall be entered in the clerks office of onondaga county and shall have the same force and effect as a judgment the court may during the pendency of any such proceeding stay the collection of any assessment involved therein as against the parties to such proceeding costs and disbursements of any such proceeding may be allowed in the discretion of the court no appeal shall be allowed or taken from the order made in any such proceeding but the determination so made therein shall be final and conclusive upon all parties thereto ny laws 190 ch 75  34 grounds upon which special assessments may be vacated annulled etc  fair market value of improvements to be left undisturbed no court shall cancel annul or vacate any such assessment on any property for any local improvement except for total want of jurisdiction on the part of the common date of the final order of modification and twelve 12 per centum thereafter be disturbed for any cause the provisions of this section shall apply to actions to recover money paid for assessments and shall take judicial notice this act article shall be construed not as an act in derogation of the powers of the state but as one intended to aid the state in the execution of its duties and shall be when this act article takes effect under or by virtue of the law so repealed but the same may be asserted enforced prosecuted or inflicted as fully and to the same extent as if such law had not been repealed  and all actions or proceedings civil or criminal commenced under or by virtue of any law so repealed and pending when this act article takes effect may be prosecuted and defended to final may be created a notwithstanding any inconsistent provision of law to the contrary the city of syracuse is hereby authorized to create by ordinance a special assessment district within the city of syracuse b such ordinance creating such special assessment district shall provide that the city of syracuse shall have the following powers with respect to such special district construction and installation of landscaping planting and park areas  construction of lighting and heating facilities  construction and operation of facilities such as places of amusement and entertainment bus stop shelters decorative lighting benches and street furniture sculptures paintings murals and other works of art booths signs news and music facilities fire hydrants kiosks receptacles canopies pedestrian opening widening or narrowing of existing streets  condemnation of existing structures where necessary in order to carry out special district purposes  construction of ramps sidewalks plazas and pedestrian malls  rehabilitation or removal of existing structures as required  removal and relocation of utilities and vaults as required  provision for additional maintenance andor police personnel as required for the enjoyment and protection of the public  granting of permits to newsstands restaurants entertainment facilities and other desirable private uses and making appropriate charges for such private uses  providing and coordinating parking lot and parking garage facilities within the special district in order to secure maximum availability of public parking  and such other powers as amount of assessments  financing of costs of operating and maintaining improvements a such ordinance shall accurately describe by boundary description or otherwise the properties to be included in said special assessment district which properties shall be subject to assessment for capital improvements to be constructed within the district in no event however shall properties within the special assessment district be assessed for capital improvements of a total cost exceeding three million dollars $300000000 by reason of the provisions of this act article the cost of such capital improvements need not be assessed uniformly against properties within the district properties included within said special assessment district may be assessed according to a formula established by ordinance which in the sole judgment of the syracuse common council reflects benefits accruing to the various properties within the special district by reason of such capital improvements b such ordinance may further provide that the capital improvements and facilities constructed within the said special assessment district as heretofore provided shall be operated and maintained and the cost of such additional operation and maintenance taxed and assessed to the properties benefited within the special district by reason of the construction of such capital improvements and facilities such additional operation and maintenance may be of the kind and nature already being performed by the city of syracuse and the cost of said additional operation and maintenance shall be in addition to operation and maintenance already being performed by the city within the special district such additional operation and maintenance costs need not be assessed uniformly against properties included within said special assessment district but may be assessed according to a formula established by ordinance which in the sole judgment of the syracuse common council reflects benefits accruing to the various properties within the special assessment district by reason of such additional operation and maintenance ny laws 197 ch 405  3 public hearing required prior to adoption of ordinance creating except as otherwise noted the catchlines for the sections in this article were furnished by the editor none being present in the legislation from which this is derived collection of county and state taxes by city  compromise of delinquent county and state taxes by city 1 the commissioner of assessment of the city of syracuse shall on or before october 15 of each year certify to the onondaga county legislature the total amount of assessments on all taxable property within the city of syracuse the commissioner shall not be required to prepare duplicate assessment rolls for the county legislature 2 during the first week of november of each year the county legislature shall furnish to the city commissioner of assessment and the syracuse common council a certified copy of a resolution commonly known as city abstract showing the estimated amount necessary to be levied for state and county taxes and the rate thereof 3 it shall be the duty of the proper officers of the city of syracuse to assess real property and subsequent to the tax levy by the common council to extend and collect state and county taxes and special ad valorem levies for county special districts on all taxable property in the city of syracuse this shall be accomplished in the same manner in the same proceedings with the same force and effect and subject to the same discount fees penalties and proceedings for the collection of taxes as is prescribed in the charter of the city of syracuse and general special laws applicable to city taxes 4 the state and county tax rate and the city tax rate may be added together and extended and collected in one item 5 the county commissioner of finance shall reimburse the city of syracuse the amount of the discount allowed on payment of state and county taxes as shown on a certificate to be furnished by the city commissioner of finance on or before december thirtyfirst the city shall be entitled to one percent of the total state and county taxes levied as a fee for collecting same said one percent collection fee as well as an estimated amount for aforesaid discounts shall be included in the city abstract 6 on the first tuesday of each month the city commissioner of finance shall pay to the county commissioner of finance all state and county taxes plus fees and penalties which he has collected and entered upon his books during the preceding month a certified statement shall accompany each transmittal setting forth the following information a the amount of current taxes being transmitted  b the amount of fees and penalties on current taxes  c the identity of each delinquent tax being transmitted  and d amount of fees and penalties on each delinquent tax simultaneously therewith the city commissioner of finance shall submit to the county a claim for its collection fee of one percent of the amount of the current years taxes being transmitted any balance due on the one percent collection fee due the city shall be paid on or before december thirtyfirst of each year 7 the county commissioner of finance shall refund to the city of syracuse upon a certificate to be furnished by the city commissioner of assessment the amount of all state and county taxes that have been paid and transmitted to the county and subsequently determined to be erroneous or unlawful as defined in title 3 of of the real property tax law 8 on or before january 15 annually the city commissioner of finance shall make and deliver to the county commissioner of finance account delinquent tax roll subscribed and affirmed by him as true of state and county taxes listed on the tax roll which remain unpaid as of december 31 of the previous calendar year the county commissioner of finance if satisfied that said account is correct shall credit the city with the amount of said delinquent taxes 9 the city is authorized to compromise delinquent state and county taxes with prior written consent of the county executive or his duly authorized representative in accordance with the procedure set forth in the tax and assessment act of the city of syracuse being of the laws of 190 as amended or the charter of the city of syracuse and within thirty 30 days after receipt of payment from any such compromise the city shall remit to the county its proportionate share of the state and county taxes collected which have not been paid to the county previously in the event that the city shall sell any property it has acquired as a result of the nonpayment of taxes in accordance with the charter of the city of syracuse the city shall remit to the county the full amount of state and county taxes due to the county provided however that if the sale was with the prior consent of the county executive or his duly authorized representative and was for less than the full amount of taxes due to the city and county the city shall remit to the county its proportionate share of the sale price in the event that the city shall sell any property for less than the full amount of delinquent taxes due to the city and county without the prior consent of the county executive or his duly authorized representative the city shall pay to the county the full amount of the delinquent taxes due to the county in the event the city shall elect to retain title to such property for municipal purposes then in that event the city shall remit to the county the full amount for all delinquent state and county taxes not previously paid to the county as of the date of acquisition 10 such state and county tax levied by the city of syracuse or by its officers as herein provided together with interest fees and penalties are and shall remain until actually paid or satisfied a lien upon the taxable property upon which the same have been levied from the time the tax roll containing said tax shall be filed with the city treasurer or other officer performing his functions the unpaid taxes in the towns of the county of onondaga shall be returned to the county commissioner of finance by the various collectors of such towns as prescribed by law and the county commissioner of finance shall proceed to collect the same and enforce such collection in the manner hereinafter provided ny laws 193 ch 690  1  ny laws 194 ch 710 pt 3  963  ny laws 196 ch 263  1  ny laws 196 ch 768  1  ny laws 197 ch 712  1 duty of county owneroccupants with respect to sales of tax delinquent residential properties which are the subject of competing offers sales may be made to persons not submitting the highest offer in the following situations 1 persons desiring to buy such property should be asked to state whether they are willing to be domiciled in the property for at least one year and to give assurances of such under penalty of reverter to the city or under other penalties deemed acceptable to the corporation counsel 2 where such persons give assurances of being so domiciled in the property a sale to such person may be recommended even where another person who is not willing to give such assurances may offer a higher price for the property  however where two 2 or more persons submit such assurances a sale will be considered to the person submitting the higher offer 3 a sale in these circumstances for less than the highest offer need not be made a if the proposed purchasers ability to repair maintain and pay taxes associated with the property is not reasonably established  b where the offer does not meet the citys estimate of fair market value  or c where the terms and conditions of the sale are not met relocation assistance plan a the city of syracuse will replace all occupied and vacant occupiable lowmoderate income dwelling units demolished or converted to a use other than as lowmoderate income housing as a direct result of activities assisted with funds provided under the housing and community development act of 197 as amended as described in 24 cfr b1 b all replacement housing will be provided within three 3 years of the commencement of the demolition or rehabilitation relating to conversion before obligating or expending funds that will directly result in such demolition or conversion the city of syracuse will make public and submit the hud field office the following information in writing 1 a description of the proposed assisted activity  2 the general location on a map and approximate number of dwelling units by size number of bedrooms that will be demolished or converted to a use other than as lowmoderate income dwelling units as a direct result of the assisted activity  3 a time schedule for the commencement and completion of the demolition or conversion  4 the general location on a map and approximate number of dwelling units by size number of bedrooms that will be provided as replacement dwelling units  5 the source of funding and a time schedule for the provision of replacement dwelling units  and 6 the basis for concluding that each replacement dwelling unit will remain a lowmoderate income dwelling unit for at least ten 10 years from the date of initial occupancy c the city of syracuse may provide relocation assistance to each lowmoderate income household displaced by the demolition of housing or by the conversion of a lowmoderate dwelling to another use as a direct result of assisted activities however no relocation assistance shall be provided by the city of syracuse when either the relocation is necessitated by conditions or violations caused by any member of the household or such assistance would duplicate in whole or in part relocation assistance provided by another governmental agency relocation assistance will include the following 1 timely notice of relocation to another dwelling 2 referral to replacement housing opportunities of comparable size and condition within the city of syracuse and preferably within the same neighborhood 3 relocation and replacement housing financial assistance that is reasonable and minimized financial hardship to the household prior to the disbursement of any financial assistance the household shall submit written receipts andor invoices for eligible reimbursable expenses d consistent with the goals and objectives of activities assisted under the act the city of syracuse will take the following steps to minimize the displacement of persons from their homes 1 prior to demolition all residential units will be inspected by the department of community development division of code enforcement to determine structural integrity and repairability only those units certified as structurally unsound or unfit for repair will be slated for demolition however funds provided to the city of syracuse under the housing and community development act of 197 as amended shall not support the citys demolition activities 2 all city owned or tax delinquent vacant repairable residential units will be actively marketed by the city of syracuse for rehabilitation and occupancy priority is given to owner occupants pursuant to guidelines established by the common council and financial assistance for property rehabilitation is provided homestead program funded under the citys community development block grant program 3 cdbg funds provided to nonowner occupants who are eligible for and accepted into the citys rehabilitation loan program shall be determined by and for and serve to act upon addressing major code violations funds shall not be made available for improvements which would encourage conversion to other than lowmoderate income housing 4 cdbgfunded rehabilitation loan program assistance shall not to the extent practicable involve displacement of tenants the intake and loan approval process including onsite inspections shall determine occupancy status prior to during and following planned rehabilitation 5 developers requesting cdbg or rental rehabilitation funds must sign an agreement certifying that following rehabilitation units shall be available to lowmoderate income households to levels mandated under the housing and community development act of 197 as amended    area relocation payment schedule adopted the city of syracuse subject established  functions the syracuseonondaga county drug and alcohol abuse commission be and is hereby established with the following functions 1 to provide a mechanism for cooperative and collaborative action and activities among law enforcement education business government treatment and the community at large to enable an effective preventive educational enforcement and rehabilitative approach 2 to promote awareness of the dangers of substance abuse by sharing information among professionals and the community at large 3 to provide a sounding board for future drug and alcohol abuse programs in syracuse and onondaga county 4 to act as a stimulus for new approaches to deal with drug and alcohol abuse in syracuse and onondaga county 5 to actively encourage efforts of the city and county governments the receipt of grants from the public and private sectors for educational preventative treatment rehabilitation and enforcement activities regardless of the ultimate recipients if such grants are in the interest of the people of syracuse and onondaga county 6 the commission shall recommend and report to the mayor of the city of syracuse and the county executive of onondaga county and other appropriate agencies 7 the commission shall consist of fifty 50 members to be selected as follows a eighteen 18 positions shall be jointly and permanently designated by both the mayor and county executive as conferring exofficio membership with voting and full membership privileges to the persons holding those positions the positions are 1 chairman of the onondaga county legislature 2 president of the syracuse common council 3 chair of the health committee onondaga county legislature 4 chair of the public safety committee syracuse common council 5 chief of police city of syracuse 6 sheriff county of onondaga 7 us attorney for the northern district new york state 8 onondaga county district attorney 9 commissioner onondaga county department of mental health 10 district 17 superintendent ocm boces 18 executive director syracuseonondaga county youth bureau the aforementioned members may designate as an alternate a representative from the same department or program to attend meetings in hisher place b the onondaga county executive shall appoint twelve 12 voting members each of whom shall serve for a threeyear term and the county legislature shall appoint four 4 members each of whom shall serve for a threeyear term in making appointments of these members the county executive and the onondaga county legislature shall make every effort to make selections representative of the broad diversity of onondaga county c the mayor of the city of syracuse shall appoint twelve 12 voting members each of whom shall serve for a threeyear term and the syracuse  business regulations generally pt o ch 9 article i  in general title this code chapter shall be known as the consumer protection the city of syracuse new york art i  a 22574   purpose to provide for the health safety and wellbeing of consumers in the city of syracuse by education investigation and enforcement of minimal standards of fairness as set forth in this code and rules and regulations promulgated pursuant thereto this code chapter intends to provide reasonable safeguards to insure a fair market place in syracuse art i  b 22574   scope this code chapter shall apply to unfair deceptive or unconscionable trade practices their prevention and remedies and consumer education as well as administration and enforcement of this code chapter which shall seek to foster trade practices which are in the best interests of the health safety and welfare of the general public art i  c 22574   nonapplicability nothing in this code chapter shall apply to any television or radio broadcasting station or to any publisher or printer of a newspaper magazine or other form of printed advertising who broadcasts publishes or prints an advertisement which violates this code chapter except insofar as such station or publisher or printer knowingly and willfully aids and encourages such deceptive or unconscionable practice with sale or offering for sale of its goods or services gen art i  d 22574   severability in the event that any portion of this code chapter or the rules and regulations promulgated thereto is adjudged invalid by a court of law such judgment shall be limited in its operation to the part provision or application directly involved in the controversy in such judgment art i  e 22574   definitions words and terms used in this code chapter shall have the following meanings 1 consumer a purchaser lessee or recipient or prospective purchaser lessee or recipient of consumer goods or services or consumer credit including a coobligor or surety 2 consumer goods services credit and debts goods services credit and debts which are primarily for personal household or family purposes 3 deceptive trade practice any false falsely disparaging or misleading oral or written statement visual description or other representation of any kind which has the capacity tendency or effect of deceiving or misleading consumers which is made in connection with the sale lease rental or loan of consumer goods or services the extension of consumer credit  or the collection of consumer debts deceptive trade practices include but are not limited to a representations that i goods or services have sponsorship approval accessories characteristics ingredients uses benefits or quantities that they do not have  ii the merchant has a sponsorship approval status affiliation or connection that he does not have  iii goods are original or new if they are deteriorated altered reconditioned reclaimed or secondhand  iv goods or services are of particular standard quality grade style or model if they are of another b the use in any oral or written representation of exaggeration innuendo or ambiguity as to a material fact  c failure to state a material fact if such use or failure deceives or tends to deceive  d disparaging the goods services or business of another by false or misleading representations of material facts  e consistently offering goods or services without intent to supply reasonably expectable public demand unless the offer discloses the limitation  f offering goods or services without intent to sell them  g making false or misleading representations of fact concerning the reason for existence of or amounts of price reductions  or the price in comparison to price of competitors or ones own price at a past or future time  h falsely stating that a consumer transaction involves consumer rights remedies or obligations  i falsely stating that services replacements or repairs are needed  and j falsely stating the reasons for offering or supplying goods or services at sale or discount prices  k communicating with the debtor or any member of his family or household with such frequency or at such unusual hours or in such a manner as can reasonably be expected to abuse or harass the debtor  l any deception fraud false pretense false premise misrepresentation or the knowing concealment suppression or omission of any material fact with the intent that consumers rely upon such concealment suppression or omission in connection with the sale or advertisement of any merchandise or with the subsequent performance of person aforesaid whether or not any person has in fact been misled deceived or damaged thereby  m use of the word free except as herein provided i when making free or similar offers all substantial terms conditions and obligations upon which the right to take advantage of such offer is directly depended shall appear in close conjunction with the offer of free merchandise or service and in a manner which is as prominent as the offer of free merchandise or service for the purpose of this regulation placement of the terms of an offer set forth in a footnote of an advertisement to which reference is made by an asterisk or other symbol placed next to the offer is not in close conjunction ii if a consumer good or service is to be given free upon the purchase of some additional merchandise or service said additional service or merchandise must not be sold at above the regular price nor may the quantity or quality of the product be diminished  iii a free offer of a single size of a product or a single kind of a service shall not be advertised by the same person in a trade area for more than six 6 months in any twelve 12 month period at least thirty 30 days shall elapse before another such offer is promoted in the same trade area no more than three 3 such offers shall be made in the same area in a twelve 12 month period  iv no free offer shall be made in connection with the introduction of a new product or service offered for sale at a specified price unless offeror expects in good faith to commence selling the product or service promoted separately at the same price at which it was promoted with a free offer  v the use of any term in an advertisement which tends to indicate that the goods or service is free shall fall within the purview of this code chapter  vi for the purposes of this regulation the following definitions shall apply a free free shall mean that a consumer shall pay nothing for an article so offered and not more than the regular price for any other article which must be purchased by the consumer in order to avail himself of said free offer  b regular price the term regular price shall mean the price in the same quantity quality and with the same service at which the seller or advertiser of said product or service has openly and actively sold the product or service in the trade area in which he is making a free or similar offer for a prior period of thirty 30 days for consumer products or services which fluctuate in price the regular price shall be the lowest price at which any substantial sales were made during the aforesaid thirty 30 days period n use of the words special bargain savings or similar language except as herein provided i when the words special bargain savings or similar language represent a reduction in price in comparison to ones own price at a past or specified future time  ii when the words special bargain savings or similar language represent an increase in quantity where quantity was limited in the immediate past or will be limited at a specified future time o advertising price shall be deemed a deceptive trade practice if any of the following rules are violated i when price is advertised in dollar amounts and fractions thereof said numbers indicating the fractional amounts must be clear and conspicuous in the body of such advertisement  ii the price advertised must be clearly and conspicuously related to a specific consumer good or service  iii if at any time there are substantial conditions or obligations upon which the right to take advantage of a sale item is dependent such conditions or obligations must be made known in the body of the advertisement of such sale as used in this section the phrase conditions or obligations shall mean such conditions upon which receipt and retention of an item are directly dependent conditions such as length of sale location of sale quantity of sale items where there is a limited supply credit restrictions and shipping and handling charges shall be deemed to be conditions which must be made known such terms as sorry no mail or phone no cods and the like are not to be considered substantial conditions or obligations 4 director the director of the consumer affairs unit of the department of law 5 merchant a manufacturer supplier seller lessor creditor or other person firm or corporation who makes available to consumers either directly or indirectly goods services or credit 6 person an individual proprietor partnership corporation firm cooperative association or any other group of individuals however organized 7 unconscionable trade practice any act or practice is unconscionable if it takes unfair advantage of the lack of knowledge ability experience or capacity of a consumer which results in a gross disparity in the rights of the consumer as against the merchant or results in a gross disparity between the value received by a consumer and the price paid by the consumer unconscionable trade practices include but are not limited to a charging for an estimate without informing consumer of said charge prior to rendering the estimate  b failure to provide a written estimate of repairs alterations modifications or servicing when requested by a consumer and the subsequent repair alteration modification or servicing of any item without first tendering said estimate  c making repairs alterations modifications or servicing exceeding by twenty 20 percent or more the price quoted in a written estimate without prior approval either written or verbal of a consumer  d failure to reassemble or restore an electrical or mechanical apparatus appliance chattel or other goods or merchandise to its tendered condition unless a service or labor charge is paid without notification prior to receiving the tendered item of said service or labor charge  e failing to supply to a consumer a copy of a sales or service contract lease promissory note trust agreement or other evidence of indebtedness which that person may execute  f making or enforcing unconscionable terms or provisions of sales or leases in applying this subsection consideration shall be given to gross disparity between the price of the property or services measured by the price at which similar property or services are readily obtainable in transactions by like buyers or lessees g knowingly taking advantage of the inability of the consumer reasonably to protect his interests by reason of physical or mental infirmities ignorance illiteracy or inability to understand the language of the agreement or similar factors  h replacing parts or components in an electrical or mechanical apparatus appliance chattel or other goods or merchandise when such parts or components are not defective or worn unless requested by the customer  i falsely stating or representing that repairs alterations modifications or servicing have been made and receiving remuneration therefore when they have not been  j the collection of a debt concerned with the sale or rental of a consumer good or services if i the alleged creditor communicates or threatens to communicate the nature of a consumer claim to the debtors employer prior to obtaining final judgment against the debtor the provisions of this subdivision shall not prohibit a principal creditor from communicating with the debtors employer to execute a wage assignment agreement if the debtor has  ii said alleged creditor his assignee agent or employee creates the notion of legal service or sanction of a governmental agency when contacting the alleged debtor when such is not the case  iii contact other than the service of judicial process with the alleged debtor by an alleged creditor his assignee agent or employee is attempted at hours of the day or night considered not to be reasonable  k attempting to induce a sale or solicitation by appealing to the sympathies or fears of the person so solicited art i  f 22574   administration 1 a consumer affairs office is hereby established for the city of syracuse to administer and secure compliance with this code chapter this office shall be under the direction of a director of consumer affairs who shall be appointed by the mayor the director shall be the chief administrative officer of the consumer affairs office 2 the consumer affairs office shall be composed of an enforcement and regulation unit a weights and measures unit a government services unit and an administrative unit 3 the common council committee on education and human development is hereby designated to serve as an advisory body to the consumer affairs office art ii  a 22574     declaration of unlawfulness deceptive trade practices and unconscionable trade practices are hereby declared unlawful in the city of syracuse new york art ii  b 22574   powers and duties of the director the director of the consumer affairs office or his delegate shall have the following powers and duties 1 to receive and investigate consumer complaints regarding business and commercial practices throughout the city of syracuse  2 to conduct investigations research studies surveys and analyses of matters affecting the interests of city of syracuse consumers  3 to enforce throughout the city all state and local laws and regulations and rules regarding consumer protection and weights and measures  4 to be of assistance to all residents of the city relative to services provided by all governmental agencies in the city of syracuse  5 to initiate implement and administer such consumer protection programs and activities throughout the city as shall be appropriate including the examination and testing of foods food packages and other food containers to determine quantity and quality of content  6 to examine prepackaged goods and products of every kind and nature to determine safety and the propriety and accuracy of weight labeling and pricing  7 to implement educational programs to inform the general public on proper and lawful marketing practices and procedures  8 to undertake special activities to inform welfare recipients the elderly those persons not fluent in either written or spoken english and other groups of people who operate at a disadvantage in the market place in addition to the use of mass media communications for this purpose simplified versions of the consumer protection code shall be posted in agencies that service these groups of people furthermore easily accessible filled offices may be periodically established to provide consumer protection services to these groups of people  9 to undertake activities to encourage local business industry and government to maintain high standards of honesty fair business practices and public responsibility in the production promotion and sale of consumer goods and services  10 to endeavor or eliminate unfair dealings or causes for complaint by conference conciliation and persuasion  11 to initiate his own investigations of frauds or unfair dealings against consumers  12 to conduct a hearing in accordance with of this section 210 when a complaint is not resolved to the satisfaction of the director conference and persuasion  13 to represent consumer interests before legislative regulatory and administrative bodies  14 to cooperate with other agencies public and private in the development of standards and quality grades for consumer goods and services  15 to receive administer pay over and distribute monies collected in and as a result of actions brought for violations of the law  16 to commence legal actions on behalf of any consumer or class of consumers in courts of appropriate jurisdiction or in appropriate agencies  17 to report to the appropriate law enforcement agencies any information concerning possible violations of a penal nature of any consumer protection laws  18 to secure from the appropriate legal officer such subpoenas as are necessary to conduct investigations and to take action against alleged violations of this code  19 to exercise and perform such other functions powers and duties as may be deemed necessary or appropriate to carry out the purposes of this consumer code gen art ii  c 22574     hearing procedures 1 filing of complaint all complaints must be in writing signed by the complainant on a form to be prescribed by the director complaints may be filed at the consumer affairs office in person or by mail copies of all relevant documents including advertisements should be attached to the complaint 2 docketing and numbering complaints each complaint shall be docketed and given a number correspondence with the office of consumer affairs should bear the complaint number 3 determination of jurisdiction within a reasonable time after filing each complaint will be reviewed to determine whether the office of consumer affairs has jurisdiction thereof the office of consumer affairs shall notify the complainant by mail if it is determined that no jurisdiction exists 4 notice of complaint if the office of consumer affairs determines that it has jurisdiction it shall inform the respondent by certified mail  with return receipt requested 1 the substance of the complaint filed against him  2 when and by whom it was filed  3 that the respondent has the right to respond to the complaint  4 that any response must be sent by mail within five 5 days following receipt of the office of consumer affairs letter  5 that unless a response is made demonstrating clearly that the division lacks jurisdiction or there is no substantial claim a hearing may be set on the matter nothing in this subdivision shall act to preclude the office of consumer affairs from contacting the respondent by telephone or other means for attempted resolution of the complaint 5 calling and notice of hearing the office of consumer affairs may call a hearing respecting any complaint and fix that date and place of hearing at least five 5 days prior to the time of the hearing date the office of consumer affairs shall send by certified mail to each party a notice stating 1 the time and place of the hearing  2 a copy of the statute or rule involved  and 3 unless the substance of the complaint was adequately stated in the original notice of complaint the substance of the complaint 6 conduct of hearing a hearing is an informal proceeding the parties shall appear before a duly assigned hearing officer who shall be the director or the directors designate opportunity shall be afforded to the complainant and respondent to present evidence and argument on all issues involved and to cross examine all witnesses who have testified the hearing officer may question any party or witness when the hearing officer deems it appropriate the director of the office of consumer affairs shall be authorized to secure from the appropriate legal officer such subpoenas as are necessary to compel the attendance of witnesses and the production of tangible evidence a hearing officer may expel any party or attorney from any hearing for improper disorderly or contemptuous conduct any relevant evidence which is not privileged is admissible without regard to whether such evidence is heresay or otherwise inadmissible in a court of law the hearing officer may exclude irrelevant immaterial or unduly repetitious evidence each party has the right to representation by counsel at his own expense a hearing officer may administer an oath or affirmation to any person upon request of either party or upon his own initiative either party or the office of consumer affairs may cause the hearing to be transcribed at his or its own expense the hearing officer shall make a written finding based on substantial evidence that a violation of any statute rule or regulation under the office of consumer affairs jurisdiction has occurred the respondent and complainant shall be notified by mail of any such finding 7 failure to appear at hearing upon failure of a duly notified respondent to appear at a hearing after issuance of a subpoena the director shall be authorized to ask the corporation counsel to seek a contempt citation in a court of competent jurisdiction failure of one party to appear at a scheduled hearing does not preclude the hearing officer from receiving evidence from and hearing arguments by the other party the hearing officer may make a finding notwithstanding the absence of one of the parties upon failure of the complainant to appear the hearing officer may in his discretion terminate the matter 8 hearing officer to be impartial no person with financial or other interest relative to a complaint shall serve as hearing officer any party may challenge the impartiality of any hearing officer by presenting an objection in writing to the hearing officer or to the director the director shall consider and determine such objection 9 continuance of date of hearing a continuance may be granted in the discretion of the hearing officer for good cause a request for a continuance must be made no later than fortyeight 48 hours preceding the date and time of the hearing any such request made later than fortyeight 48 hours preceding the date and time of the hearing will be granted only in a case of unexpected emergency 10 nothing contained in this section shall be construed to restrict any legal remedy available to the director or the department of law under this code chapter or any applicable local state or federal laws art ii  d 22574     rules and regulations 1 the director may adopt such rules and regulations as may be necessary to effectuate the purposes of this code chapter except that any such rules or regulations that shall affect a penalties b subpoena powers c enforcement and d the definition of specific deceptive or unconscionable trade practices must first be approved by the common council 2 it shall be the policy of the consumer affairs office to offer the public an opportunity to comment upon any regulation proposed by the director prior to final adoption of the regulation all regulations adopted by the director shall be available to the public regulations other than those adopted by the common council shall be adopted in the following manner a at least thirty 30 days before the effective date of a proposed regulation the director shall send a copy of the proposed regulation to the mayor the city clerk each member of the common council shall cause the proposed regulation be published in a newspaper of general circulation in syracuse and shall invite those persons and the public to comment upon the proposed regulation orally or in writing during this period  b after thirty 30 days have elapsed or the period for public comment has ended whichever occurs later the director shall promulgate the regulation in its final form by sending a copy to the city clerk and by causing the regulation to be published in a newspaper of general circulation in syracuse the regulation shall be effective on the date it is published unless a later date is established in the regulation c where such action is necessary to protect the public interest the director may waive the procedure set forth in subsection a and adopt a regulation to be effective immediately by promulgation in the manner set forth in subsection b art ii  e 22574     penalties and remedies 1 criminal penalties a knowingly and willfully engaging in committing or assisting another to commit a deceptive trade practice or engaging in committing or assisting another to commit an unconscionable trade practice is an offense b any person who shall knowingly and willfully violate this code chapter by committing or assisting in the commission of a deceptive trade practice or an unconscionable trade practice shall be punished by a fine of not less than one hundred fifty dollars $15000 and not more than five hundred dollars $50000 or by imprisonment for not more than fifteen 15 days or both a fine and imprisonment 2 civil penalties a any person who shall violate any provision of this code chapter or the rules and regulations promulgated thereunder shall be liable to a civil penalty in the sum of not more than one thousand dollars $100000 b upon a finding by the director of repeated multiple or persistent violation of any provisions of the consumer code or of any rule or regulation promulgated thereunder the director may with the consent of the corporation counsel bring an action to compel the proceeds thereof received to pay all monies properties or other things or proceeds thereof received as a result of such violations into court to be disbursed pursuant to the applicable provisions of the new york civil practice law and rules c in any action brought under the provisions of this code chapter or the rules and regulations promulgated thereunder the consumer affairs office is entitled to recover from the violator the offices cost for investigation and hearing provided a repeated multiple or persistent violation has been established by the director of the consumer affairs office 3 remedies a whenever any person has engaged in any acts or practices which constitute violations of any provision of this code chapter or any rule or regulation promulgated thereto the consumer affairs office may take application to the supreme court for an order enjoining such acts or practices and for an order granting a temporary or permanent injunction restraining order or other order enjoining such acts or practices b whenever any person has engaged in an unconscionable or deceptive trade practice to the detriment of a consumer such consumer may seek redress in a court of appropriate jurisdiction except that no consumer shall have the authority to sue for a civil penalty or to commence a criminal action as provided by the code chapter art iii  a 22574     settlements 1 in lieu of instituting or continuing an action pursuant to this consumer code chapter or any rule or regulation promulgated thereto the director may accept a written assurance of discontinuance of any act or practice in violation of this code chapter from the person or persons who have engaged in such acts or practices such settlement agreement may include but is not limited to a stipulation for voluntary payment by the violator of the costs or investigation by the director and may also include a stipulation for the restitution by the violator to consumers of money property or other things received from them in connection with a violation of this code chapter including money necessarily expended in the course of making and pursuing a complaint to the director if such stipulation applies to consumers who have been affected by the violators practices but have not yet complained to the director the settlement agreement must be approved by court which shall direct the minimum means by which potential claimants shall be notified of the agreement a consumer need not accept restitution pursuant to such a settlement agreement  his acceptance shall bar recovery of any other damages in any action by him against the defendant or defendants on account of the same acts or practices 2 all settlement agreements shall be made a matter of public record 3 violation of a settlement agreement entered into pursuant to this section shall be treated as a violation of this code chapter and shall be subject to all the penalties provided therefor art iii  b 22574   judicial review any person or persons jointly or severally aggrieved by any final order of the director of the consumer affairs office may seek to have such order reviewed by a court of competent jurisdiction in the manner prescribed by law art iv  a 22574     secs 215225  reserved article ii  regulations division 1  generally secs the city of syracuse  miscellaneous provisions pigeon control a pigeons a public nuisance the commissioner of health of the city of syracuse having on  found that pigeons are a public nuisance in this city the common council upon such finding and after investigations made by or on its behalf and upon information and reports contained in news media that large numbers of uncontrolled pigeons roost and make their nests on the roofs and in the crevices of various public and private buildings and structures within the city also finds that pigeons in the city of syracuse have become a public nuisance b permits for control purposes and in order to prevent public distress caused by the foregoing pigeon nuisance the city clerk on behalf of the common council is authorized to issue permits to trap pigeons in the city of syracuse in accordance with provisions of section 185 formerly section 206 of the conservation law of the state of new york as amended and adopt reasonable rules and regulations for the issuance and termination of such permits the city clerk may revoke any such permit for violation of the terms thereof or of this ordinance section after giving the permittee an opportunity to be heard thereon upon at least ten 10 days written notice thereof served in person or by mail c disposition of trapped pigeons any pigeon or pigeons found in any of said traps so set up placed or permitted to be placed for trapping purposes shall if the same shall be fit for such purposes be disposed of for food purposes within the meaning of said section 185 of the state conservation law as amended all sick injured or unfit pigeons found in said traps shall be placed in the charge or care of the central new york society for the prevention of cruelty to animals for disposition in the manner provided by law whenever any antwerp or homing pigeon wearing a ring or seamless band and with its registered number stamped thereon within the meaning of section 185 of the said conservation law as amended is found among such trapped pigeons the same shall be immediately released from custody or placed in the care or charge of the central new york society for the prevention of cruelty to animals for disposition pursuant to law d expiration each such permit unless sooner terminated as herein provided shall expire on december 31st of the year in which issued amended and renumbered as to read as follows 1416 emergency repair service a purpose the city of syracuse has numerous multiple dwellings and residential mixed use buildings equipped with elevators these elevators are intended to promote a certain quality of life for the residential tenants occupying said buildings recognizing that elevator equipment occasionally breaks down it is in the citys interest in providing for the lives safety and welfare of its citizenry to ensure that said elevators are repaired in a timely manner and maintained operational at all times b mandated emergency repairs a responsible person for a multiple dwelling or residential mixed use building shall call an elevator company employing a licensed installer or licensed mechanic to respond to a request for emergency repair service within two 2 hours after said responsible person has been notified that an elevator is out of service the aforesaid responsible person shall make every good faith effort to have a elevator company employing a licensed installer or licensed mechanic restore the elevator to service at the time of the initial service call in the event that the repair to the elevator cannot be made said responsible person shall secure documentation from the elevator company as to the reason the elevator was not placed back in service at the time of the initial call in order to general governing rules the board of zoning appeals shall be governed by the provisions of all applicable state statutes local laws ordinances and these rules rules of 102058  101  rules of 12993  101 officers and duties 1 chairman and vicechairman the board shall elect annually from its members by a majority vote a chairman and vicechairman who may be elected to succeed themselves the chairman or in his or her absence or incapacity the vicechairman shall decide all points of order or procedure may administer oaths and may compel the attendance of witnesses 2 secretary in accordance with part a section ii article 5 of the zoning rules and regulations as amended the director of planning or a designee ie zoning administrator shall act as secretary the secretary shall keep all records conduct all correspondence of the board and supervise the clerical work of the board the secretary shall keep a minute book of the proceedings of each meeting and each hearing which shall include the vote or abstention of each member on each question the names and addresses of all witnesses a summary of the facts on which the decision is based the decision rendered and any other official actions of the board rules of 102058  201  rules of 12993  201 meetings 1 quorum a quorum shall consist of four 4 voting members of the board 2 time of meeting a regular meetings shall be scheduled every three 3 weeks except during the months of november when meetings may be scheduled every four 4 weeks meetings shall be held on thursdays at  pm or at such other time as the chairman shall designate the first regular meeting in july shall constitute the annual organization meeting of the board b special meetings may be called by the chairman at any time provided that at least fortyeight 48 hours notice shall be given each member before a special meeting is held the chairman shall call a special meeting within ten 10 days of receipt of a written request from any two 2 members of the board special meetings including night meetings may also be scheduled at any meeting of the board by a majority vote of its members provided adequate time is given to post notice at least ten 10 days in advance for any hearing that might be held 3 cancellation of meetings whenever there are no appeals for special exceptions variances or other pertinent business to be considered at a regular meeting the chairman may dispense with such meeting by so notifying each member at least fortyeight 48 hours prior to the time set for such meeting 4 order of business the order of business shall be a approval of minutes b adoption of resolutions from previous meetings c public hearings d action on held cases e action on new cases f other business g adjournment 5 voting and disqualification of members all matters shall be decided by roll call vote the affirmative vote of at least four 4 voting members of the board present when such matters are heard shall be required for decisions on 1 matters requiring public hearings 2 matters which reverse any order requirements decision or determination made by the division of code enforcement or any administrative officer charged with the enforcement of the zoning rules and regulations 3 matters to decide in favor of an applicant upon which the division of code enforcement or administrative officer has been required to make a determination under said rules and regulations and 4 variances to other matters shall be decided by majority vote of those present no member of the board shall sit in hearing on any matter or vote on any matter in which he or she shall be personally or financially interested nor shall he or she vote on the determination of any appeal unless he or she shall have attended the public hearing thereon an exception to the above requirement of attendance at the public hearing shall be made upon a determination by the chairman that a pool of at least four 4 members who were present at such hearing no longer exists or cannot be sustained in which case members who were not present can vote on the matter in question after reviewing the record including the recording or transcript of the hearing rules of 102058  301  rules of 12993  301 public hearings 1 matters requiring public hearings a public hearing shall be required in all matters involving an appeal from any order requirement decision or determination by the division of code enforcement arising from the enforcement of the zoning rules and regulations  an appeal for a variance from the terms of the zoning rules and regulations  an appeal for an exception as specified in the zoning rules and regulations  or a question involving the interpretation of the zoning rules and regulations 2 notice of hearings no appeal shall be decided until after due notice has been given and a public hearing has been held thereon due notice of a hearing shall be as follows a a notice thereof shall be published once in the official newspaper of the city at least ten 10 days before the date of the hearing b the board shall mail notice of the hearing to the appellant or applicant andor his attorney or agent at least ten 10 days before the date of the hearing c the board shall also insofar as practical mail notices of the hearing of an appeal to all properties within a four hundredfoot radius of the premises affected by the appeal except that only a two hundredfoot radius shall be required in cases of area variances notice of the hearing shall also be sent to the member of the common council in whose district the property described in the application is located compliance with this subparagraph however shall not be a condition precedent to proper legal notice and no hearing or action taken thereon shall be deemed invalid or illegal because of any failure to mail the notices provided for in this subparagraph 3 conduct of public hearings any person may appear in person by agent or attorney at any public hearing the order of proceedings in the hearing of each case at a public hearing shall be as follows a reading of the public notice for the hearing by the chairman b reading of pertinent written comments or reports concerning the appeal c witnesses in favor of the appeal d witnesses in opposition to the appeal e rebuttals the chairman or any member of the board may require any witness to swear or affirm that his or her statements of fact are true 4 rehearings in no instance shall a request for reconsideration of a case heard and denied by the board be accepted unless there is a conclusive demonstration presented in writing that a substantial change in facts evidence or condition has occurred in regard to the neighborhood a new request if it involves a waiver of the same permitted uses or involves the same or greater degree of waiver of area requirements neighborhood changes bearing on reconsideration must be circumstances not of the applicants own making which create unnecessary hardship or practical difficulties rules of 102058  401  rules of 12993  401 appeals 1 time limit for appeal an appeal from the action of the division of code enforcement or administrative officer must be made to the board within sixty 60 days after said action 2 filing of appeals all applicants shall file appeals with the office of zoning administration on forms available at said office located at 201 east washington street syracuse new york two 2 copies of all plans and surveys shall be submitted by the applicant to the division of code enforcement appeals for exceptions and variances shall be accompanied by an accurate and intelligible plan drawn to a suitable scale a nonreturnable fee of twentyfive dollars $2500 by check or money order payable to the commissioner of finance is required upon filing of an appeal appeals shall be signed by the property owners or a certified agent 3 calendar the appeal shall be placed on the calendar of the board when the board has substantial factual information to hear the case 4 amendments withdrawals the applicant may not amend or withdraw his application after the official notice of the public hearing has been transmitted to the official newspaper for publication rules of 102058  501  rules of 12993  501 decisions 1 form of decisions all decisions of the board for matters requiring public hearing shall be by resolution the basis for the determination of each appeal and a detailed summary of the facts upon which the determination is made shall be recorded in the decision and shall constitute a part of the record thereof in the case of variances granted the decision shall state the exceptional difficulty or unusual hardship found to exist upon which the appeal is based the decision to grant a variance shall also state in detail the conditions and safeguards to be required 2 expiration of permits unless otherwise specified any order or decision of the board granting an appeal or a special exception shall expire if the relevant building or occupancy permits are not obtained by the applicant within one year of the date the decision becomes final 3 filing of decision the decision of the board shall become final on the date of the filing of the written resolution for such decision with the secretary of the board said date to be known as the release date copies of the decision shall also be sent to the division of code enforcement the department of assessment and the office of the city clerk rules of 102058  601  rules of 12993  601 amendments these rules may be amended at any regular meeting by an affirmative vote of not less than four 4 voting procedure in connection with zoning matters  applications  citizen requests for amendments of the zoning rules and regulations of the zoning plan and map shall be made in writing on forms furnished by the city planning commission and shall be signed by the owners of the property affected or by their duly authorized agent or representative except that requests for amendments to the zoning plan and map concerning large areas shall be supported by a petition signed by fifty 50 percent or more of the owners of the affected property  any application for a text amendment or zone change affecting any protected site or property within a preservation district shall be referred to the preservation board the preservation board shall within a reasonable time submit its recommendation to the city planning commission if the board fails to act within a reasonable time the commission may proceed in accordance with these rules of procedure  no application may be withdrawn after notice of hearing thereon has been given except by the permission of the city planning commission at such hearing upon a showing that the applicant cannot proceed due to circumstances beyond his control or upon the consent of all persons interested and appearing at said hearing  all applications shall be accompanied by sufficient factual information maps pictures reports and studies to show compliance with the general plan of the city of syracuse the need or benefit to the city of the requested change and the appropriateness of the area in question toward meeting these needs  submission requirements for
