property 3 names and mailing addresses of contiguous property owners 4 accurate survey by a licensed surveyor showing property lines with distances and angles north arrow scale date and property address 5 location width and purpose of all existing and proposed easements reservations and areas dedicated to public use within the subject property 6 description of all existing deed restrictions or covenants applying to the subject property 7 for new exterior construction topographic features including a map showing existing contour intervals of no more than five 5 feet twofoot contour intervals are required if the topography is relatively flat areas of steep slopes shall be delineated as necessary hydrologic features including drainage and runoff patterns shall also be shown 8 vegetation cover including existing wooded areas significant isolated trees and similar features 9 dimensioned floor plans drawn to scale 10 elevation sections showing dimensions and construction materials of exterior surfaces 11 proposed location use height and construction material of principal and accessory buildings and other structures such as retaining walls fences and waste disposal units 12 location proposed use design and construction materials of improvements not requiring structures such as parking loading and outside storage areas 13 location size and design of all outdoor operation 19 completion of the pertinent application and environmental assessment form  the city planning commission may delegate to the secretary of the commission or hisher designee the authority to hearings no action to amend the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse or the zoning plan and map will be taken until a public hearing has been held in connection therewith before the city planning commission  notification of city planning commission action requiring a public hearing shall be completed in the following manner 1 a copy of the hearing notice shall be sent to each city planning commission the city clerk the corporation counsel the director of the division of buildings and property rehabilitation the city fire prevention bureau and the preservation board  and 2 hearing proceeds those who are in favor of the application shall be heard first at this time petitions or other evidence in support of the applications shall be received following the above opponents of the application shall be heard and their petitions and evidence against the application shall be received at the discretion of the chairperson rebuttals and counterrebuttals may be permitted the chairperson then declares the public hearing for that case closed any application may be adjourned for hearing at a future date at the discretion of the city planning commission procedure of a hearing shall not necessarily be the same as followed by the courts a record of appearance statements and testimony shall be kept in the manner specified by the city planning commission upon hearing of all applications entered in the calendar the chairperson of the city planning commission shall declare the hearing closed  renewal of applications when an applicant has been denied the city planning commission will not hold a hearing or act upon a new application in regard to the matter contained in the previous application for twelve 12 calendar months from the date of the denial except by the sections herein are articles in the rules of the landmark preservation board general governing rules the landmark preservation board shall be governed by the provisions of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse part c section vii entitled landmark preservation and all applicable state statutes local laws ordinances and these rules rules of 92475 art  officers and duties  chairperson the landmark preservation board hereinafter called the board shall elect by majority vote a chairperson who shall serve in that position for a period of one year such chairperson may be elected to successive terms the chairperson shall preside at all meetings of the full board and shall be empowered to call special meetings of the board as warranted the chairperson shall designate all chairpersons of any committees of the board or absent such designation the committee members may select a committee chairperson  vicechairperson the board shall elect by majority vote a vicechairperson who shall serve for a period of one year such vicechairperson shall serve in the absence or incapacity of the chairperson and shall assume all the powers of the chairperson with respect to the conduct of meetings of the board  secretary the director of planning for the city of syracuse or his designee shall serve as secretary to the board the secretary shall keep all records conduct all correspondence of the board and supervise the clerical work of the board the secretary shall keep minutes of all meetings of the board and shall record all decisions andor recommendations of the board the secretary shall be responsible for notifying all appropriate governmental agencies and affected owners of landmark designations as per the provisions of part c section vii of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse rules of 92475 art  committees  appointment of committees for the purpose of reviewing applications for the designation of preservation districts and protected sites certificates of appropriateness and applications for hardship the board may establish permanent or ad hoc committees consisting of not less than three 3 members of the board the board may determine that such actions shall be directed to the entire board rather than to a committee  action by committees in any case where a committee of the board is authorized to act no final action may be taken by such committee without the prior consent of the full board any standing committee of the board shall make regular reports to the board regarding the activities and recommendations of such committee  rules of committees except as specifically provided otherwise in these regulations the rules of procedure of the preservation board shall apply to its committees rules of 92475 art  procedure for the designation of preservation districts and protected sites  applications citizens requests to the syracuse city planning commission for the designation of protected sites andor preservation districts shall be made in writing on forms furnished by the preservation board such forms shall include information regarding the location of the subject property the owner andor owners of the subject property date of construction architect if known type of construction and other significant data relative to the architectural andor historic importance of the proposed structures  upon receipt of such application the city planning commission shall forward the said application to the preservation board the board shall review the proposed designation and report to the planning commission all findings of fact and recommendations regarding the application the report of the preservation board together with a resolution of the city planning commission shall be forwarded to the city clerk who shall transmit copies of the same to the members of the common council as per the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse any report recommendation or decision of the board shall be in further compliance with of these rules of procedure section 1384 hereof  public hearings public hearings on the designation of a preservation district or a protected site shall be held by the city planning commission in accordance with the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse and the rules of procedure of the city planning commission  where an application for the designation of a preservation district or a protected site has been initiated by the preservation board the chairperson of the board or his designee shall appear before the public hearing considering such designation to give testimony on behalf of the preservation board  where an application for the designation of a preservation district or a protected site has been initiated by an individual or organization other than the preservation board the chairperson of the board or his designee may appear before the public hearing considering such designation to give testimony on behalf of the preservation board  informational hearings the board may hold informational hearings for the benefit of affected property owners governmental agencies and other interested parties with regard to the proposed designation of a preservation district or protected site such informational hearings may be held as warranted by the board the chairperson of the board shall direct the secretary to notify the appropriate individuals organizations and agencies of any such informational hearings  informational hearings may not be substituted for regular public hearings before the city planning commission as per of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse rules of 92475 art  procedure for the issuance of certificates of appropriateness  applications requests by owners of structures located within the preservation districts or designated as protected sites shall apply for the issuance of a certificate of appropriateness in writing on forms furnished by the preservation board such forms shall include information regarding the location of the subject property the owners of the subject property the agent or attorney for the applicant if any the proposed material changes to be made and other sufficient factual information as the board may deem appropriate including but not limited to maps plans sections and elevations photographs reports and studies  upon receipt of such application the board shall review the proposed material changes to be made in accordance with of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse  upon receipt of an application for a certificate of appropriateness the secretary of the board shall notify the appropriate municipal agencies that such an application has been filed no less than one business day after receipt of such application the secretary shall request of such agencies having jurisdiction over the issuance of any building or other permit as may be required by state or local law or regulation that they report to the board any impediment to the issuance of such permits  issuance of certificate if the board shall approve disapprove or approve with specific conditions the issuance of a certificate of appropriateness the secretary shall notify the applicant in writing of such determination such notification shall state the decision of the board and the reasons therefor and shall additionally advise the applicant of his right to a hearing before the board to appeal such determination or to show substantial hardship as a result of such determination  the secretary shall notify all appropriate municipal agencies or departments of the determination of the board regarding the issuance of a certificate including any conditions which may have been imposed by the board rules of 92475 art  procedure for hardship appeals  applications written applications requesting a hearing before the board to appeal a determination of the board regarding the issuance of a certificate of appropriateness may be received by the secretary of the board in accordance with of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse applications shall be filed on forms furnished by the board and shall include information regarding the location of the subject property the owners of the subject property and such other information as the board may deem appropriate  upon receipt of such application for appeal the secretary shall notify the chairperson of the board and the chairpersons of any committees of the board relating to hardship that such application has been received within a reasonable period of time after such notification the chairperson of the board shall call a special meeting of the board to hear such appeal the secretary shall notify the applicant the members of the board and the city clerk of such hearing  action by the board all actions of the board with regard to findings andor recommendations regarding hardship shall be in accordance with of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse and these rules of procedure  the secretary of the board shall notify the city clerk in writing of any findings andor recommendations of the board regarding hardship appeals rules of 92475 art  procedure for review of material changes to cityowned property  referral of plans plans for the construction reconstruction alteration or demolition of any improvement or proposed improvement which is owned by the city or is to be constructed upon property owned by the city and which is contained within a preservation district or located on a protected site shall be referred by the responsible municipal department or agency to the preservation board for review as per of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse  upon receipt of such plans reports and other documents the secretary of the board shall notify all board members and shall with the consent of the chairperson call a special meeting of the board to review such plans  action by the board the secretary shall be responsible for preparing subject to the approval of the board a report which shall be forwarded to the mayor the common council and the referring agency or department such report shall contain the recommendations of the board regarding the work to be undertaken and the reasons for such recommendations for the construction reconstruction alteration or demolition of the subject property which would be in keeping with the intent of of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse rules of 92475 art  meetings  sic quorum a quorum shall consist of a majority of the members of the preservation board or of a committee of the board no business may be conducted before the board and no final action may be taken by the board without such a quorum  meetings regular public meetings shall be scheduled on a monthly basis by the preservation board at the first annual organizational meeting of the board or at such hour and day as the chairperson shall designate or at such hour and day as previously scheduled by members of the board the first regular meeting in june shall constitute the annual organizational meeting of the board the board shall not hold a regular public meeting during the month of august  special meetings may be called by the chairperson or by request of the majority of board members  whenever there is no pertinent business to be considered at a regular public meeting the chairperson may dispense with such meeting by notifying the secretary of the board at least three 3 business days in advance of the scheduled meeting the secretary shall then notify the additional board members at least two 2 business days in advance of the meeting  all regular public meetings of the preservation board and its committees shall be open to the public  the board may deliberate in closed session but every final vote shall be recorded by the secretary and the results of such vote shall be kept permanently on file in the office of the secretary and shall be open to inspection by the general public  voting and disqualification of members all matters before the board shall be decided by rollcall vote except as hereinafter provided all decisions andor recommendations for the designation of preservation districts and protected sites  the issuance of certificates of appropriateness  recommendations regarding hardship  and recommendations regarding cityowned property contained within a preservation district or located upon a protected site shall be made by majority vote of the full membership of the board all other matters shall be decided by majority vote of the voting members present  no member of the preservation board may vote on any matter in which he shall be financially interested or have a conflict of interest nor shall he vote on any matter which shall have been considered at a regular meeting of the board in the absence of said member unless and until such member shall certify in writing to the secretary of the board that he has familiarized himself with the facts and circumstances of such matter before the board no member of the board shall be excluded from discussion of any matter before the board nor shall he be prevented from voting on any matter before the board except in the manner prescribed by these rules and regulations rules of 92475 art  records and decisions  formal decisions all formal decisions andor recommendations of the board concerning the designation of preservation districts and protected sites  the issuance of certificates of appropriateness  recommendations regarding hardship  and recommendations regarding cityowned property contained within a preservation district or located upon a protected site shall be made by resolution of the board and shall be duly recorded by the secretary and kept permanently on file in the office of the secretary all such resolutions shall be open to inspection at any time by the general public the common council the city planning commission and by appropriate municipal agencies and departments  in the event that any member or members of the preservation board shall fail to agree with the majority resolution of the board such member or members of the board may submit his or their reports permanently on file and open to inspection by the general public the common council the city planning commission and the appropriate municipal agencies and departments  the secretary of the board shall be responsible for the transmittal of all resolutions reports and recommendations of the board to the city clerk the city planning commission the office of the mayor and appropriate municipal agencies and departments  all resolutions of the board shall be duly authorized by the signature of the chairperson or the vicechairperson or their designee  informal decisions in carrying out its duties as prescribed by of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse the board may informally advise the mayor the city planning commission the common council appropriate municipal agencies and departments landmark owners and the general public on matters relating to the preservation of protected sites and preservation districts all correspondence informal recommendations and decisions of the board shall be duly recorded by the secretary of the board rules of 92475 art  amendment and filing of rules of procedure these rules of procedure shall be filed with the city clerk of the city of syracuse after their adoption by the board any amendment to these rules of procedures shall be in the manner prescribed for decisions of the preservation board rules of 92475 art  guidelines for review of certificates of appropriateness amendments to the rules of procedure of the landmark preservation board to establish guidelines for the review of certificates of appropriateness in the hanover square preservation district by the addition of the following sections  to the rules  general  these guidelines for the review of certificates of appropriateness shall apply only to exterior building components of the structures in the hanover square preservation district and to the public spaces within the district pursuant to of the zoning rules and regulations  these guidelines shall be used by the syracuse landmark preservation board in reviewing and issuing certificates of appropriateness  in the preparation of reports of the board regarding the improvement or alteration of public spaces  and by appropriate municipal agencies private developers and other interested parties seeking to enhance the spatial architectural visual and historic character of hanover square  these guidelines may be amended by action of the preservation board in accordance with the rules of procedure of the board  purpose  it shall be the purpose of these guidelines to encourage the rehabilitation and reuse of structures in the hanover square preservation district as well as improvements to public spaces which are in keeping with the spatial architectural visual and historic character of hanover square  these guidelines shall not restrict the use of structures within the district except in accordance with the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse  public space the improvement of public space and facilities within the hanover square preservation district including pavement materials for pedestrian and vehicular movement curbs seating trees and planting pedestrian street lighting signage and other elements should be appropriate to the scale form and architectural features of the buildings surrounding hanover square  pavement materials for vehicular movement the improvement of street surfaces shall be in accordance with established practices except that where appropriate pavers or other materials of suitable design should be used to highlight and direct pedestrian movement parking shall be discouraged in the square however where parking spaces are permitted they should be concentrated in or near vehicular rightsofway and not conflict with pedestrian rightsofway  pavement materials for pedestrian areas pavement materials shall be of reinforced concrete and may incorporate paving blocks or other materials of suitable design to highlight or direct pedestrian movement the use of paving materials should respect building and site lines and other architectural features the use of asphaltic blacktop for sidewalks shall not be permitted  street furniture the use of street furniture should be encouraged street furniture may be executed in contemporary or period style but should respect areas of pedestrian movement and congregation site lines and view  plant materials the use of trees and other plant material within hanover square should be encouraged trees should be of a type which shall enhance the space and architectural features or ornamentation trees and plant materials shall be located in a manner which respects building and site lines entrances to structures and pedestrian movement square the relation between hanover square and other areas such as clinton square the city hall area shall be highlighted by the use and placement of trees and plant materials  lighting the use of appropriate pedestrian street lighting should be encouraged street lighting shall be of a size and type which compliments architectural features building height and pedestrian space movement lighting may be either executed in a contemporary or period style but should serve to enhance and not compete with architectural elements  architectural features the architecture of hanover square as expressed building facades and ornamentation is the squares singularly most important visual feature the enhancement of facades rehabilitation and the use of appropriate materials and techniques should be encouraged  cleaning cleaning of facades processes or other means should be undertaken by professional contractors using established practices the use of abrasives should not be prohibited but where architectural ornamentation and detailing would be eroded or where surface construction materials would be irreparably damaged abrasives shall not be permitted  facade work the rehabilitation of facades to their original or period appearance should be encouraged the use of applied or false facades which cover existing surfaces will not be permitted by the board original detailing should be preserved or enhanced where possible except where earlier alterations render such improvements impossible  fenestration the use and arrangement of windows establishes the architectural pattern or rhythm of building facades where possible the appearance of windows and millwork should be preserved or restored to correspond to original appearance the use of contemporary materials to replace worn or damaged wood sashes and frames and the use of new insulated glazing should be encouraged where such treatment does not impair original architectural features and finish colors should be compatible with colors or surface materials and may be contrasting to offset window arrangements where appropriate original millwork shall be repaired where possible and may be painted in colors compatible with surface materials the use of overly bright or phosphorescent colors for window frames sashes or millwork shall not be permitted  painting since many of the structures in hanover square are brick painting of surfaces may be appropriate in the case of the franklin and phoenix buildings the use of compatible or similar colors should be encouraged to enhance the massing and uniformity of upper floors except for stonefaced facades earthtones or similar colors in red yellow and brown should be encouraged while overly bright or phosphorescent colors which would not be compatible with the architectural character of the structures will not be permitted stone surfaces should not be painted  repair the repair or replacement of damaged or worn surface parts and materials may be undertaken pursuant to the provisions of the preservation ordinance where existing materials are to be repaired care should be taken to retain the original appearance of such materials when new materials are to be used they should be fabricated and installed in a fashion which is compatible with the architecture of the structure and surrounding structures the duplication of original materials or appearances should be undertaken to the extent practicable use of new materials and techniques where lack of materials or construction techniques prevents such duplication care should be taken to insure that the new materials are compatible with the architecture of the structure and surrounding structures  lighting the lighting of building facades or portions of a structure may be undertaken for reasons of security or decoration however lighting shall be of incandescent type only and should not directly illuminate adjoining structures or pedestrians space  storefronts and entryways the most substantial alterations or structures within the square have taken place at the street level the rehabilitation of storefronts to a period appearance should be encouraged where possible original surface materials should be exposed and preserved the use of display window areas should be encouraged providing the size and scale of such areas is compatible with the architecture of the structure entryways may be glazed or opaque and finish colors for door frames should be compatible with those for windows for upper stories  awnings and canopies awnings and canopies for storefronts or for upper story windows shall be permitted however awningscanopies shall not project more than 30 from upper stories nor more than 60 from building line at street level  signage  the use of signs to identify businesses and advertise products and services are inherent to the commercial nature of hanover square over the years the size method of lighting arrangement and color of signage in the square has changed dramatically the intent of these guidelines shall be to enhance the spatial architectural visual and historic character of hanover square signs should be viewed as extensions of a structures architecture and should not compete with it for attention at the same time it should not be the intent of these guidelines to create a singular signage type or method of identification all signage shall be additionally designed and installed in accordance with the sign the city of syracuse  criteria for evaluation proposed signage shall be evaluated based on the sign impact size shape texture color method of lighting and attachment to the structure the impact of the sign on the spatial architectural and visual character of the square enhancement of architectural and visual qualities of hanover square and compatibility with site lines view and pedestrian orientation conformance to existing sign regulations for the city of syracuse  signage types single facedsigns attached to the surface of the structure doublefaced projectingsigns perpendicular to the facade with messages on both sides of the sign threedimensionalspecial signs which shall identify particular businesses use of symbols paintedwall signssigns painted directly on front or side walls freestandingkiosk or other types located apart from the principal structure temporary signssigns which are not permanent or seasonal in nature  size sizes of signs and messages contained will vary dependent on the type and method of attachment the size must respect the scale composition and architecture of the structure as well as its compatibility with other structures in the district overlay large signs will not be permitted  sign location no signs shall be located so as to obscure architectural features or details of a structure signs on glass windows are permissible provided that they are small and in proportion to the surface area  materials materials such as wood wrought iron metal grillwork and other types typical of the 19th and early 20th centuries are permissible signs incorporating plastics extruded aluminum etc will not be acceptable freestanding or kiosk signs may incorporate such new materials provided their design is compatible with the existing architecture of the structure which they identify  method of attachment sign attachments should respect the architectural integrity of the structure applied signs would utilize existing stone or brick piers above store fronts  projecting signs may be hung from ornamental brackets or other suitable attachments  lighting backlist signs or a fluorescent type or exposed neon lighting are not appropriate to the character of the district signs which flash revolve or otherwise are in motion will not be permitted direct or indirect front lighting for signage is appropriate provided that such lighting does not produce glare on adjoining structures or the street  offpremise advertising billboards or other advertising for businesses outside of the district will not be permitted  public signs signage for purposes of traffic safety or direction or parking and other public uses should be combined into appropriate signage kiosks or other coordinated system which will reduce the number and location of such signage in hanover square is encouraged rules of 92475 art  as amended 11277 taxation and special assessments footnotes  1  cross reference taxation pt c  6401 et seq pt l ch 14 article i  in code of  art ii  113  and gen  police administration there is hereby established in the police department of this city a traffic division to be under the control of an officer of police qualified therefor appointed by and directly responsible to the chief of police gen  duty of police department it shall be the duty of the police department to enforce the street traffic ordinances and regulations of this city and all of the state vehicle laws applicable to street traffic in this city to make arrests for traffic violations to investigate accidents and to cooperate with the commissioner of public works and other officers of the city in the administration of the traffic laws and in developing ways and means to improve traffic conditions and to carry out those duties specially imposed upon said division by this ordinance and the traffic ordinances of this city gen  issuance of notice of traffic infractions a whenever any person is found by a police officer committing any traffic infraction other than of speeding contrary to the provisions of this ordinance not causing or contributing to an accident resulting in injury or death to any person or causing property damage such officer shall take the name address and operators license number of such person and the registration number of the motor vehicle involved and issue to him in writing on a form provided by the commissioner of finance a notice to answer to the charge against him during hours and at a place specified in the notice b whenever any person is found by a police officer committing a traffic infraction causing or contributing to an accident resulting in injury or death to any person or causing property damage or committing the traffic infraction of speeding contrary to the provisions of this ordinance or committing any violation of the provisions of the vehicle and traffic law of the state of new york or any other ordinance of the city pertaining to traffic which is expressly declared by such law or ordinance to be a misdemeanor such officer shall issue a summons to such person for the appearance in traffic court at the next session thereof or shall take such person in custody for arraignment in traffic court as the exigencies of the case may require gen  answer traffic infraction notices a a person who has received a notice of a traffic infraction department of police may within the time specified in such notice answer at the traffic violations bureau to the charges set forth therein either in person or by power of attorney by paying a prescribed fine and in writing waiving a hearing in court pleading guilty to the charge and giving a power of attorney to the person in charge of the bureau to make such a plea and pay such a fine in court or a person may answer said notice at said traffic violations bureau by depositing cash bail equal to double the prescribed fine for appearance in court at a time specified by the bureau acceptance of the prescribed fine and power of attorney by the bureau shall be deemed complete satisfaction for the infraction and the violator shall be given a receipt which so states b any person who is charged with speeding contrary to the provisions of this ordinance or who has been guilty of more than three 3 traffic infractions during the current calendar year shall not be permitted to pay any fine at the traffic violations bureau but must appear in court at the time specified by the bureau c plea of not guilty by mail a person who has received a notice of a traffic infraction department of police may enter a plea of not guilty by mail provided he is not charged with a misdemeanor or felony as defined in the new york state vehicle and traffic law such person must attach the traffic ticket to form 254 and mail both form and traffic ticket to traffic court 511 south state street syracuse new york by registered or certified mail return receipt requested within three 3 days after receipt of the ticket upon receipt of the ticket and plea of not guilty the court will advise said person by registered or certified mail return receipt requested of the trial date such trial date shall not be less than seven 7 days after such notice of trial is mailed such person has the right to be represented by counsel at such trial d plea of guilty by mail a person who has received a notice of a traffic infraction department of police may enter a plea of guilty by mail provided he is not charged with a misdemeanor or felony as defined in the new york state vehicle and traffic law no plea by mail may be entered if a person is charged with a second or subsequent speeding offense in eighteen 18 months or with the passing of a stopped school bus the person who wishes to plead guilty by mail must fill out the form on the back of the traffic ticket and mail the ticket with of his operators license to traffic violations bureau 511 south state street syracuse new york gen  liable to arrest on failure to answer traffic violations notice any person to whom a notice of traffic infraction has been personally delivered by a police officer and who fails to appear to answer such notice of traffic infraction shall be subject to arrest upon a warrant issued pursuant to a sworn information or complaint setting forth the specific violation for which said notice of traffic infraction was originally issued gen  police department to investigate accidents it shall be the duty of the police department to investigate traffic accidents and make a full and complete report thereof and to arrest and to assist in the prosecution of those persons charged with violations of law causing or contributing to such accidents gen  traffic accident studies whenever the accidents at any particular location become numerous the police department shall cooperate with the commissioner of public works in conducting studies of such accidents and determining remedial measures gen  traffic accident reports a the police department shall maintain a suitable system of filing traffic accident reports such reports shall be available for the use and information of the commissioner of public works and may be examined by any person having an interest therein or by such persons attorney or agent the police department shall also upon request issue certified copies of reports of accidents for the fee prescribed in section 67a of the public officers law b the police department shall receive and properly file all accident reports made to it under state law or under any ordinance of this city gen  drivers files to be maintained a the police department shall maintain a suitable record of all traffic accidents warnings arrests convictions and complaints reported for each driver which shall be filed alphabetically under the name of the driver concerned b said department shall study the cases of all the drivers charged with frequent or serious violations of the traffic laws or involved in frequent traffic accidents or any serious accident and shall attempt to discover the reasons therefor and shall take whatever steps are lawful and reasonable to prevent the same c such records shall be maintained complete for at least the most recent fiveyear period gen  police department to submit annual traffic safety report the police department shall annually prepare a traffic report which shall be filed with the mayor such report shall contain information on traffic matters in this city as follows 1 the number of traffic accidents the number of persons killed the number of persons injured and other pertinent traffic accident date  2 the number of traffic accidents investigated and other pertinent traffic accident data  3 the plans and recommendations of the division for future traffic safety activities gen  emergency regulations the commissioner of public works in his discretion during the times of emergency or other special conditions and in the have the following functions powers and duties a to accept pleas and to hear and determine charges of parking violations b to provide for penalties other than imprisonment for parking violations in accordance with a schedule of monetary fines and penalties  provided however that monetary penalties shall not exceed the maximum amount allowed by the new york state vehicle and traffic law for each parking violation c to adopt rules and regulations not inconsistent with any applicable provision of law to carry out the purposes of article 2b of the vehicle and traffic law of the state of new york including but not limited to rules and regulations prescribing the internal procedures and organization of the bureau the manner and time of entering pleas the conduct of hearings and the amount and manner of payment of penalties d to issue subpoenas to compel the attendance of persons to give testimony at hearings and to compel the production of relevant books papers and other things e to enter judgments and enforce them without court proceedings in the same manner as the enforcement of money judgments in civil actions in any court of competent jurisdiction or any other place provided for the entry of civil judgment within the state of new york f to compile and maintain complete and accurate records relating to all charges and dispositions and to prepare complete and accurate transcripts of all hearings conducted by the bureau and to furnish such transcripts to the person charged at said persons own expense upon timely request and upon said person complying with the regulations of the bureau g to answer within a reasonable period of time all relevant and reasonable inquiries made by a person charged with a parking violation or their attorney concerning the notice of violation served on that person the bureau must also furnish within a reasonable period of time to the person charged on his request and upon complying with the regulations of the bureau a copy of the original notice of violation including all information contained thereon failure of the bureau to comply with the provisions of this subsection or any part of the provisions of this subsection within fortyfive 45 days of such inquiry forwarded to the bureau by certified or registered mail return receipt requested will result upon the request of the person charged in an automatic dismissal of all charges relating to and only to that notice of violation to which the inquiry was made h to prepare and issue a notice of violation in blank to members of the police department and to such other officers and public servants as the bureau by regulation shall determine the notice of violation or duplicate thereof when filled in and sworn to or affirmed by such designated officers or public servants and served as provided in this article shall constitute notice of the parking violation charged i it shall keep an easily accessible record of all the violations of which each person has been guilty of during the current calendar year j if a violator of a parking rule or regulation does not appear in answer to a notice of parking violation within fifteen 15 days of the date of the violation the parking violations bureau shall send to the owner a second notice informing of the violation and warning him that he will be held responsible as more fully set forth in section 1534 of article iia herein k if the owner or violator does not respond to such second notice of violation the parking violations bureau shall have a third notice mailed to the owner requiring him to appear sustaining the charges the hearing examiner may examine person chargeds the charged persons prior violations record prior to rendering a final determination b final determinations sustaining or shall be an appeals board within the bureau which shall consist of three 3 or more persons duly qualified as hearing examiners excluding from the panel the hearing officer whose decision is the subject of the appeal b an appeal from a determination of any hearing examiner after a hearing on a plea denying liability or from a determination denying a motion to reopen any matter filed in accordance with the rules and regulations of the bureau shall be submitted to the appeals board which shall have the power to review the facts and the law and shall have power to reverse or modify any determination appealed from for error of fact or law c a party aggrieved by a final determination of a hearing examiner may obtain a review thereof by serving either personally in writing or by certified or registered mail return receipt requested upon the bureau within thirty 30 days of the entry of such final determination a notice of appeal setting forth the reasons why the final determination should be reversed or modified upon receipt of such notice of appeal the bureau shall furnish to the appellant at his request and at his own expense a transcript of the original hearing no appeal shall be conducted less than ten 10 days after the mailing of the transcript to the appellant or his attorney when the questions presented by an appeal can be determined without an explanation of all the pleadings and proceedings the appellant may prepare and submit a statement showing how the questions arose and were decided by the hearing examiner and setting forth only so much of the facts averred and proved or sought to be approved as are necessary to a decision of the questions the notice of appeal shall be in such form as the director may prescribe no appeal may be had where a plea of guilty was entered by the person charged at the hearing d appeals shall be conducted in the presence of the appellant or his attorney or both if such right of appearance is expressly requested by the appellant in his notice of appeal and upon his complying with the regulations of the bureau and paying of fee if the appellant elects to appear the bureau within thirty 30 days after the receipt of the notice of appeal shall advise the appellant either personally or by ordinary first class mail of the date and time on which he shall appear no appeal shall be conducted less than ten 10 days after the mailing of such notification the appellant shall be notified in writing of the decision of the appeals board appellant shall provide in writing the address for the mailing of the decision if different from original address on notice e the service of the notice of appeal shall not stay the enforcement of a judgment upon the determination appealed from unless the appellant shall have posted a bond in the amount of such determination at the time of or before the service of such notice of appeal unless the enforcement of such judgment shall have been stayed by the appeals board f the order of the appeals board shall be the final determination of the bureau judicial review may be sought pursuant to article 78 of the civil practice law and rules gen   gen audible signal by horn gong siren or bell 1 the driver of every other vehicle shall yield the rightofway and shall immediately drive to a position parallel to and close as possible to the righthand edge or curb of the roadway or to the edge of a oneway roadway three 3 or more lanes in width clear of any intersection and shall stop and remain in such position until the authorized emergency trafficcontrol signal legend whenever traffic is lawfully regulated by a trafficcontrol signal the following colors shall be used and none other and those colors when lighted shall be obeyed as required by this ordinance and in accordance with their meaning as set forth in this ordinance red shall require that traffic shall stop and remain standing green shall mean that traffic shall move yellow when used shall mean that colors in the signal are about to change and shall require that traffic shall stop and remain standing unless the yellow is lighted too late to allow a stop to be made with safety yellow either fixed or flashing when used in caution signals shall mean proceed with caution red when used in a flashing caution signal shall require that traffic shall stop and the right to proceed shall be subject to the rules applicable after making a stop at a stop sign the foregoing meanings of yellow and red shall not apply to authorized emergency vehicles when on emergency trips provided such vehicles are driven with caution and adequate warning sounded the colors in any such trafficcontrol signal shall be placed and shall show with relation to each other as follows red shall be at the top green shall be at the bottom and yellow when used shall be in the center or if such signal is horizontal red shall be at the left green at the right and yellow when used shall be in the center one exception is made to the above for historical reasons all the intersection of tompkins street milton avenue and burnet park drive in a section of the city known as tipperary hill where the green signal shall be on top and the red signal shall be at the bottom at all intersections where traffic is controlled by trafficcontrol signals movement shall be made on the green only except as otherwise directed by a peace officer vehicular traffic facing a green arrow signal shown alone or in combination with another indication may cautiously enter the intersection only to make the movement indicated by such arrow or such other movement as permitted by other indications shown at the same time such vehicular traffic shall yield the rightofway to pedestrians lawfully within an adjacent crosswalk and to other traffic lawfully using the intersection tc of 3369 art v  5 pedestrian walk and dont walk signals whenever special pedestriancontrol signals exhibiting the words walk or dont walk are in place such signals shall indicate as follows a walk pedestrians facing such signal may proceed across the roadway in the direction of the signal and shall be given the rightofway by the drivers of all vehicles b dont walk no pedestrian shall start to cross the roadway in the direction of such signal but any pedestrian who has partially completed his crossing on the walk signal shall proceed to a sidewalk or safety zone while the dont walk signal is showing tc of 3369 art v  6 display of unauthorized signs signals or markings a no person shall place maintain or display upon or in view of any highway any unauthorized sign signal marking or device which purports to be or is an imitation of or resembles an official trafficcontrol device or railroad sign or signal or which attempts to direct the movement of traffic or which hides from view or interferes with the effectiveness of any official trafficcontrol device or any railroad sign or signal and no person shall place or maintain nor shall any public authority permit upon any highway any traffic sign or signal bearing thereon any commercial advertising this shall not be deemed to prohibit the erection upon private property adjacent to highways of signs giving useful directional information and of a type that cannot be mistaken for official signs b every such prohibited sign signal or marking is hereby declared to be a public nuisance and the chief of police is hereby empowered to remove any such prohibited sign signal or marking or cause it to be removed without notice tc of 3369 art v  7 interference with official trafficcontrol devices or railroad signs or signals no person shall without lawful authority attempt to or in fact alter deface injure knock down or remove any official trafficcontrol device or any railroad sign or signal or any inscription shield or insignia thereon or any other part thereof tc of 3369 art v  8 commissioner of public works to designate crosswalks establish safety zones and mark traffic lanes the commissioner is hereby authorized without formal designation of the common council 1 to designate and maintain by appropriate devices marks or lines upon the surface of the roadway crosswalks at intersections where in his opinion there is particular danger to pedestrians crossing the roadway and at such other places as he may deem necessary  2 to establish safety zones of such kind and character and at such places as he may deem necessary for the protection of pedestrians  3 to mark lanes for traffic on street pavements at such places as he may deem advisable consistent with the traffic ordinances of this city and the laws of the state of new york tc of 3369 art v  9 be printed and distributed the commissioner is authorized to have booklets containing this ordinance printed in sufficient numbers and is further authorized to supply one to each member of the police department members of the bar of onondaga county public officers requiring same without charge and any person requesting copy at a charge to be established by the commissioner tc of 3369 art v  10 secs 1510115115  reserved article vi  speed regulations speed limit signs speed limit signs shall be posted on every main highway entering the city and also on every main highway within the limits of said city where the rate of speed changes strictly in accordance with the provisions of section 1643 of the vehicle and traffic law of the state of new york tc of 3369 art vi  1 drive within speed limit the driver of any vehicle shall not drive or operate such vehicle on any of the public streets of this city at a rate of speed greater than thirty 30 miles per hour except as otherwise provided in the following sections tc of 3369 art vi  2 changes in speed limit on the streets shown in schedule i no driver of any vehicle shall drive or operate such vehicle at a rate of speed greater than that indicated in such schedule for any particular street or part of street tc of 3369 art vi  3 decrease of speed limit at certain intersections the commissioner is authorized after engineering and traffic investigation to designate the safe rate of speed for approaching and crossing intersections where physical or traffic conditions create a hazard to vehicular traffic and to post such speeds at points within one hundred 100 feet of such intersections at every entrance thereto when such intersections are properly posted no driver of any vehicle shall approach or cross such intersections at a rate of speed greater than that shown tc of 3369 art vi  4 duty of driver to reduce speed the driver of every vehicle shall drive at an appropriate reduced speed when approaching and crossing an intersection or railway grade crossing when approaching and going around a curve when approaching a hill crest when traveling upon any narrow and winding roadway and when any special hazard exists with respect to pedestrians or other traffic by reason of weather or highway conditions tc of 3369 art vi  5 secs 1512115135  reserved article vii  turning movements required position and method of turning at intersections the driver of a vehicle intending to turn at any intersection shall do so as follows a the driver of a vehicle turning to the right from the roadway shall approach and turn the corner as near the righthand curb as practicable b the driver of a vehicle intending to turn to the left within an intersection or into an alley private road or driveway shall yield the rightofway to any vehicle approaching from the opposite direction which is within the intersection or so close as to constitute an immediate hazard unless otherwise directed by a police officer tc of 3369 art vii  1 authority to place and obedience to markers a the commissioner is authorized to paint lines place devices markers buttons or signs within between or adjacent to intersections indicating the course to be traveled by vehicles b when authorized markers buttons signs pavement markings or other indications are placed between adjacent to or within an intersection indicating the course to be traveled by vehicles therein no driver of a vehicle shall disobey the directions of such indications tc of 3369 art vii  2 authority to place restricted turn signs the commissioner is hereby authorized to determine those intersections at which drivers of vehicles shall not make a right left or u turn and shall place proper signs at such intersections the making of such turns may be prohibited between certain hours of any day and permitted at other hours in which event the same shall be plainly indicated on the signs or they may be removed when such turns are permitted nothing herein shall be construed to impair existing franchise rights of public bus corporations tc of 3369 art vii  3 obedience to no turn signs whenever authorized signs are erected indicating that no right or left or u turn is permitted no driver of a vehicle shall disobey the directions of any such sign tc of 3369 art vii  4 limitations on turning around the driver of any vehicle shall not turn such vehicle so as to proceed in the opposite direction upon any street in the central traffic district and shall not upon any other street so turn a vehicle unless such movement can be made in safety and without interfering with other traffic tc of 3369 art vii  5 secs 1514115155  reserved article viii  oneway streets and alleys authority to sign oneway streets and alleys whenever any ordinance of this city designates any oneway street or alley the commissioner shall place and maintain signs giving of traffic in the opposite direction is prohibited upon those streets and parts of streets and in those alleys described in schedule ii traffic shall move only in the direction designated tc of 3369 art viii  1 authority to establish lanes for mass transit vehicles a the commissioner may from time to time designate a traffic lane closest to the curb on streets used for transportation of passengers for hire over a defined route or routes in the city of syracuse hereinafter referred to as mass transit vehicles by erecting appropriate signs for the days indicated passenger cars and taxicabs may enter and leave such lane for the sole purpose of taking on or discharging a passenger or passengers but the operator thereof shall for such purpose enter and leave such lane at the nearest point to such loading and unloading point and shall remain within such lane only long enough to so load and unload and provided further that any vehicle may enter such lane within one hundred 100 feet of the approach to an intersection for the sole purpose of making a right turn at such intersection unless such turn is prohibited and so indicated by an official traffic control device  and provided further that no mass transit vehicle except those engaged in express service shall leave such reserved lane except to make a turn or to pass a vehicle which is disabled or illegally blocking passage of such mass transit vehicle b the burden of proof shall be upon the driver of a vehicle other than a mass transit vehicle entering such lane to show that he entered such lane for the purpose of taking on or discharging a passenger or passengers or of making a right turn as the case may be and the burden of proof shall be upon the driver of a mass transit vehicle leaving such lane except one engaged in express service to show that he left such lane for the purpose of making a turn or of passing a vehicle which was disabled or illegally blocking passage of his vehicle c this ordinance shall take effect immediately tc of 3369 art viii  2   secs 1515815170  reserved article ix  special stops required through traffic streets those streets and parts of streets described in schedule iii are hereby declared to be streets tc of 3369 art ix  1 authority to erect traffic signals stop signs flashing signals or yield signs when any ordinance of this city designates and describes a street of such limitations at each entrance to such intersections a authority to designate stop intersections or yield intersections and order signs and signals thereforthe commissioner is hereby authorized to determine and designate by regulation adopted in accordance with this code where particular hazards or conditions exist any street or intersection as a stop intersection or yield intersection it vehicles to stop at stop signs when stop signs are erected as herein provided at or near the entrance to any intersection every driver of a vehicle approaching a stop sign shall stop such vehicle at such sign or at a clearly marked stop line before entering the intersection and after having stopped shall yield the rightofway to any vehicle which has entered the intersection from another highway or which is approaching so closely on said highway as to constitute an immediate hazard during the time when such driver is moving across or within such intersection tc of 3369 art ix  4 emerging from alley or private driveway the driver of a vehicle emerging from an alley driveway or building shall stop such vehicle immediately prior to driving onto a sidewalk or onto the sidewalk area extending across any alleyway yielding the rightofway to any pedestrian as may be necessary to avoid collision and upon entering the roadway shall yield the rightofway to all vehicles approaching on said roadway tc of 3369 art ix  5 stop when traffic obstructed no driver shall enter an intersection or marked crosswalk unless there is sufficient space on the other side of the intersection or crosswalk to accommodate the vehicle he is operating without obstructing the passage of other vehicles or pedestrians notwithstanding any trafficcontrol signal indication to proceed tc of 3369 art ix  6 obedience to signal indicating approach of railroad train a whenever any person driving a vehicle approaches a railroad grade crossing under any of the circumstances stated in this section the driver of such vehicle shall stop not less than fifteen 15 feet from the nearest rail of such railroad and shall not proceed until he can do so safely the foregoing requirements shall apply when 1 a clearly visible electric or mechanical signal device gives warning of the immediate approach of a railroad train  2 a crossing gate is lowered or when a human flagman gives or continues to give a signal of the approach or passage of a railroad train  3 an approaching railroad train is plainly visible and is in hazardous proximity to such crossing b no person shall drive any vehicle around or under any crossing gate or barrier at a railroad grade crossing while such gate or barrier is closed or is being opened or closed tc of 3369 art ix  7 secs 1517815190  reserved article x  miscellaneous driving rules drive on right side all vehicles shall be driven upon the right side of the roadway except a when overtaking and passing another vehicle pedestrian or substantial object in the same traffic lane  b when the right half of the roadway is closed to traffic while under construction or repair  c upon a roadway divided into three 3 marked lanes for traffic under the rules applicable thereon  d upon a roadway designated and signed for oneway traffic tc of 3369 art x  1 overtaking the driver of a vehicle overtaking another vehicle proceeding in same direction shall pass to the left at a safe distance and shall not again drive to the right until safely clear of the overtaken vehicle and it shall be the duty of the driver of the overtaken vehicle to facilitate such passing tc of 3369 art x  2 limitations on passing no vehicle shall be driven to the left side of the center of the road to overtake and pass another vehicle unless such left side is clearly visible and free of oncoming traffic for a sufficient distance ahead to permit such overtaking and passing to be completely made without interfering with the safe operation of any vehicle approaching from the opposite direction or with the overtaken vehicle or vehicles the driver of any vehicle shall not attempt to overtake and pass another vehicle where the drivers view ahead along the roadway is obstructed or where official signs or pavement markings are in place directing traffic to keep right tc of 3369 art x  3 approaching or entering intersection when two 2 vehicles are approaching the intersection from different roadways approximately at the same time the vehicle on the left shall yield the rightofway to the vehicle on the right except where movement is otherwise directed by a police officer trafficcontrol signal or other official device tc of 3369 art x  4 signals to be given before stopping or turning except in case of emergency no driver or operator of a vehicle shall stop or turn such vehicle without giving the proper signal either by a suitable mechanical device or by proper hand signaling performed as follows before making a left turn extend left hand and arm horizontally  before making right turn extend left hand and arm upward  before slowing down or stopping extend left hand and arm downward and show back of whole hand drivers of vehicles pulling from curb to join the flow of traffic must first indicate their intention to do so by extending left arm in the manner required for left turns or by operating an adequate mechanical signal device tc of 3369 art x  5 driving across private or public property prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to drive any motor vehicle upon or across any private or public property for the purpose of evading the provisions of this ordinance relative to traffic signs or signals or other trafficcontrol devices tc of 3369 art x  6 excess load it shall be unlawful for any person hauling trash refuse ashes dirt sand gravel stone coal brick steel shavings or other material to do so in such a manner as to cause material to be scattered over any street or streets of this city tc of 3369 art x  7 unsafe substances in streets no person shall scatter deposit or leave in any street of this city any mud snow debris thing or substance which might tend to make the surface of the street unsafe for vehicular traffic or which might cause damage to other city property if any such mud snow debris thing or substance shall be scattered deposited or left in any street of this city it shall be the duty of the driver and owner of the vehicle depositing scattering or leaving such mud debris thing or substance forthwith to completely remove the same from the street or pavement tc of 3369 art x  7a following fire  9 driving or other procession no driver of a vehicle except authorized emergency vehicles shall drive between the vehicles comprising a funeral or other authorized procession while they are in motion and when such vehicles are conspicuously designated as required in this ordinance this provision shall not apply at intersections where traffic is controlled by trafficcontrol signals or police designated by the police department tc of 3369 art x  12 when permits required for parades no person society or organization of any name or nature shall assemble congregate or march in or of the and shall give adequate warning and shall while backing exercise due vigilance to prevent accident tc of 3369 art x  15 riding on motorcycles a person operating a motorcycle shall not ride other than switching tc of 3369 art xii  1 secs 1524715260  reserved article xiii  pedestrians rights and duties pedestrians subject to trafficcontrol signals at intersections where traffic is controlled only by cross roadway on green or walk signal tc of 3369 art xiii  1 rightofway at crossings the operator of a vehicle shall yield the rightofway to a pedestrian crossing the roadway within any crossing at any intersection except at intersections where the movement of traffic is regulated by a peace officer or trafficcontrol signal this provision shall not relieve the pedestrian from the duty of exercising due care for his safety tc of 3369 art xiii  2 vehicles not to pass at crosswalks whenever any vehicle is stopped at a marked crossing or at any intersection to permit a pedestrian to cross a roadway it shall be unlawful for the operator of any other vehicle approaching from the rear to overtake and pass such stopped vehicle tc of 3369 art xiii  3 yield rightofway every pedestrian crossing a roadway at any point other than within a marked or unmarked crossing shall yield the rightofway to vehicles upon the roadway provided that this provision shall not relieve the driver of a vehicle from the duty of exercising due care for the safety of pedestrians tc of 3369 art xiii  4 vehicles yield rightofway on go signal except as otherwise provided in section 6 section 1596 hereof at intersections where traffic is controlled by trafficcontrol signals or by a peace officer operators of vehicles shall yield the rightofway to pedestrians crossing or those who have started to cross the roadway on a green or go signal and in all other cases pedestrians shall yield rightofway to vehicles lawfully proceeding directly ahead on a green or go signal tc of 3369 art xiii  5 driving zones prohibited no vehicle shall at any time be driven within a safety zone tc of 3369 art xiii  6 secs 1526715280  reserved article xiv  regulations for bicycles footnotes  4  editors note of article xiv of the traffic code was repealed by gen where applicable the regulations set forth in this article shall apply whenever a bicycle is operated upon any street or upon any public path set be granted all of the rights and shall be subject to all of the duties applicable to the driver of a vehicle by the laws of this state declaring rules of the road applicable to vehicles or by the traffic ordinances of this city applicable to the driver of a vehicle except as to special regulations in this article and except those provisions of laws and ordinances which by their nature can have no application tc of 3369 art xiv  2 obedience to trafficcontrol devices a any person operating a bicycle shall obey instructions of official trafficcontrol signals signs and other control devices disobey the directions of any such sign except where such person dismounts from the bicycle to make any such turn in which event such person shall then obey the regulations applicable to pedestrians tc of 3369 art xiv  3 riding on bicycles a a person propelling a bicycle shall not ride other than astride a permanent and regular seat attached thereto b no bicycle shall be used to carry more persons at one time than the number for which it is designed and equipped tc of 3369 art xiv  4 riding on roadways and bicycle paths a every person operating a bicycle upon a roadway shall ride as near to the righthand side of the roadway as practicable exercising due care when passing a standing vehicle or one proceeding in the same direction b persons riding bicycles upon a roadway shall not ride more than two 2 abreast except on the paths or parts of roadways set aside for the exclusive use of bicycles c whenever a usable path for bicycles has been provided adjacent to roadway bicycle riders shall use such path and shall not use the roadway tc of 3369 art xiv  5 carrying articles no person operating a bicycle shall carry any package bundle or article which prevents the rider from keeping at least one hand upon the handle bars tc of 3369 art xiv  6 parking no person shall park a bicycle upon a street other than upon the roadway against the curb or upon the sidewalk in a rack to support the bicycle or against a building or at the curb in such manner as to afford the least obstruction to pedestrian traffic tc of 3369 art xiv  7 riding on sidewalks no person shall ride a bicycle upon a sidewalk within the central traffic district tc of 3369 art xiv  8 equipment of bicycles a every bicycle when in use during the period from onehalf hour after sunset to onehalf hour before sunrise shall be equipped with a lamp on the front which shall emit a white light visible from a distance of at least five hundred 500 feet to the front and with a red reflector at least three 3 inches in diameter on the rear and of a type approved by the state commissioner of motor vehicles which shall be visible from all distances from fifty 50 feet to three hundred 300 feet to the rear when directly in front of lawful upper beams of head lamps on a motor vehicle a lamp emitting a red light visible to the rear may be used in addition to the red reflector b no person shall operate a bicycle unless it is equipped with a bell or other device capable of giving a signal audible for a distance of at least one hundred 100 feet except that a bicycle shall not be equipped with nor shall any person use upon a bicycle any siren or whistle c every bicycle shall be equipped with a brake which will enable the operator to make the braked wheels skid on dry level clean pavement tc of 3369
