this chapter is derived the article headings herein are headings within the rules from which this chapter is derived cross reference water pt o  182 et seq  collection of water rents pt l  114  water supply and water department pt s ch 20 article i  general conditions and restrictions rulescontract the following rules and regulations are adopted by the common council of the city of syracuse  and every person who shall be supplied or whose property shall be supplied with water by the city automatically subscribes to said rules  and the same shall constitute a part of the contract between such person and the city of syracuse wherever the word consumer shall be used in these rules and regulations it shall mean the owner of the premises art 1 4974  gen   gen  work to be done by certain parties all work in connection with the water supply furnished by the city shall be done by city employees charged with such duties  or a plumber licensed by the county of onondaga  or in the case of commercial concerns work on property of such concerns may be done by competent plumbers or steamfitters in their regular employ contractors may do work in connection with the water system of the city under the supervision of the city engineer or his authorized agent fire services from the curb to the check valve in the building or pits may be installed by licensed plumbers  or by sprinkler contractors  or by other water works contractors whose qualifications and experience are satisfactory to the city engineer the work herein described shall terminate at the water meter on domestic commercial or industrial services and at the check valve in buildings or pits on fire services all work should be in accordance with plumbing standards of the new york state building construction no 23 or the current latest edition thereof and local interpretations of same art 2 4974 permits no person except a regular employee of the division of water department of engineering shall make any attachment to or connection with the pipes of the water system of the city from said water system to the water meter on domestic commercial or industrial services  or to the check valve in the building or pits on fire services or lay any service pipe connected therewith  or remove or tamper with any meter check valve etc except that a licensed plumber may install or remove a meter whenever said licensed plumber turns a water service on or off removes or installs a water meter he must report the corresponding meter reading to the bureau of water department of finance when he performs any one of the above operations art 3 4974 permits not transferable no licensed plumber shall allow his name to be used by any other person or party either for the purpose of obtaining permits or doing work under his license except an agent of a licensed plumber art 4 4974 agent of owner the plumber including his employees designated and employed by the owner of the premises will be considered the agent of such owner while employed in the prosecution of the work of introducing the water to said premises  and in no sense as the agent of the city nor will the city be responsible for the acts of such plumber including his employees art 5 4974 curb cock or valve keys no plumber shall loan or part with the possession of a key made for the purpose of operating cityowned curb cocks or valves to persons not authorized to perform such work art 6 4974 report of work done all licensed plumbers or authorized persons having a permit to do work in connection with the water system of the city shall notify officials of the water division within fortyeight 48 hours after completing the work art 7 4974 opening of curb cocks the curb cock controlling any service shall not be opened or left open by the plumber after connecting said service at the curb or elsewhere or after making any new extension or attachment in unoccupied premises so that the water may be supplied to said premises by said service without formal permit from the city notwithstanding the provisions of this article no plumber shall operate a cityowned curb cock or valve larger than one inch in size the city will operate such curb cocks and valves for the plumber at his request art 8 4974 injury to pipe or fixtures any contractor or party doing construction work or repair work in city streets such as sewers drains conduits grading paving etc who may cause injury to any part of the water system such as mains services valves valve boxes hydrants etc will be held liable for all such injuries and for loss of water that may be wasted due to his acts such repairs will be made by the city  and the cost will be charged to the party liable art 9 4974 service pipe main to curb applications for a water service pipe from the street main to the curb must be made in writing at the offices of the bureau of water department of finance after prior approval by the division of water department of engineering  and in addition in the case of a new building a building permit must first be obtained the city reserves the right to require a plumber or other special agent of the owner to accompany his application with written evidence by the owner that he is authorized to do this particular job when the service is to be larger than two 2 inches a sketch of the proposed service showing location and type of use to be supplied must be filed with the city engineer and approved by him before application will be taken art 10 4974 existing services to be used existing services to the curb both fire and domestic where adequate in the opinion of the city engineer are to be connected to by the property owner when he makes application for a service to said property all service installations shall be subject to approval of the city engineer or his designated agents as to location size and material if the existing domestic service consists of lead or galvanized piping up to a size of one 1 inch the city will replace the portion of the service from the street main to the curb in kind at no charge upon replacement of the owners portion of the service pipe from the curb cock to the water meter and satisfactory completion of a service permit as specified in article 10 section 1610 if a replacement domestic service is requested for the purpose of changing the size or the location of the service the cost of the installation shall be borne by the owner according to the provisions of articles 12 and 13 sections 1612 and 1613 where two 2 or more contiguous parcels belong to one owner the city will install additional services on one per one hundred 100 feet of frontage on the same street according to the fee schedule outlined in articles 12 and 13 sections 1612 and 1613 any installations not specifically covered by these provisions may be provided upon review and approval of the city engineer  the cost of which as determined by the city engineer shall be borne by the owner art 11 4974     new domestic services the city will provide a water service to each parcel of land fronting on city streets according to the following schedule and the provisions of article 13 section 1613 tap size in inches domestic service fee 1 $ 50000 1 70000 2 70000 4 115000 6 140000 8 160000 10 and over to be done at cost art 12 4974   fee for paving cuts and repairs the following will be charged by the division of water department of engineering and collected by the bureau of water department of finance for site restoration necessitated by domestic or combined firedomestic service installations five hundred dollars $50000 art 13 4974     taps separate tap will be furnished for each lot supplied with water the city will determine the size of the tap to be made in any water main under any application and permit and the size of the service to the curb therefrom the minimum size of a new tap and service will be inch for a onefamily house and one inch for a twofamily house art 14 4974 connections at curb application for permit to connect onto the existing service pipes at the curb must be made by a licensed plumber doing plumbing work on the premises to be supplied with water the application must state the number of dwelling units in the building the number of dwelling units may be verified by employees of the bureau of water department of finance art 15 4974 permit obtained before trench is opened no person shall be allowed to open any trench in the streets or public grounds of the city of syracuse for the purpose of laying any service connection with the water system of the city without first obtaining a street cut permit in writing from the department of public works city of syracuse art 16 4974 kind of pipe no service pipe except cast iron or copper shall be used between the street main to and including the curb stop or the control valve on larger services service pipe larger than two 2 inches will be of cast iron pipe approved plastic pipe may be installed between the curb stop or control valve and the premises provided that the plumber furnishes the transition fitting or adaptor for connecting the plastic pipe to the curb stop or control valve this procedure applies only to new installations grounding the electrical system within the structure shall conform to the national electrical replacement of existing metallic water service pipes with plastic pipe is prohibited because of the problems involved with electrical equipment grounded to water service pipes art 17 4974 cast iron pipe the cast iron pipe and fittings must conform to specifications for same on file in the office of the city engineer art 18 4974 copper pipe the copper pipe and fittings must conform to specifications for same on file in the office of the city engineer art 19 4974 plastic pipe the plastic pipe and fittings must conform to specifications for same on file in the office of the city engineer art 20 4974 responsibility for trench in the opening of a street or public grounds for the introduction of any water service pipe or connection under authority of a permit from the city engineer the owner and plumber will each be held responsible for the trench opened by them whenever any street or public ground is opened for making a connection with any water pipe or laying any water pipe or fixtures public safety and convenience shall be duly regarded and conserved by the construction of such bridges across open trenches as may be regarded to properly accommodate business and to insure safety to the public signal lights barricades railings and all other necessary means of protection against accident shall be provided art 21 4974 method of laying pipe service pipes shall be required to be laid with the invert not less than five 5 feet below the surface of the earth at any point and to be inside of the foundation wall of the building into which the water service is introduced this applies to the established grade it has been fixed a water service may be laid in the same trench with an iron sewer lateral or gas service from the curb cock to the meter providing it be laid on a shelf two 2 feet wide and five 5 feet below the established grade when the trench is deeper than five 5 feet the service pipe must be not less than eighteen 18 inches horizontally from any other service sewer lateral or other underground structure in no case shall the water service pipe be located below the top of any sewer pipe art 22 4974 trench inspected where trenches are opened for the laying of service pipes such trenches shall be inspected by the city after the pipe is laid and before they are backfilled the plumber performing such work shall notify the superintendent of the water division that such pipe is laid and ready for inspection failure to comply with this regulation will necessitate reexcavating the trench for inspection at cost for the violator art 23 4974 service pipe maintenance a the owner of property into which water is introduced by a service pipe shall be required to maintain it in perfect order at his own expense the said service pipe from the curb cock or curb to his premises  and in case such service is not so kept in repair the city may shut of the supply of water until satisfactory repairs are made in such cases where the water supply is terminated by the city a fee of forty dollars $4000 as provided for by article 76 section 16108 hereof will be charged b lead service replacement program replacement of the customer portion of lead services by the city of syracuse water division as authorized by of the laws of the state of new york 1994 and city of syracuse local law no 24 of 199 shall conform to the specific rules and regulations contained within this section  the water division being the department of water pursuant to an amendment of the charter of the city of syracuse 196 as amended 1 program application a the water division will accept applications on a continuous basis for admission to this program residential property owners who wish to replace their portion of the lead water service from the curb box to the water meter shall submit an application residents may obtain application forms by contacting the water division residential lead water services are the only services covered by this program replacement of all services will be with a copper service of the proper size and materials as specified in the onondaga county health the city of syracuse water rules and regulations applications may be picked up at 101 north beech street homeowners may also call the water division 4732609 and have the application mailed the number of applications accepted each year shall be designated by the commissioner of water the number of applications acted upon shall be limited by the amount of funding appropriated to the program by the common council b all applications shall be submitted with a nonrefundable application fee in the amount of fifty dollars $5000 payable to the bureau of water this fifty dollar $5000 fee shall be credited towards the one hundred fifty dollar $15000 administrative fee which is authorized by local law no 241995 the one hundred fifty dollar $15000 administrative fee may be amortized over ten 10 years on the homeowners tax bill senior citizens who currently receive a property tax exemption shall have the fifty dollar $5000 application fee waived applications will be accepted on a first come first serve basis the commissioner of water shall determine after considering the best interests of the program the order in which these applications shall be acted upon 2 verification a homeowners should verify that they have a lead water service before applying if necessary a water division employee will inspect and verify the presence of the lead service before the application is accepted homeowners may call the water engineering division 4732609 to schedule an inspection 3 construction and contract administration a the administration of the residential lead water service replacement program will be under the direction of the commissioner of water the number of services replaced annually will be determined by the commissioner of water the work shall be performed by the city of syracuse water division or by qualified contractors designated by the commissioner of water b property owners are required to provide the city and its designated agents permission to enter the property before and during construction restoration of all landscaping and surfaces including but not limited to lawns trees bushes shrubs flowering plants sidewalks driveways or portion thereof etc necessitated by excavation and conditions required for the replacement of the water service lines will be the sole responsibility of the property owner c the cost of the homeowners portion of the lead water service replacement program including the one hundred fifty dollar $15000 administrative fee or portion thereof can be financed by the city of syracuse pursuant to the provisions of local law no 24 of 1994 this cost shall be assessed in full against the property owner in the manner described in subsection 4 of these regulations the homeowner shall have the option of paying the total cost of the replacement in one lump sum 4 payment process a the homeowner shall be provided with an estimated range of the replacement cost before the contract between the homeowner and the city is executed if the contract price exceeds the upper level of this estimated cost the homeowner shall be allowed to withdraw from the program application withdrawal requests must be made in writing to the syracuse water division b completion of construction will be based upon the satisfactory performance of all items specified within the lead water service replacement contract determination of completed construction will be made by the commissioner of water upon determination of completed construction the commissioner shall certify the cost of the replacement to the commissioner of assessment the commissioner of assessment will assess the total cost of the construction against the subject property a certified copy of the assessment shall be filed with the commissioner of finance c the homeowner may repay the cost of the lead water service replacement in one lump sum the homeowner shall make such lump sum payment before april 1 of each calendar year the homeowner may choose to repay the cost 10 equal installments on the propertys annual city tax bill the cost of the one hundred fifty dollar $15000 administrative fee may be included in these ten 10 equal installment the installment payment shall be indicated on the first quarters tax bill and shall be due in full on july 31 of each city fiscal year each installment payment shall consist of onetenth of the total cost of the lead water service replacement including the one hundred fifty dollar $15000 administrative fee plus interest on all sums unpaid the interest rate shall be seven 7 percent the unpaid balance will be submitted by the commissioner of finance to the commissioner of assessment the unpaid portion of the annual installments will be collected at the same time and as part of the general city tax d the homeowner shall be required to execute documentation to define the legal status of his property and repayment terms before commencement of construction to participate in the program the homeowner is required to be current on all real property taxes and special assessments special and local levies and the water bill or to have entered into a tax trust agreement and to be current on the same art 24 4974   fire services services may be installed for fire protection purposes the city reserves the right to limit the size of a pipe used depending on local conditions  as to the size of the main in the street length of the proposed service in feet quantity of water available and pressure applications for a permit to install a fire service accompanied by a plan of the proposed piping system must be submitted to the city engineer for approval after prior review by the fire department and issuance of a building permit no change or additions to existing systems shall be made on the street side of the check valve or any part of the system involving antifreeze loops without a permit from the city engineer such permit will be issued only when plans of proposed changes have been submitted and approved by the city engineer except in unusual cases where it would be economically impractical to do otherwise separate services for fire and domestic use will be required from main to building or other point of use on private property special combination domestic and fire service shall only be permissible provided that the service is fully metered and that the fire demand does not exceed the maximum meter capacity meters shall be sized by water division personnel according to the domestic demand criteria specified in the onondaga county plumbing the maximum meter capacity as specified by the standard specifications of the city engineer on file building plans shall be provided to the syracuse water division showing all domestic fixtures sprinkler plans shall include sprinkler head flow and pressure requirements and system flow requirements in gallsperminute the number of sprinkler heads in a single sprinkler design area shall not exceed six 6 for combination services combination service installations shall be limited to no larger than twoinch diameter piping and shall conform to the standard specifications for combined fire services of the city engineer on file and new york state cross connection control criteria art 25 4974   cost of installation and maintenance the entire cost of materials installation and maintenance of a fire service from the main to the building or within the limits of the premises shall be borne by the owner of the property supplied all construction and maintenance work between the main and curb shall be done by the city at the expense of the owner but the work between the curb and the property shall be done by the owner failure to make necessary repairs after due notice by the city will result in the water being shut off until the repairs are made art 26 4974 fire service installation fees a uniform charge for the installation of fire services to the curb will be made as follows combined firedomestic service installation fees tap size of inches fire service fee 1 $ 50000 1 70000 2 70000 other fees as specified in article 13 section 1613 may apply fire service installation fees tap size in inches fire service fee 1 $220000 2 230000 4 350000 6 360000 8 380000 10 and over to be done at cost payment will be made in advance at the time of application for the service   annual fee for unmetered fire service commencing on  any such property supplied with an unmetered fire service within the city of syracuse water supply system shall be assessed an annual fire service fee according to the rate schedule below and the provisions of this article annual fire service fee tap size in inches fee 1 $ 7500 2 7500 3 12000 4 installed directly after the service enters the building any service size not indicated in the fee structure shall be assessed service fees according to the fee for the next larger size eg 2inch service shall be assessed at the 3inch rate in the event that the service entrance is obscured it shall be the responsibility of the owner to clear the service for inspection in the event the water    usage of water services no water shall be taken from a fire system except that which is used for tests of the fire system unless said service is metered detected use of water unmetered fire service for other than fire or test purposes shall be billed by the city for the estimated use at regular metered rates a meter shall be installed by the city and placed on any fire service where water is being used for other than fire or test purposes the city engineer may direct the property owner to make plumbing alterations if required to allow for the proper setting of a meter by the city all rules and fees relating to meter installations shall apply if upon investigation by the city it is determined that the unauthorized use of water fire service is deliberate the violator shall be subject to penalties as provided for by section 16107 hereof art 28 4974   check valve on fire services all fire services supplying sprinkler systems or any piping at a higher elevation than the surface of the ground shall be equipped with an approved check valve so placed that it shall be between the main and any pipes branching off the fire service see article 66 section 1698 hereof art 29 4974 check valves on interconnecting services all existing and future interconnecting services both fire and domestic tapped off two 2 different street mains or the same main where a gate valve in the street is located between the services shall be equipped with an approved check valve opening for flows into the consumers property and closing against back flow if the service is metered the check valve shall be placed on the consumers side of the meter and as near to the bypass as is practicable unmetered fire services shall have their check valves at convenient locations  but in any event in such a manner as will prevent back flow service see article 66 section 1698 hereof art 30 4974 responsibility for fire service break the owner of a fire service shall be responsible for any damage that may be caused by a leak or the breaking or bursting of a fire service or its tributary branches unless such damage has been caused fault of the city art 31 4974 inspectors may enter premises intake end of the meter not more than three 3 feet from the wall of the building or meter pit in which the meter is located and not less than one nor more than five 5 feet above the floor the meter is to be installed in an accessible place and conveniently located so that it may readily be read or removed the pipes connected to the discharge end of the meter shall be properly supported so that the removal of the meter does not allow any of the piping to drop or in any way strain or stress the piping system of the building the owner is also responsible for installing maintaining and repairing the shut off valves on both sides of the meter when in the opinion of the city engineer the piping andor shut off valves attached to the meter are deteriorated to such an extent that the process for removing the meter for repairs andor test may result in damage to such piping andor valves the owner shall upon notification by the city engineer andor bureau of water replace the piping andor shut off valves in an approved manner by a licensed plumber as regards such deteriorated shut off valves on the intake side of the meter the owner may opt to have such shut off valve repaired or replaced by authorized city personnel and said repair or replacement to be charged to the owner at cost art 51 4974 method of installation all meters shall be installed so that all the water which enters the service from the main goes meter a shut off valve is to be provided on each side of the meter in the case of one and twofamily dwelling units the installation of a shut off valve on the outlet side of the meter may be waived at the discretion of the city engineer if a structure sets back more than one hundred 100 feet from the property line of the street from which water is being taken or the structure has a slabongrade foundation the meter must be installed as recommended by the city engineer art 52 4974 installation of meters three inches and larger all installations of meters three 3 inches and larger shall be with the intake end of the meter not less than three 3 feet nor more than five 5 feet from the wall of the meter pit or building to which the meter is installed and not less than one nor more than five 5 feet above the floor if the meter does not have a builtin test plug for the purpose of attaching a two 2 inch test meter when necessary the consumer shall also install a two 2 inch tee branch in the main water line between the discharge end of the meter and the nearest valve beyond the meter art 53 4974 large meters to be bypassed all new installation of a three 3 inch meters and larger shall be bypassed and suitable shut off valves installed at the owners expense in the service each side of the meter and on the bypass this shall be done in such a manner that by proper manipulation of the valves the meter can be removed without interrupting the flow service when the meter is in service the bypass shall be closed and sealed by an authorized employee of the city art 54 4974 breaking the bureau of water seals in case it is necessary for a consumer to break any seal affixed by the city to any part of his water system oral notification of this fact must be made within twelve 12 hours to the bureau of water followed by a written notification within fortyeight 48 hours on failure to do this the city reserves the right to order a meter be placed on the bypass or any other line where a sealed branch has been used and to charge at scheduled rates for the estimated water which passed bypass previously art 55 4974 valve and meter chambers where meters valves or other apparatus is installed by the owner in underground pits or chambers such chambers shall be large enough to provide ample room for working on said apparatus  and where feasible must be drained to keep them as dry as possible if draining is impossible the pit or chamber must be pumped out at the owners expense when access is desired by the city art 56 4974 access to meters the owner stoppage leaks or other defects or irregularities of the meter art 57 4974 mandatory installation of remote readers when a meter reader is unable to obtain a meter reading on a particular meter for city art 59 4974 permissible use of hydrant wrenches and reducers no fire hydrant under the jurisdiction of the city of syracuse will be operated without prior issuance of a hydrant permit from the from april 1 to december 1 the wrench and reducer must be returned to the city at the expiration of the time specified on the permit the deposit will be refunded to the user when the wrench and deposit additionally the delinquent user will continue to be charged at the daily scheduled rate plus a twenty 20 percent surcharge per day until the wrench and reducer are returned art 61 4974 fill any swimming pool from a city fire hydrant shall pay a fee of fiftyfive dollars $5500 in advance to the bureau of water department of finance art 74 4974   penalty any person violating any provision of these rules shall be subject to criminal andor civil penalties as detailed herein a criminal penalties any person who shall knowingly and willfully violate or assist in the violation of any provision of these rules and regulations in damaging or tampering with a water meter valve or other equipment used in providing water to a property or in illegally turning on or off water to a property shall be guilty of an offense and upon conviction thereof shall be punishable by a fine of not less than one hundred fifty dollars $15000 or imprisonment for a term not exceeding fifteen 15 days or both for each offense every day of such violation shall be held to constitute a separate offense b civil penalties any person who shall violate or assist in the violation of any provision of these rules and regulations in damaging or tampering with a water meter valve or other equipment used in providing water to a property or in illegally turning on or off water to a property shall be subject to a civil penalty of five hundred dollars $50000 to be collected by the corporation counsel by a civil action every day of such violation shall be held to constitute a separate violation art 75 4974      gen   gen   gen  shut offs a when shut offs are authorized for the infraction of any of its rules the department of water may shut off the water to any property where the owner of said property fails to correct the violation after notice has been provided pursuant to section 16108b violations of the rules shall include but not be limited to nonpayment andor damage or destruction of department of water equipment b notice to be given to owner and known occupants prior to the department of water shutting off the water to the property the department of water shall serve a written notice printed in english and spanish to the owner and known occupants if any residing at the property said notice shall 1 notify the owner and known occupants that water to the property is to be shut off 2 specify the event under which the water is being shut off 3 notify the owner and known occupants of the shut off date 4 notify the owner and known occupants that the owner has fifteen 15 days from the date on the notice to abate the event for which the water is being shut off and thereby avoid shutoff  5 notify the owner and known occupants that they have a right to a hearing to contest the shutoff and that a hearing must be requested by sending a written request to the department of water either by handdelivery or by mail fifteen 15 days prior to the shut off date listed in the notice  6 notify the owner and known occupants that when the water is shut off the property shall be deemed unfit for human habitation by the division of code enforcement  and 7 include the mailing address email address and telephone number for the department of water division of finance and identify a contact person for any inquiries c service of the notice the notice shall be served upon the owner by means of certified mail and regular first class mail with return receipt requested sent to the owners last known address on file with the citys department of water if the last known address on file with the citys department of water for the owner is a post office box then service of the notice upon the owner by regular first class mail shall be sufficient the notice shall be served upon the known occupants of the affected premises by posting a written notice in a conspicuous place upon the property affected and having a copy thereof mailed first class to the known occupants at the property affected d hearing the commissioner of water shall designate a hearing officer who will conduct the hearing and make a decision as to whether the shut off of water at the premises should go forward the hearing officer shall not be an employee of the department of water the hearing shall be scheduled by the hearing officer whenever possible within thirty 30 days of the hearing request written notice of the hearing date shall be provided to the party requesting the hearing and shall also be provided to the owner of the property and any known occupants the hearing officer shall not be bound by the technical rules of evidence and any relevant evidence may be submitted by any party the hearing officer shall have discretion to make decisions on a case by case basis the hearing officer shall issue a written decision the hearing officers decision shall be binding on the commissioner of water said hearing and decision must be finalized prior to the shut off of water at the property by the department of water written notification of the decision shall be given to the party who requested the hearing and shall also be given to the owner of the property and any known occupants the decision shall be sent via regular first class mail within fifteen 15 business days from the hearing date in the event that the decision is to shut off the water at the property the written decision shall provide a date when the department of water will shut off the water at the property e execution of shut off the department of water may shut off the water to any property where the owner failed to correct the violation and no hearing was requested either by the owner or any known occupants after suitable notice has been served where a timely written request for a hearing has been received the department of water may only shut off the water at the premises after the hearing has been held and a written decision has been made upholding the basis for the water shutoff in such cases where an event is not abated and the water is shut off a fee of one hundred forty dollars $14000 will be charged to the owner to turn the water supply back on at the property in situations where the owner has failed to abate the violation of nonpayment of the water bill an occupant may pay the outstanding water bill for the property and any associated fees including but not limited to the restoration of service fee if they choose to do so the register receipt for the payment shall note the name of the person making the payment it shall then be the responsibility of the occupant to take any necessary action to recoup the payment from the owner of the property in accordance with a of the new york state real property law payment of the bill by the occupant does not relieve the owner of their responsibility for future payments f turning water back on in any case where there has been a shut off of water at a property the department of water shall restore water service for the owner or lawful occupants of the property only when the event which is the basis for the shut off no longer exists and the fee set forth in section 16108e has been paid g delay in shutoffs execution of water shut offs to properties shall be rescheduled where the heat index on the scheduled shut off date is forecasted to be ninety 90 degrees or higher art 76 4974      gen   gen   gen  comparative table vehicle sales business overlay district cx2 connective corridor cx3 revised 0511 1 part a general intent and purpose it is the intent of this pursuant to of the charter of the city of syracuse  1960 adopted by local law #13 of 196 to establish in the public interest and in order to promote the health of the public and the safety and welfare of the inhabitants of the city of syracuse restraints on individual discretion by creating certain zoning districts which contain rules regulations restrictions and prohibitions concerning the location construction alteration and use of buildings structures and land in the city of syracuse such districts and the zoning plan and map shall determine by classes and subclasses the uses which will be permitted and excluded  the height and bulk of buildings and structures to be erected  the density of population  the area of lot coverage and for yards  distances of buildings and structures from other buildings structures and lot lines  open spaces offstreet parking loading and unloading requirements  and the like it shall further be the purpose of this based upon the objectives set forth in the city of syracuse general plan to lessen congestion in the streets  to secure safety from fire and other hazards  to prevent the overcrowding of land  to avoid undue concentrations of population  to provide adequate light air open space and privacy  and to facilitate the adequate provision of transportation water sewerage schools parks and other public requirements such regulations shall be proposed with reasonable consideration among other things as to the character of the district and its suitability for particular uses and with a view to conserving the value of land and buildings and encouraging the most appropriate use of land throughout the city of syracuse 1 part a ordinance zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse i r spencer steele duly appointed commissioner of planning of and for the city of syracuse acting in accordance with of the charter of the city of syracuse  1960 adopted by local law #13 of 196 and in agreement with the advice of the advisory commission on city planning do this 24th day of july 196 adopt the following resolution whereas the city planning commission of the city of syracuse pursuant to the provisions of of the laws of 1920 of the state of new york as amended divided said city into districts as shown upon the zoning plan and map made by said commission dated  and filed in the office of the city engineer of said city on the 30th day of january 192 and the city planning commission thereafter from time to time by and with the consent of the common council amended or modified said districts as shown upon said zoning plan and map  and whereas the city planning commission pursuant to the provisions of of the laws of 1920 of the state of new york as amended and the the city of syracuse  1935 being local law no 7 of the city of syracuse 193 as amended prepared or caused to be prepared by the city engineer an amended plan and map designated amended zoning plan and map of the city of syracuse new york and further described as an amended zoning plan and map of the city of syracuse which is amendatory of the zoning plan and map of the city of syracuse dated  as amended which said amended zoning plan and map of the city of syracuse new york is dated   and whereas said city planning commission heretofore adopted the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse which contained the regulations prohibitions and restrictions concerning the buildings structures and uses allowed and permitted in said districts and in said districts as amended  and whereas local law no 11 of the city of syracuse  195 amended of the charter of the city of syracuse  1935 adopted by local law no 7 of 195 as amended abolished the city planning commission provided for a department of city planning for the city of syracuse headed by a commissioner of planning enumerated the powers and duties of said commissioner of planning and created an advisory commission on city planning whose general function is to advise the commissioner of planning in matters over which he has jurisdiction  and whereas local law no 13 of the city of syracuse 1960 further enumerated the powers functions and duties of the commissioner of planning and the advisory commission on city planning  and aii1 2 whereas the commissioner of planning and the advisory commission on city planning have reviewed and recommend a proposed revision and recodification of the entire zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse as amended in order to clarify the existing zones rules and regulations as amended and to facilitate the use of said zoning rules and regulations and for this reason it is necessary to amend the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse as amended in its entirety  and whereas the said proposed revision and recodification of the zoning rules and regulations as amended retains the existing zoning districts and maps as amended as heretofore adopted and made a part of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse as amended  and whereas all changes in content in the proposed revision and recodification of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse as amended have been advertised in the local newspaper on  and have been explained and reviewed at a public hearing on   and whereas the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse as amended are presently designated as 5 of the existing building the city of syracuse and the commissioner of planning and the advisory commission on city planning have recommended that in the interests of clarity the revised rules and regulations remain so designated  and whereas the commissioner of planning and the advisory commission on city planning recommend that the proposed revision and recodification of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse as amended take effect on   and whereas the commissioner of planning and the advisory commission on city planning have further recommended that all resolutions heretofore adopted or adopted on or before  pursuant to the existing rules and regulations of the city of syracuse as amended shall remain in full force and effect and shall require no further action by the commissioner of planning andor the advisory commission on city planning  now therefore be it resolved that i r spencer steele commissioner of planning of and for the city of syracuse with the agreement of the advisory commission on city planning do hereby amend the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse as amended by adding statements of general purposes and intent to various sections and by making further amendments to various sections of said zoning ordinance which amendments are set forth in their entirety in exhibit a hereto attached and made a part hereof  and be it further resolved that i r spencer steele commissioner of planning of and for the city of syracuse in agreement with the advice of the advisory commission on city planning do hereby amend in its entirety the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse as amended by recodifying the text of said ordinance into various parts sections and articles as set forth in a copy of said recodified ordinance on file in the office of the commissioner of planning and the office of the city clerk  and aii1 3 be it further resolved that i r spencer steele commissioner of planning of and for the city of syracuse in zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse  and be it further resolved that this resolution is subject to the approval and consent of the common council of the city of syracuse 1 part a ordinance saving clause this not be construed as superseding limiting changing or suspending any law ordinance code or regulation affecting the safety construction or sanitation of any building or structure 1 part a ordinance revisions and legal authority the city planning commission may from timetotime by and with the consent of the common council amend supplement or change said amended zoning plan and map of the city of syracuse new york and the rules and regulations restrictions prohibitions or districts herein established or continued if any section article paragraph subdivision clause or provision of these rules regulations restrictions prohibitions or districts shall by a court of competent jurisdiction be adjudged invalid such adjudication shall apply only to such article section paragraph district subdivision clause or provisions so adjudicated the city planning commission shall file a copy of said amended zoning plan and map of the city of syracuse new york and any supplements thereto or amendments thereof with the division of buildings and property rehabilitation and in such other office as may now or hereafter be required by law the commission may in its discretion also file a copy thereof in such other office as it shall deem advisable and in the interests of the public 1 part a ordinance penalties and enforcement 1 penalties any person or corporation that violates or aids or assists in violating this ordinance or any of the rules regulations prohibitions or restrictions herein set forth other than 1 4 or 6b relating to front yard parking shall be fined not more than one hundred fifty dollars $15000 for each such offense 2 enforcement the provisions of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse as amended shall be enforced by the division of except that activities restricted by paragraph 14 and paragraph 16b shall be enforced by the department of police as set forth herein 3 issuance of citation a whenever any person is found by a police officer committing a violation of paragraph 1 subparagraphs 4 or 6b of this ordinance such officer shall issue to such person in writing on a form provided by the department of police a notice to answer to the charge against him within three 3 days during hours and at a place specified in the citation b whenever any vehicle without an operator is found by a police officer to be stopped standing or parked in such manner as to constitute a violation of paragraph 1 subparagraphs 4 or 6b of this ordinance such officer shall take any information displayed on the vehicle which may tend to identify its users and if a motor vehicle or motorcycle the registration number thereof and affix conspicuously to such vehicle a notice in writing on a form provided by a plea and pay such a fine in court or a person may answer said citation at said traffic violations bureau by depositing cash bail equal to double the prescribed fine for appearance in court at a time by registered or certified mail return receipt requested within three 3 days after receipt of the citation c upon receipt of the citation and plea of not guilty the court will advise said person by violations bureau 511 s state street syracuse ny 5 liability for arrest for failure to answer citation a any person to whom a citation has been personally delivered by a police officer and who fails originally issued b if the police officer has issued a citation by affixing such citation to the offending vehicle and the owner does not appear in answer to the citation the traffic violations bureau appeals 1 creation and membership there is hereby established in and for the city of syracuse a board of zoning appeals such board shall consist of seven 7 members appointed by the mayor the term of office of each member except as herein provided shall be for three 3 years dating from july first of each year provided however that two 2 of the members first appointed under the provisions hereof shall be appointed for a term of office of one 1 year two 2 members for a term of office of two 2 years and one 1 member for a term of three 3 years the director of planning shall be exofficio a member of the board of appeals and shall act as its secretary and shall not be entitled to vote as a member thereof an appointment to a vacancy occurring prior to the expiration of term shall be for the remainder of the unexpired term appointive members of the board of appeals shall be paid such salary or compensation for their actual time incurred in the conduct of public hearings as may be fixed and determined by the board of estimate and may be reimbursed for their actual expenses incurred in the performance of their duties if such sums are provided for in the annual budget the corporation counsel shall be and act as the legal advisor of the board of appeals the board of appeals may utilize the staff and facilities of the syracuseonondaga county planning agency and may appoint such additional personnel as shall be authorized by the board of estimate and at such salaries or compensation as fixed by the board of estimate members of the common council and the city planning commission shall be ineligible for appointment to the board of appeals 2 organization and procedure the board of appeals shall elect annually from its membership a chairman and vicechairman and may make adopt promulgate and enforce rules of procedure for the conduct of its meetings consistent with law and the ordinances applicable thereto which shall become effective on the date when the same are filed with the city clerk meetings of the board shall be held not less than once each month except in the month of august and as otherwise modified by the board and at such other times as the board may determine special meetings may be called by the chairman and must be called at the request of any two 2 members of the board of appeals the chairman or in his absence the vicechairman may administer oaths and compel the attendance of witnesses hearings of the board of appeals shall be public the board shall keep minutes of its proceedings and the vote of each member upon each question or if absent or failing to vote indicating such fact and shall keep a record of its inspections and other official action all of which shall be filed promptly with the secretary of the board and which shall be a public record the basis for the determination of each appeal and a brief summary of the facts upon which the determination is made shall be recorded in the decision and shall constitute a part of the record thereof the presence of four 4 members shall constitute a quorum the board of appeals shall act by resolution the concurring vote of four 4 members of the board shall be necessary to reverse any order requirement decision or determination made by an enforcement officer charged with the enforcement of any ordinance code or regulation over which the board has original or appellate jurisdiction now in effect or hereafter conferred upon it by ordinance of the common council and any order requirement decision or determination of the division of buildings and property rehabilitation or to decide in favor of the applicant any matter upon which he is required to determine under any such an ordinance or to grant any variance from the requirements of such an ordinance no member of the board of appeals shall sit in hearing or vote in any case in which he shall be personally or financially interested nor shall he vote on the determination of any appeal unless he shall have attended the public hearing thereon aii5 2 3 duties and powers the board of appeals shall have all the powers and duties prescribed by law and this board of appeals shall hear and decide appeals from and review any order requirement decision or determination made by an administrative officer charged with the enforcement of any zoning ordinance of the city of syracuse now in effect or hereafter adopted or any other ordinance code or regulation over which the board may hereafter be granted original or appellate jurisdiction conferred upon it by ordinance of the common council it shall hear decide grant or deny applications for variances and exceptions as herein provided it shall decide any question involving the interpretation of the zoning ordinances including determination of the exact location of any district boundary if there is uncertainty with respect thereto after a public hearing held upon notice to the owners affected thereby and may make such a determination relative thereto as may in its judgment carry out and apply the intent and purpose of any zoning ordinance of the city of syracuse notwithstanding any contrary provisions contained herein the board of appeals is hereby divested of any authority to waive alter or modify the regulations contained in vii of the zoning rules and regulations of the city of syracuse a appeal how taken any person aggrieved by an order requirement decision or determination made by any administrative officer charged with the enforcement of any zoning ordinance of the city of syracuse now in effect or hereafter adopted or any other ordinance code or regulation over which the board may hereafter be granted original or appellate jurisdiction conferred upon it by ordinance of the common council or any officer board department or bureau of the city affected thereby may take an appeal to the board of appeals such appeal shall be taken within such time as shall be established by the rules of procedure as hereinbefore provided by filing with the secretary of the board a notice of appeal specifying the grounds thereof and payment of the fees hereinafter prescribed such appeals shall be taken upon forms provided by the board the officer from whose determination the appeal is taken shall forthwith transmit to the board of appeals all of the papers constituting the record upon which the action appealed from was taken b stay an appeal shall stay all proceedings in furtherance of the action from which appeal is made unless the officer from whose determination the appeal is taken certifies to the board of appeals after notice of appeal shall have been filed with him that by reason of facts stated in the certificate a stay would in his opinion cause imminent peril to life or property in such cases proceedings shall not be stayed otherwise than by a restraining order which after notice to the officer from whose determination the appeal is taken upon due cause shown may be granted by the board or by the supreme court c fees each appellant or applicant shall pay to the secretary of the board of appeals at the time of filing a notice of appeal as herein prescribed a fee of twenty five dollars $2500 to defray the expenses of the proceedings which shall be received by the secretary of the board and deposited by him with the commissioner of finance aii5 3 d hearings no appeal shall be decided until after due notice has been given and a public hearing has been held thereon due notice of a hearing shall be as follows 1 by publication of a notice thereof once in one 1 official paper of the city at least ten 10 days before the date of hearing 2 the board shall mail notice of the hearing to the appellant or applicant or his attorney or agent at least ten 10 days before date of the hearing 3 the board shall also insofar as practicable mail notices of the hearing of an appeal to all property owners as appears on the latest tax roll of the city within a two hundred 200 foot radius of the premises affected by the appeal such notices shall be mailed to the street address of the properties within the two hundred 200 foot radius regardless of whether or not the owner resides therein unless the board has definite knowledge of other addresses of absentee owners notice of the hearing shall also be sent to the councilor of the district within which the property described in the application is located compliance with this subparagraph  shall not be a condition precedent to proper legal notice and no hearing or action taken thereat shall be deemed invalid or illegal because of any failure to mail the notices provided in this subparagraph upon hearing all parties in interest may appear in person or by agent or attorney the board of appeals shall decide all matters submitted to it within a reasonable time the board of appeals may reverse or affirm wholly or in part or may modify the order requirement decision or determination as in its opinion ought to be made in the premises and to that end shall have all the powers of the officer from whom the appeal is taken the decision of the board shall become final on the date of entry of such order with the secretary of the board of appeals and service of a copy of its decision and notice of filing with the appellant or his attorney or agent e administrative review the board of appeals shall hear and decide appeals from and review any order requirement decision or determination made by the division of buildings and property rehabilitation or other administrative officer charged with the enforcement of any zoning ordinance of the city of syracuse now in effect or hereafter adopted or any other ordinance code or regulation over which the board may hereafter be granted original or appellate jurisdiction conferred upon it by ordinance of the common council f variances upon appeal after due notice and hearing the board of appeals shall have the power to vary or modify the application of any of the regulations or ordinances relating to the use construction structural changes in equipment or alteration of buildings or structures or the use of land so that the spirit of the zoning ordinances now in effect or hereafter adopted or any other ordinance code or regulation over which the board may hereafter be granted original or appellate jurisdiction conferred upon it by ordinance of the common council shall be observed public safety and welfare secured and substantial justice done only upon competent proof that there are practical difficulties or aii5 4 unnecessary hardship in the strict application of the ordinance applicable thereto any relief granted shall be limited to the minimum required to effect substantial justice and shall not materially impair the general purpose of the ordinance applicable thereto in granting any variance the board of appeals shall prescribe any conditions that it deems to be necessary or desirable in every instance of granting a variance of the board of appeals there must be showing that 1 the strict application of the provisions of the zoning result in practical difficulties or unnecessary hardship inconsistent with the general purpose and intent of the zoning the city of syracuse 2 there are exceptional or extraordinary circumstances or conditions applying to the property involved or to the intended use or development of the property that do not apply generally to other properties or uses in the same zoning district or neighborhood 3 the granting of such variance will not be of substantial detriment to the public interest or to the property or improvements in such district in which the variance is sought and will not materially impair the purpose of the zoning ordinances of the city of syracuse g exceptions the board of appeals shall have the power to grant exceptions in the following instances after due notice and public hearing 1 the board may permit the construction of a building on a lot which does not meet the minimum area requirements of this provided that the lot is owned by the applicant and provided further that the ownership was of record prior to the adoption of this amended no such permit shall be granted if the applicant purchased said property after the adoption of this amended or if the applicant is the owner of adjoining vacant property so that he could comply with the requirements of this 2 where a district boundary line divides a lot in single ownership the board may permit a use permitted in the less restricted district to extend into the more restricted portion of the lot for a distance of not more than fifty 50 feet or in the case of a lot running the next street onehalf 12 of the distance from the street front of the lot to the next street 3 the board may permit the erection and use of a building or the use of premises in any district by a public service corporation for public utilities purposes if the board finds that such use is reasonably necessary for the public convenience or welfare and that it will not substantially interfere with the use or character of surrounding property no such building shall be permitted unless it meets the height and yard requirement of the use district in which it is located or to be located and provided that the lot coverage is not more than 35% provided however that electric power transmission lines poles and towers may exceed height limitations this provision does not include antennas communication towers and satellite dish antennas which are subject to of these zoning rules and regulations aii5 5 4 the board may grant a permit for the temporary use of property by a building contractor where such temporary use does not conform with the provisions of this temporary permit shall be granted for a period not to exceed two 2 years 4 review of decisions of board of appeals any person or persons jointly or severally aggrieved by any decision of the board of appeals or any officer department board or bureau of the city may upon proper cause shown review any decision of determination of the board of appeals in the manner prescribed by of the civic practice act amended  typographical correction  1 part a 1 part b central business districts planned developments and far premiums 1 planned developments the term planned development shall be defined as follows a large lot or tract of land of not less than one 1 acre developed or rehabilitated under single ownership of unified control or developed or rehabilitated as an urban renewal or redevelopment project exceptions to the applicable building bulk and yard regulations may be authorized in planned developments and urban renewal projects provided the city planning commission shall find a that such exception shall be solely for the purposes of promoting an integrated site plan no less beneficial to the residents or occupants of such development as well as of neighboring properties than would be obtained under the bulk or yard regulations of this ordinance for buildings developed on separate lots b that the overall floor area ratio of a residential planned development would not exceed by more than 15% the maximum floor area ratio which would be determined on the basis of the floor area required for the individual uses in such planned development c that the maximum lot area per dwelling unit requirements of this not be decreased by more than 15% of any such development containing residential uses and that there would be available to each residential building and immediately adjacent thereto including the land area upon which it is erected the minimum amount of land area required for such building under the intensity of use provisions of this that spacing between principal buildings would be at least equivalent to such spacing as would be required between buildings similarly developed under the terms of this separate lots due consideration being given to the openness normally afforded by intervening streets and alleys 2 floor area ratio far premiums the maximum far permitted in each central business district may be further increased by the premiums specified in each district if any of the following desired characteristics and amenities are provided in cbd development biv8 2 a plaza or interior open space premium to qualify for the premium herein authorized a plaza or interior open space shall be open to the sky completely paved or paved and partially landscaped open to the public for pedestrian movement and have 1 an area of not less than onesixth 16 of the area of the lot or six thousand 6000 square feet whichever is greater or 2 a frontage of fifty 50 feet on at least one 1 street and an area of not less than six thousand 6000 square feet weather protection admitting light and air shall not be considered as being in conflict with the requirements of being open to the sky b street arcade premium to qualify for the premium herein authorized the first story at grade shall be setback from the lot line for the entire frontage of the lot such arcade area shall be completely paved or paved and partially landscaped and shall be unobstructed except for columns or piers required to support the building or roof not less than six 6 feet of arcade depth shall be accessible to the public for pedestrian movement the full premium shall be given for street arcades eighteen 18 feet in depth arcades providing less than six 6 feet of depth for pedestrian movement shall receive no premiums arcades providing between six 6 feet and eighteen 18 feet of depth shall receive 833% of the maximum premium for each foot over six 6 feet in depth if a lot has a frontage on more than one 1 street the premium shall apply to each separate frontage in the degree to which it qualifies c internal arcade premium to qualify for the premium herein authorized an internal arcade shall connect two 2 public streets street arcades or plazas fronting on other streets said arcade shall be a pedestrian way of not less than 1 ten 10 feet in width if completely separated from sales areas and elevator lobbies 2 ten 10 feet in width plus six 6 feet for each side containing sales areas opening directly to the arcade 3 ten 10 feet in width plus ten 10 feet for each side containing elevator entrances opening directly to the arcade biv8 3 d canopy premium to qualify for the premium herein authorized a sidewalk canopy shall extend not less than eight 8 feet from the facade of the building except where restricted by the curb line clearance along the entire frontage of the lot the entire space under the canopy shall be accessible to the public each street frontage shall be considered separately and shall qualify for an additional premium however if canopies are constructed along two 2 intersecting streets on a corner lot the canopy must be continued around the corner to qualify for an additional premium e passengerloading premium to qualify for the premium herein authorized an offstreet passengerloading area shall open directly to a public entrance to the building or to a hallway tunnel or pedestrian way connecting with a public entrance in said building said passengerloading area shall have separate ingress and egress lanes not less than twelve 12 feet in width one 1 loading berth nine 9 feet wide by thirty 30 feet long parallel to the access land shall be provided for each fifty 50 rooms or fraction thereof in a hotel or motel one 1 such space shall be provided for each twenty five thousand 25000 square feet of gross floor space in a building housing a place of public assembly up to a maximum of twenty 20 spaces such passengerloading area and the access to the building shall be open to the public during all hours which the building is open for business f consolidated freightloading premium to qualify for the premium herein authorized three 3 or more uses each requiring loading berths shall be served by a common offstreet loading facility having a capacity equal to or greater than the minimum standards set forth in of this loading facility shall have separate ingress and egress lanes each building so served shall qualify for the premium also any building in an adjoining block which is connected to the common offstreet loading facility by a tunnel may qualify for the premium provided the loading facility has sufficient berths to qualify under for all the buildings served computation of number of berths required shall be on the basis of the total floor area served g public open space premium to qualify for the premium herein authorized a building shall have a front side or rear lot line adjoining a public open space of at least one 1 acre in area and of a depth perpendicular to such lot line of not less than two hundred 200 feet the public open space may district class a 1 purpose and intent the purpose of this district is to provide appropriate areas on or near major routes within the city of syracuse which would permit the development and continued use of lands for compatible retail commercial and light manufacturing uses in promoting the general purpose of this district the specific intent is a to encourage land uses that are characterized by the city amended 586 1 part b institutional districts planned institutional district 1 purpose and intent it is the purpose and intent of this district to permit and encourage the orderly cooperative and flexible development and expansion of institutional land uses it is further the intent of this district a to insure compatible relationships between land use activities  b to insure the compatible orientation of one 1 building to another in regard to building bulk architectural and open space  c to provide for visually pleasing and functional treatment of open areas  d to provide for an efficient and safe circulation system for both pedestrians and vehicles  e to provide adequate parking space for immediate and future needs  f to insure that signs are adequate but properly controlled
